Hebrew: <big>מִ֭</big>שְׁלֵי שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה בֶן־דָּוִ֑ד מֶ֝֗לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The proverbs of Solomon son of David, king of Israel:
Transliteration: <big>mi</big>sheley shelomoh ven-david melekhe yisherael

Hebrew: לָדַ֣עַת חׇכְמָ֣ה וּמוּסָ֑ר לְ֝הָבִ֗ין אִמְרֵ֥י בִינָֽה׃
Translated:
For learning wisdom and discipline;
For understanding words of discernment;
Transliteration: ladaat chׇkhemah umusar lehaviyn imerey viynah

Hebrew: לָ֭קַחַת מוּסַ֣ר הַשְׂכֵּ֑ל צֶ֥דֶק וּ֝מִשְׁפָּ֗ט וּמֵשָׁרִֽים׃
Translated:
For acquiring the discipline for success,
Righteousness, justice, and equity;
Transliteration: lakachat musar hashekhel tsedek umishefat umeshariym

Hebrew: לָתֵ֣ת לִפְתָאיִ֣ם עׇרְמָ֑ה לְ֝נַ֗עַר דַּ֣עַת וּמְזִמָּֽה׃
Translated:
For endowing the simple with shrewdness,
The young with knowledge and foresight.
Transliteration: latet lifetayim ׇremah lenaar daat umezimah

Hebrew: יִשְׁמַ֣ע חָ֭כָם וְי֣וֹסֶף לֶ֑קַח וְ֝נָב֗וֹן תַּחְבֻּל֥וֹת יִקְנֶֽה׃
Translated:
—The wise man, hearing them, will gain more wisdom;
The discerning man will learn to be adroit;
Transliteration: yishema chakham veyvosef lekach venavvon tachevulvot yikeneh

Hebrew: לְהָבִ֣ין מָ֭שָׁל וּמְלִיצָ֑ה דִּבְרֵ֥י חֲ֝כָמִ֗ים וְחִידֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
For understanding proverb and epigram,
The words of the wise and their riddles.
Transliteration: lehaviyn mashal umeliytsah diverey chakhamiym vechiydotam

Hebrew: יִרְאַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה רֵאשִׁ֣ית דָּ֑עַת חׇכְמָ֥ה וּ֝מוּסָ֗ר אֱוִילִ֥ים בָּֽזוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge;
Fools despise wisdom and discipline.
Transliteration: yireat yehovah reshiyt daat chׇkhemah umusar eviyliym vazu {f}

Hebrew: שְׁמַ֣ע בְּ֭נִי מוּסַ֣ר אָבִ֑יךָ וְאַל־תִּ֝טֹּ֗שׁ תּוֹרַ֥ת אִמֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
My son, heed the discipline of your father,
And do not forsake the instruction of your mother;
Transliteration: shema veniy musar aviykha veal-titosh tvorat imekha

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ לִוְיַ֤ת חֵ֓ן הֵ֬ם לְרֹאשֶׁ֑ךָ וַ֝עֲנָקִ֗ים לְגַרְגְּרֹתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
For they are a graceful wreath upon your head,
A necklace about your throat.
Transliteration: khiy liveyat chen hem leroshekha vaanakiym legaregerotekha

Hebrew: בְּנִ֡י אִם־יְפַתּ֥וּךָ חַ֝טָּאִ֗ים אַל־תֹּבֵֽא׃
Translated: My son, if sinners entice you, do not yield;
Transliteration: veniy im-yefatukha chataiym al-tove

Hebrew: אִם־יֹאמְרוּ֮ לְכָ֢ה אִ֫תָּ֥נוּ נֶאֶרְבָ֥ה לְדָ֑ם נִצְפְּנָ֖ה לְנָקִ֣י חִנָּֽם׃
Translated:
If they say, “Come with us,
Let us set an ambush to shed blood,
Let us lie in wait for the innocent
(Without cause!)
Transliteration: im-yomeru lekha֢h itanu neerevah ledam nitsefenah lenakiy chinam

Hebrew: נִ֭בְלָעֵם כִּשְׁא֣וֹל חַיִּ֑ים וּ֝תְמִימִ֗ים כְּי֣וֹרְדֵי בֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Like Sheol, let us swallow them alive;
Whole, like those who go down into the Pit.
Transliteration: nivelaem khishevol chayiym utemiymiym kheyvoredey vvor

Hebrew: כׇּל־ה֣וֹן יָקָ֣ר נִמְצָ֑א נְמַלֵּ֖א בָתֵּ֣ינוּ שָׁלָֽל׃
Translated:
We shall obtain every precious treasure;
We shall fill our homes with loot.
Transliteration: khׇl-hvon yakar nimetsa nemale vateynu shalal

Hebrew: גּ֭וֹרָ֣לְךָ תַּפִּ֣יל בְּתוֹכֵ֑נוּ כִּ֥יס אֶ֝חָ֗ד יִהְיֶ֥ה לְכֻלָּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Throw in your lot with us;
We shall all have a common purse.”
Transliteration: gvoralekha tafiyl vetvokhenu khiys echad yiheyeh lekhulanu

Hebrew: בְּנִ֗י אַל־תֵּלֵ֣ךְ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ אִתָּ֑ם מְנַ֥ע רַ֝גְלְךָ֗ מִנְּתִיבָתָֽם׃
Translated:
My son, do not set out with them;
Keep your feet from their path.
Transliteration: veniy al-telekhe vederekhe itam mena ragelekha minetiyvatam

Hebrew: כִּ֣י רַ֭גְלֵיהֶם לָרַ֣ע יָר֑וּצוּ וִ֝ימַהֲר֗וּ לִשְׁפׇּךְ־דָּֽם׃
Translated:
For their feet run to evil;
They hurry to shed blood.
Transliteration: khiy rageleyhem lara yarutsu viymaharu lishefׇkhe-dam

Hebrew: כִּֽי־חִ֭נָּם מְזֹרָ֣ה הָרָ֑שֶׁת בְּ֝עֵינֵ֗י כׇּל־בַּ֥עַל כָּנָֽף׃
Translated:
In the eyes of every winged creature
The outspread net means nothing.
Transliteration: khiy-chinam mezorah harashet veeyney khׇl-vaal khanaf

Hebrew: וְ֭הֵם לְדָמָ֣ם יֶאֱרֹ֑בוּ יִ֝צְפְּנ֗וּ לְנַפְשֹׁתָֽם׃
Translated:
But they lie in ambush for their own blood;
They lie in wait for their own lives.
Transliteration: vehem ledamam yeerovu yitsefenu lenafeshotam

Hebrew: כֵּ֗ן אׇ֭רְחוֹת כׇּל־בֹּ֣צֵֽעַ בָּ֑צַע אֶת־נֶ֖פֶשׁ בְּעָלָ֣יו יִקָּֽח׃ {פ}
Translated:
Such is the fate of all who pursue unjust gain;
It takes the life of its possessor.
Transliteration: khen ׇrechvot khׇl-votsea vatsa et-nefesh vealayv yikach {f}

Hebrew: חׇ֭כְמוֹת בַּח֣וּץ תָּרֹ֑נָּה בָּ֝רְחֹב֗וֹת תִּתֵּ֥ן קוֹלָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Wisdom cries aloud in the streets,
Raises her voice in the squares.
Transliteration: chׇkhemvot vachuts taronah varechovvot titen kvolah

Hebrew: בְּרֹ֥אשׁ הֹמִיּ֗וֹת תִּ֫קְרָ֥א בְּפִתְחֵ֖י שְׁעָרִ֥ים בָּעִ֗יר אֲמָרֶ֥יהָ תֹאמֵֽר׃
Translated:
At the head of the busy streets she calls;
At the entrance of the gates, in the city, she speaks out:
Transliteration: verosh homiyyvot tikera vefitechey sheariym vaiyr amareyha tomer

Hebrew: עַד־מָתַ֣י ׀ פְּתָיִם֮ תְּֽאֵהֲב֫וּ־פֶ֥תִי וְלֵצִ֗ים לָ֭צוֹן חָמְד֣וּ לָהֶ֑ם וּ֝כְסִילִ֗ים יִשְׂנְאוּ־דָֽעַת׃
Translated:
“How long will you simple ones love simplicity,
You scoffers be eager to scoff,
You dullards hate knowledge?
Transliteration: ad-matay fetayim teehavu-fetiy veletsiym latsvon chamedu lahem ukhesiyliym yisheneu-daat

Hebrew: תָּשׁ֗וּבוּ לְֽת֫וֹכַחְתִּ֥י הִנֵּ֤ה אַבִּ֣יעָה לָכֶ֣ם רוּחִ֑י אוֹדִ֖יעָה דְבָרַ֣י אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated:
You are indifferent to my rebuke;
I will now speak my mind to you,
And let you know my thoughts.
Transliteration: tashuvu letvokhachetiy hineh aviyah lakhem ruchiy vodiyah devaray etekhem

Hebrew: יַ֣עַן קָ֭רָאתִי וַתְּמָאֵ֑נוּ נָטִ֥יתִי יָ֝דִ֗י וְאֵ֣ין מַקְשִֽׁיב׃
Translated:
Since you refused me when I called,
And paid no heed when I extended my hand,
Transliteration: yaan karatiy vatemaenu natiytiy yadiy veeyn makeshiyv

Hebrew: וַתִּפְרְע֥וּ כׇל־עֲצָתִ֑י וְ֝תוֹכַחְתִּ֗י לֹ֣א אֲבִיתֶֽם׃
Translated:
You spurned all my advice,
And would not hear my rebuke,
Transliteration: vatifereu khׇl-atsatiy vetvokhachetiy lo aviytem

Hebrew: גַּם־אֲ֭נִי בְּאֵידְכֶ֣ם אֶשְׂחָ֑ק אֶ֝לְעַ֗ג בְּבֹ֣א פַחְדְּכֶֽם׃
Translated:
I will laugh at your calamity,
And mock when terror comes upon you,
Transliteration: gam-aniy veeydekhem eshechak eleag vevo fachedekhem

Hebrew: בְּבֹ֤א (כשאוה) [כְשׁוֹאָ֨ה ׀] פַּחְדְּכֶ֗ם וְֽ֭אֵידְכֶם כְּסוּפָ֣ה יֶאֱתֶ֑ה בְּבֹ֥א עֲ֝לֵיכֶ֗ם צָרָ֥ה וְצוּקָֽה׃
Translated:
When terror comes like a disaster,
And calamity arrives like a whirlwind,
When trouble and distress come upon you.
Transliteration: vevo (khshvh) [kheshvoah ] fachedekhem veeydekhem khesufah yeeteh vevo aleykhem tsarah vetsukah

Hebrew: אָ֣ז יִ֭קְרָאֻנְנִי וְלֹ֣א אֶעֱנֶ֑ה יְ֝שַׁחֲרֻ֗נְנִי וְלֹ֣א יִמְצָאֻֽנְנִי׃
Translated:
Then they shall call me but I will not answer;
They shall seek me but not find me.
Transliteration: az yikerauneniy velo eeneh yeshacharuneniy velo yimetsauneniy

Hebrew: תַּ֭חַת כִּֽי־שָׂ֣נְאוּ דָ֑עַת וְיִרְאַ֥ת יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה לֹ֣א בָחָֽרוּ׃
Translated:
Because they hated knowledge,
And did not choose fear of the LORD;
Transliteration: tachat khiy-shaneu daat veyireat yehovah lo vacharu

Hebrew: לֹא־אָב֥וּ לַעֲצָתִ֑י נָ֝אֲצ֗וּ כׇּל־תּוֹכַחְתִּֽי׃
Translated:
They refused my advice,
And disdained all my rebukes,
Transliteration: lo-avu laatsatiy naatsu khׇl-tvokhachetiy

Hebrew: וְֽ֭יֹאכְלוּ מִפְּרִ֣י דַרְכָּ֑ם וּֽמִמֹּעֲצֹ֖תֵיהֶ֣ם יִשְׂבָּֽעוּ׃
Translated:
They shall eat the fruit of their ways,
And have their fill of their own counsels.
Transliteration: veyokhelu miferiy darekham umimoatsoteyhem yishevau

Hebrew: כִּ֤י מְשׁוּבַ֣ת פְּתָיִ֣ם תַּהַרְגֵ֑ם וְשַׁלְוַ֖ת כְּסִילִ֣ים תְּאַבְּדֵֽם׃
Translated:
The tranquillity of the simple will kill them,
And the complacency of dullards will destroy them.
Transliteration: khiy meshuvat fetayim taharegem veshalevat khesiyliym teavedem

Hebrew: וְשֹׁמֵ֣עַֽ לִ֭י יִשְׁכׇּן־בֶּ֑טַח וְ֝שַׁאֲנַ֗ן מִפַּ֥חַד רָעָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
But he who listens to me will dwell in safety,
Untroubled by the terror of misfortune.”
Transliteration: veshomea liy yishekhׇn-vetach veshaanan mifachad raah {f}

Hebrew: בְּ֭נִי אִם־תִּקַּ֣ח אֲמָרָ֑י וּ֝מִצְוֺתַ֗י תִּצְפֹּ֥ן אִתָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
My son, if you accept my words
And treasure up my commandments;
Transliteration: veniy im-tikach amaray umitsevotay titsefon itakhe

Hebrew: לְהַקְשִׁ֣יב לַחׇכְמָ֣ה אׇזְנֶ֑ךָ תַּטֶּ֥ה לִ֝בְּךָ֗ לַתְּבוּנָֽה׃
Translated:
If you make your ear attentive to wisdom
And your mind open to discernment;
Transliteration: lehakeshiyv lachׇkhemah ׇzenekha tateh livekha latevunah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אִ֣ם לַבִּינָ֣ה תִקְרָ֑א לַ֝תְּבוּנָ֗ה תִּתֵּ֥ן קוֹלֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
If you call to understanding
And cry aloud to discernment,
Transliteration: khiy im laviynah tikera latevunah titen kvolekha

Hebrew: אִם־תְּבַקְשֶׁ֥נָּה כַכָּ֑סֶף וְֽכַמַּטְמוֹנִ֥ים תַּחְפְּשֶֽׂנָּה׃
Translated:
If you seek it as you do silver
And search for it as for treasures,
Transliteration: im-tevakeshenah khakhasef vekhamatemvoniym tachefeshenah

Hebrew: אָ֗ז תָּ֭בִין יִרְאַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וְדַ֖עַת אֱלֹהִ֣ים תִּמְצָֽא׃
Translated:
Then you will understand the fear of the LORD
And attain knowledge of God.
Transliteration: az taviyn yireat yehovah vedaat Elohim timetsa

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יְ֭הֹוָה יִתֵּ֣ן חׇכְמָ֑ה מִ֝פִּ֗יו דַּ֣עַת וּתְבוּנָֽה׃
Translated:
For the LORD grants wisdom;
Knowledge and discernment are by His decree.
Transliteration: khiy-yehovah yiten chׇkhemah mifiyv daat utevunah

Hebrew: (וצפן) [יִצְפֹּ֣ן] לַ֭יְשָׁרִים תּוּשִׁיָּ֑ה מָ֝גֵ֗ן לְהֹ֣לְכֵי תֹֽם׃
Translated:
He reserves ability for the upright
And is a shield for those who live blamelessly,
Transliteration: (vtsfn) [yitsefon] layeshariym tushiyah magen leholekhey tom

Hebrew: לִ֭נְצֹר אׇרְח֣וֹת מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וְדֶ֖רֶךְ חֲסִידָ֣ו יִשְׁמֹֽר׃
Translated:
Guarding the paths of justice,
Protecting the way of those loyal to Him.
Transliteration: linetsor ׇrechvot mishefat vederekhe chasiydav yishemor

Hebrew: אָ֗ז תָּ֭בִין צֶ֣דֶק וּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּ֝מֵישָׁרִ֗ים כׇּל־מַעְגַּל־טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
You will then understand what is right, just,
And equitable—every good course.
Transliteration: az taviyn tsedek umishefat umeyshariym khׇl-maegal-tvov

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תָב֣וֹא חׇכְמָ֣ה בְלִבֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝דַ֗עַת לְֽנַפְשְׁךָ֥ יִנְעָֽם׃
Translated:
For wisdom will enter your mind
And knowledge will delight you.
Transliteration: khiy-tavvo chׇkhemah velivekha vedaat lenafeshekha yineam

Hebrew: מְ֭זִמָּה תִּשְׁמֹ֥ר עָלֶ֗יךָ תְּבוּנָ֥ה תִנְצְרֶֽכָּה׃
Translated:
Foresight will protect you,
And discernment will guard you.
Transliteration: mezimah tishemor aleykha tevunah tinetserekhah

Hebrew: לְ֭הַצִּ֣ילְךָ מִדֶּ֣רֶךְ רָ֑ע מֵ֝אִ֗ישׁ מְדַבֵּ֥ר תַּהְפֻּכֽוֹת׃
Translated:
It will save you from the way of evil men,
From men who speak duplicity,
Transliteration: lehatsiylekha miderekhe ra meiysh medaver tahefukhvot

Hebrew: הַ֭עֹ֣זְבִים אׇרְח֣וֹת יֹ֑שֶׁר לָ֝לֶ֗כֶת בְּדַרְכֵי־חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
Translated:
Who leave the paths of rectitude
To follow the ways of darkness,
Transliteration: haozeviym ׇrechvot yosher lalekhet vedarekhey-choshekhe

Hebrew: הַ֭שְּׂמֵחִים לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת רָ֑ע יָ֝גִ֗ילוּ בְּֽתַהְפֻּכ֥וֹת רָֽע׃
Translated:
Who rejoice in doing evil
And exult in the duplicity of evil men,
Transliteration: hashemechiym laashvot ra yagiylu vetahefukhvot ra

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר אׇרְחֹתֵיהֶ֣ם עִקְּשִׁ֑ים וּ֝נְלוֹזִ֗ים בְּמַעְגְּלוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
Men whose paths are crooked
And who are devious in their course.
Transliteration: asher ׇrechoteyhem ikeshiym unelvoziym vemaegelvotam

Hebrew: לְ֭הַצִּ֣ילְךָ מֵאִשָּׁ֣ה זָרָ֑ה מִ֝נׇּכְרִיָּ֗ה אֲמָרֶ֥יהָ הֶחֱלִֽיקָה׃
Translated:
It will save you from the forbidden woman,
From the alien woman whose talk is smooth,
Transliteration: lehatsiylekha meishah zarah minׇkheriyah amareyha hecheliykah

Hebrew: הַ֭עֹזֶבֶת אַלּ֣וּף נְעוּרֶ֑יהָ וְאֶת־בְּרִ֖ית אֱלֹהֶ֣יהָ שָׁכֵֽחָה׃
Translated:
Who forsakes the companion of her youth
And disregards the covenant of her God.
Transliteration: haozevet aluf neureyha veet-veriyt eloheyha shakhechah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י שָׁ֣חָה אֶל־מָ֣וֶת בֵּיתָ֑הּ וְאֶל־רְ֝פָאִ֗ים מַעְגְּלֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
Her house sinks down to Death,
And her course leads to the shades.
Transliteration: khiy shachah el-mavet veytah veel-refaiym maegeloteyha

Hebrew: כׇּל־בָּ֭אֶיהָ לֹ֣א יְשׁוּב֑וּן וְלֹֽא־יַ֝שִּׂ֗יגוּ אׇרְח֥וֹת חַיִּֽים׃
Translated:
All who go to her cannot return
And find again the paths of life.
Transliteration: khׇl-vaeyha lo yeshuvun velo-yashiygu ׇrechvot chayiym

Hebrew: לְמַ֗עַן תֵּ֭לֵךְ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ טוֹבִ֑ים וְאׇרְח֖וֹת צַדִּיקִ֣ים תִּשְׁמֹֽר׃
Translated:
So follow the way of the good
And keep to the paths of the just.
Transliteration: lemaan telekhe vederekhe tvoviym veׇrechvot tsadiykiym tishemor

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יְשָׁרִ֥ים יִשְׁכְּנוּ־אָ֑רֶץ וּ֝תְמִימִ֗ים יִוָּ֥תְרוּ בָֽהּ׃
Translated:
For the upright will inhabit the earth,
The blameless will remain in it.
Transliteration: khiy-yeshariym yishekhenu-arets utemiymiym yivateru vah

Hebrew: וּ֭רְשָׁעִים מֵאֶ֣רֶץ יִכָּרֵ֑תוּ וּ֝בוֹגְדִ֗ים יִסְּח֥וּ מִמֶּֽנָּה׃ {פ}
Translated:
While the wicked will vanish from the land
And the treacherous will be rooted out of it.
Transliteration: ureshaiym meerets yikharetu uvvogediym yisechu mimenah {f}

Hebrew: בְּ֭נִי תּוֹרָתִ֣י אַל־תִּשְׁכָּ֑ח וּ֝מִצְוֺתַ֗י יִצֹּ֥ר לִבֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
My son, do not forget my teaching,
But let your mind retain my commandments;
Transliteration: veniy tvoratiy al-tishekhach umitsevotay yitsor livekha

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֹ֣רֶךְ יָ֭מִים וּשְׁנ֣וֹת חַיִּ֑ים וְ֝שָׁל֗וֹם יוֹסִ֥יפוּ לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
For they will bestow on you length of days,
Years of life and well-being.
Transliteration: khiy orekhe yamiym ushenvot chayiym veshalvom yvosiyfu lakhe

Hebrew: חֶ֥סֶד וֶאֱמֶ֗ת אַֽל־יַ֫עַזְבֻ֥ךָ קׇשְׁרֵ֥ם עַל־גַּרְגְּרוֹתֶ֑יךָ כׇּ֝תְבֵ֗ם עַל־ל֥וּחַ לִבֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
Let fidelity and steadfastness not leave you;
Bind them about your throat,
Write them on the tablet of your mind,
Transliteration: chesed veemet al-yaazevukha kׇsherem al-garegervoteykha khׇtevem al-lucha livekha

Hebrew: וּמְצָא־חֵ֥ן וְשֵֽׂכֶל־ט֑וֹב בְּעֵינֵ֖י אֱלֹהִ֣ים וְאָדָֽם׃
Translated:
And you will find favor and approbation
In the eyes of God and man.
Transliteration: umetsa-chen veshekhel-tvov veeyney Elohim veadam

Hebrew: בְּטַ֣ח אֶל־יְ֭הֹוָה בְּכׇל־לִבֶּ֑ךָ וְאֶל־בִּ֥֝ינָתְךָ֗ אַל־תִּשָּׁעֵֽן׃
Translated:
Trust in the LORD with all your heart,
And do not rely on your own understanding.
Transliteration: vetach el-yehovah vekhׇl-livekha veel-viynatekha al-tishaen

Hebrew: בְּכׇל־דְּרָכֶ֥יךָ דָעֵ֑הוּ וְ֝ה֗וּא יְיַשֵּׁ֥ר אֹֽרְחֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
In all your ways acknowledge Him,
And He will make your paths smooth.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-derakheykha daehu vehu yeyasher orechoteykha

Hebrew: אַל־תְּהִ֣י חָכָ֣ם בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ יְרָ֥א אֶת־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה וְס֣וּר מֵרָֽע׃
Translated:
Do not be wise in your own eyes;
Fear the LORD and shun evil.
Transliteration: al-tehiy chakham veeyneykha yera et-yehovah vesur mera

Hebrew: רִ֭פְאוּת תְּהִ֣י לְשׇׁרֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝שִׁקּ֗וּי לְעַצְמוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
It will be a cure for your body,
A tonic for your bones.
Transliteration: rifeut tehiy leshׇrekha veshikuy leatsemvoteykha

Hebrew: כַּבֵּ֣ד אֶת־יְ֭הֹוָה מֵהוֹנֶ֑ךָ וּ֝מֵרֵאשִׁ֗ית כׇּל־תְּבוּאָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Honor the LORD with your wealth,
With the best of all your income,
Transliteration: khaved et-yehovah mehvonekha umereshiyt khׇl-tevuatekha

Hebrew: וְיִמָּלְא֣וּ אֲסָמֶ֣יךָ שָׂבָ֑ע וְ֝תִיר֗וֹשׁ יְקָבֶ֥יךָ יִפְרֹֽצוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
And your barns will be filled with grain,
Your vats will burst with new wine.
Transliteration: veyimaleu asameykha shava vetiyrvosh yekaveykha yiferotsu {f}

Hebrew: מוּסַ֣ר יְ֭הֹוָה בְּנִ֣י אַל־תִּמְאָ֑ס וְאַל־תָּ֝קֹ֗ץ בְּתוֹכַחְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Do not reject the discipline of the LORD, my son;
Do not abhor His rebuke.
Transliteration: musar yehovah veniy al-timeas veal-takots vetvokhachetvo

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֶ֥ת־אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֶאֱהַ֣ב יְהֹוָ֣ה יוֹכִ֑יחַ וּ֝כְאָ֗ב אֶת־בֵּ֥ן יִרְצֶֽה׃
Translated:
For whom the LORD loves, He rebukes,
As a father the son whom he favors.
Transliteration: khiy et-asher yeehav yehovah yvokhiycha ukheav et-ven yiretseh

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֣י אָ֭דָם מָצָ֣א חׇכְמָ֑ה וְ֝אָדָ֗ם יָפִ֥יק תְּבוּנָֽה׃
Translated:
Happy is the man who finds wisdom,
The man who attains understanding.
Transliteration: asherey adam matsa chׇkhemah veadam yafiyk tevunah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ט֣וֹב סַ֭חְרָהּ מִסְּחַר־כָּ֑סֶף וּ֝מֵחָר֗וּץ תְּבוּאָתָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Her value in trade is better than silver,
Her yield, greater than gold.
Transliteration: khiy tvov sacherah misechar-khasef umecharuts tevuatah

Hebrew: יְקָ֣רָה הִ֭יא (מפניים) [מִפְּנִינִ֑ים] וְכׇל־חֲ֝פָצֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א יִֽשְׁווּ־בָֽהּ׃
Translated:
She is more precious than rubies;
All of your goods cannot equal her.
Transliteration: yekarah hiy (mfnyym) [mifeniyniym] vekhׇl-chafatseykha lo yishevu-vah

Hebrew: אֹ֣רֶךְ יָ֭מִים בִּֽימִינָ֑הּ בִּ֝שְׂמֹאולָ֗הּ עֹ֣שֶׁר וְכָבֽוֹד׃
Translated:
In her right hand is length of days,
In her left, riches and honor.
Transliteration: orekhe yamiym viymiynah vishemovlah osher vekhavvod

Hebrew: דְּרָכֶ֥יהָ דַרְכֵי־נֹ֑עַם וְֽכׇל־נְתִ֖יבוֹתֶ֣יהָ שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated:
Her ways are pleasant ways,
And all her paths, peaceful.
Transliteration: derakheyha darekhey-noam vekhׇl-netiyvvoteyha shalvom

Hebrew: עֵץ־חַיִּ֣ים הִ֭יא לַמַּחֲזִיקִ֣ים בָּ֑הּ וְֽתֹמְכֶ֥יהָ מְאֻשָּֽׁר׃ {פ}
Translated:
She is a tree of life to those who grasp her,
And whoever holds on to her is happy.
Transliteration: ets-chayiym hiy lamachaziykiym vah vetomekheyha meushar {f}

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה בְּחׇכְמָ֥ה יָסַד־אָ֑רֶץ כּוֹנֵ֥ן שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם בִּתְבוּנָֽה׃
Translated:
The LORD founded the earth by wisdom;
He established the heavens by understanding;
Transliteration: yehovah vechׇkhemah yasad-arets khvonen shamayiim vitevunah

Hebrew: בְּ֭דַעְתּוֹ תְּהוֹמ֣וֹת נִבְקָ֑עוּ וּ֝שְׁחָקִ֗ים יִרְעֲפוּ־טָֽל׃
Translated:
By His knowledge the depths burst apart,
And the skies distilled dew.
Transliteration: vedaetvo tehvomvot nivekau ushechakiym yireafu-tal

Hebrew: בְּ֭נִי אַל־יָלֻ֣זוּ מֵעֵינֶ֑יךָ נְצֹ֥ר תֻּ֝שִׁיָּ֗ה וּמְזִמָּֽה׃
Translated:
My son, do not lose sight of them;
Hold on to resourcefulness and foresight.
Transliteration: veniy al-yaluzu meeyneykha netsor tushiyah umezimah

Hebrew: וְיִֽהְי֣וּ חַיִּ֣ים לְנַפְשֶׁ֑ךָ וְ֝חֵ֗ן לְגַרְגְּרֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
They will give life to your spirit
And grace to your throat.
Transliteration: veyiheyu chayiym lenafeshekha vechen legaregeroteykha

Hebrew: אָ֤ז תֵּלֵ֣ךְ לָבֶ֣טַח דַּרְכֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝רַגְלְךָ֗ לֹ֣א תִגּֽוֹף׃
Translated:
Then you will go your way safely
And not injure your feet.
Transliteration: az telekhe lavetach darekhekha veragelekha lo tigvof

Hebrew: אִם־תִּשְׁכַּ֥ב לֹֽא־תִפְחָ֑ד וְ֝שָׁכַבְתָּ֗ וְֽעָרְבָ֥ה שְׁנָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
When you lie down you will be unafraid;
You will lie down and your sleep will be sweet.
Transliteration: im-tishekhav lo-tifechad veshakhaveta vearevah shenatekha

Hebrew: אַל־תִּ֭ירָא מִפַּ֣חַד פִּתְאֹ֑ם וּמִשֹּׁאַ֥ת רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים כִּ֣י תָבֹֽא׃
Translated:
You will not fear sudden terror
Or the disaster that comes upon the wicked,
Transliteration: al-tiyra mifachad fiteom umishoat reshaiym khiy tavo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יְ֭הֹוָה יִֽהְיֶ֣ה בְכִסְלֶ֑ךָ וְשָׁמַ֖ר רַגְלְךָ֣ מִלָּֽכֶד׃
Translated:
For the LORD will be your trust;
He will keep your feet from being caught.
Transliteration: khiy-yehovah yiheyeh vekhiselekha veshamar ragelekha milakhed

Hebrew: אַל־תִּמְנַע־ט֥וֹב מִבְּעָלָ֑יו בִּֽהְי֨וֹת לְאֵ֖ל (ידיך) [יָדְךָ֣] לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
Translated:
Do not withhold good from one who
deserves it
When you have the power to do it [for him].
Transliteration: al-timena-tvov mivealayv viheyvot leel (ydykh) [yadekha] laashvot

Hebrew: אַל־תֹּ֘אמַ֤ר (לרעיך) [לְרֵעֲךָ֨ ׀] לֵ֣ךְ וָ֭שׁוּב וּמָחָ֥ר אֶתֵּ֗ן וְיֵ֣שׁ אִתָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
Do not say to your fellow, “Come back again;
I’ll give it to you tomorrow,” when you have it with you.
Transliteration: al-tomar (lrykh) [lereakha ] lekhe vashuv umachar eten veeish itakhe

Hebrew: אַל־תַּחֲרֹ֣שׁ עַל־רֵעֲךָ֣ רָעָ֑ה וְהֽוּא־יוֹשֵׁ֖ב לָבֶ֣טַח אִתָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
Do not devise harm against your fellow
Who lives trustfully with you.
Transliteration: al-tacharosh al-reakha raah vehu-yvoshev lavetach itakhe

Hebrew: אַל־[תָּרִ֣יב] (תרוב) עִם־אָדָ֣ם חִנָּ֑ם אִם־לֹ֖א גְמָלְךָ֣ רָעָֽה׃
Translated:
Do not quarrel with a man for no cause,
When he has done you no harm.
Transliteration: al-[tariyv] (trvv) im-adam chinam im-lo gemalekha raah

Hebrew: אַל־תְּ֭קַנֵּא בְּאִ֣ישׁ חָמָ֑ס וְאַל־תִּ֝בְחַ֗ר בְּכׇל־דְּרָכָֽיו׃
Translated:
Do not envy a lawless man,
Or choose any of his ways;
Transliteration: al-tekane veiysh chamas veal-tivechar vekhׇl-derakhayv

Hebrew: כִּ֤י תוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֣ה נָל֑וֹז וְֽאֶת־יְשָׁרִ֥ים סוֹדֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For the devious man is an abomination to the LORD,
But He is intimate with the straightforward.
Transliteration: khiy tvoavat yehovah nalvoz veet-yeshariym svodvo

Hebrew: מְאֵרַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה בְּבֵ֣ית רָשָׁ֑ע וּנְוֵ֖ה צַדִּיקִ֣ים יְבָרֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
The curse of the LORD is on the house of the wicked,
But He blesses the abode of the righteous.
Transliteration: meerat yehovah veveyt rasha uneveh tsadiykiym yevarekhe

Hebrew: אִם־לַלֵּצִ֥ים הֽוּא־יָלִ֑יץ (ולעניים) [וְ֝לַעֲנָוִ֗ים] יִתֶּן־חֵֽן׃
Translated:
At scoffers He scoffs,
But to the lowly He shows grace.
Transliteration: im-laletsiym hu-yaliyts (vlnyym) [velaanaviym] yiten-chen

Hebrew: כָּ֭בוֹד חֲכָמִ֣ים יִנְחָ֑לוּ וּ֝כְסִילִ֗ים מֵרִ֥ים קָלֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated:
The wise shall obtain honor,
But dullards get disgrace as their portion.
Transliteration: khavvod chakhamiym yinechalu ukhesiyliym meriym kalvon {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֣וּ בָ֭נִים מ֣וּסַר אָ֑ב וְ֝הַקְשִׁ֗יבוּ לָדַ֥עַת בִּינָֽה׃
Translated:
Sons, heed the discipline of a father;
Listen and learn discernment,
Transliteration: shimeu vaniym musar av vehakeshiyvu ladaat viynah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֶ֣קַח ט֭וֹב נָתַ֣תִּי לָכֶ֑ם תּ֝וֹרָתִ֗י אַֽל־תַּעֲזֹֽבוּ׃
Translated:
For I give you good instruction;
Do not forsake my teaching.
Transliteration: khiy lekach tvov natatiy lakhem tvoratiy al-taazovu

Hebrew: כִּֽי־בֵ֭ן הָיִ֣יתִי לְאָבִ֑י רַ֥ךְ וְ֝יָחִ֗יד לִפְנֵ֥י אִמִּֽי׃
Translated:
Once I was a son to my father,
The tender darling of my mother.
Transliteration: khiy-ven hayiytiy leaviy rakhe veyachiyd lifeney imiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּרֵ֗נִי וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לִ֗י יִֽתְמׇךְ־דְּבָרַ֥י לִבֶּ֑ךָ שְׁמֹ֖ר מִצְוֺתַ֣י וֶחְיֵֽה׃
Translated:
He instructed me and said to me,
“Let your mind hold on to my words;
Keep my commandments and you will live.
Transliteration: vayoreniy vayomer liy yitemׇkhe-devaray livekha shemor mitsevotay vecheeih

Hebrew: קְנֵ֣ה חׇ֭כְמָה קְנֵ֣ה בִינָ֑ה אַל־תִּשְׁכַּ֥ח וְאַל־תֵּ֝֗ט מֵאִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃
Translated:
Acquire wisdom, acquire discernment;
Do not forget and do not swerve from my words.
Transliteration: keneh chׇkhemah keneh viynah al-tishekhach veal-tet meimerey-fiy

Hebrew: אַל־תַּעַזְבֶ֥הָ וְתִשְׁמְרֶ֑ךָּ אֱהָבֶ֥הָ וְתִצְּרֶֽךָּ׃
Translated:
Do not forsake her and she will guard you;
Love her and she will protect you.
Transliteration: al-taazeveha vetishemerekha ehaveha vetitserekha

Hebrew: רֵאשִׁ֣ית חׇ֭כְמָה קְנֵ֣ה חׇכְמָ֑ה וּבְכׇל־קִ֝נְיָנְךָ֗ קְנֵ֣ה בִינָֽה׃
Translated:
The beginning of wisdom is—acquire wisdom;
With all your acquisitions, acquire discernment.
Transliteration: reshiyt chׇkhemah keneh chׇkhemah uvekhׇl-kineyanekha keneh viynah

Hebrew: סַלְסְלֶ֥הָ וּֽתְרוֹמְמֶ֑ךָּ תְּ֝כַבֵּ֗דְךָ כִּ֣י תְחַבְּקֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
Hug her to you and she will exalt you;
She will bring you honor if you embrace her.
Transliteration: saleseleha utervomemekha tekhavedekha khiy techavekenah

Hebrew: תִּתֵּ֣ן לְ֭רֹאשְׁךָ לִוְיַת־חֵ֑ן עֲטֶ֖רֶת תִּפְאֶ֣רֶת תְּמַגְּנֶֽךָּ׃
Translated:
She will adorn your head with a graceful wreath;
Crown you with a glorious diadem.”
Transliteration: titen leroshekha liveyat-chen ateret tifeeret temagenekha

Hebrew: שְׁמַ֣ע בְּ֭נִי וְקַ֣ח אֲמָרָ֑י וְיִרְבּ֥וּ לְ֝ךָ֗ שְׁנ֣וֹת חַיִּֽים׃
Translated:
My son, heed and take in my words,
And you will have many years of life.
Transliteration: shema veniy vekach amaray veyirevu lekha shenvot chayiym

Hebrew: בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ חׇ֭כְמָה הֹרֵיתִ֑יךָ הִ֝דְרַכְתִּ֗יךָ בְּמַעְגְּלֵי־יֹֽשֶׁר׃
Translated:
I instruct you in the way of wisdom;
I guide you in straight courses.
Transliteration: vederekhe chׇkhemah horeytiykha hiderakhetiykha vemaegeley-yosher

Hebrew: בְּֽ֭לֶכְתְּךָ לֹא־יֵצַ֣ר צַעֲדֶ֑ךָ וְאִם־תָּ֝ר֗וּץ לֹ֣א תִכָּשֵֽׁל׃
Translated:
You will walk without breaking stride;
When you run, you will not stumble.
Transliteration: velekhetekha lo-eitsar tsaadekha veim-taruts lo tikhashel

Hebrew: הַחֲזֵ֣ק בַּמּוּסָ֣ר אַל־תֶּ֑רֶף נִ֝צְּרֶ֗הָ כִּי־הִ֥יא חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Hold fast to discipline; do not let go;
Keep it; it is your life.
Transliteration: hachazek vamusar al-teref nitsereha khiy-hiy chayeykha

Hebrew: בְּאֹ֣רַח רְ֭שָׁעִים אַל־תָּבֹ֑א וְאַל־תְּ֝אַשֵּׁ֗ר בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ רָעִֽים׃
Translated:
Do not enter on the path of the wicked;
Do not walk on the way of evil men.
Transliteration: veorach reshaiym al-tavo veal-teasher vederekhe raiym

Hebrew: פְּרָעֵ֥הוּ אַל־תַּעֲבׇר־בּ֑וֹ שְׂטֵ֖ה מֵעָלָ֣יו וַעֲבֹֽר׃
Translated:
Avoid it; do not pass through it;
Turn away from it; pass it by.
Transliteration: feraehu al-taavׇr-vvo sheteh mealayv vaavor

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א יִֽ֭שְׁנוּ אִם־לֹ֣א יָרֵ֑עוּ וְֽנִגְזְלָ֥ה שְׁ֝נָתָ֗ם אִם־לֹ֥א (יכשולו) [יַכְשִֽׁילוּ]׃
Translated:
For they cannot sleep unless they have done evil;
Unless they make someone fall they are robbed of sleep.
Transliteration: khiy lo yishenu im-lo yareu venigezelah shenatam im-lo (ykhshvlv) [yakheshiylu]

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לָ֭חֲמוּ לֶ֣חֶם רֶ֑שַׁע וְיֵ֖ין חֲמָסִ֣ים יִשְׁתּֽוּ׃
Translated:
They eat the bread of wickedness
And drink the wine of lawlessness.
Transliteration: khiy lachamu lechem resha veeiyn chamasiym yishetu

Hebrew: וְאֹ֣רַח צַ֭דִּיקִים כְּא֣וֹר נֹ֑גַהּ הוֹלֵ֥ךְ וָ֝א֗וֹר עַד־נְכ֥וֹן הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated:
The path of the righteous is like radiant sunlight,
Ever brightening until noon.
Transliteration: veorach tsadiykiym khevor nogah hvolekhe vavor ad-nekhvon hayyvom

Hebrew: דֶּ֣רֶךְ רְ֭שָׁעִים כָּאֲפֵלָ֑ה לֹ֥א יָ֝דְע֗וּ בַּמֶּ֥ה יִכָּשֵֽׁלוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
The way of the wicked is all darkness;
They do not know what will make them stumble.
Transliteration: derekhe reshaiym khaafelah lo yadeu vameh yikhashelu {f}

Hebrew: בְּ֭נִי לִדְבָרַ֣י הַקְשִׁ֑יבָה לַ֝אֲמָרַ֗י הַט־אׇזְנֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
My son, listen to my speech;
Incline your ear to my words.
Transliteration: veniy lidevaray hakeshiyvah laamaray hat-ׇzenekha

Hebrew: אַל־יַלִּ֥יזוּ מֵעֵינֶ֑יךָ שׇׁ֝מְרֵ֗ם בְּת֣וֹךְ לְבָבֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Do not lose sight of them;
Keep them in your mind.
Transliteration: al-yaliyzu meeyneykha shׇmerem vetvokhe levavekha

Hebrew: כִּֽי־חַיִּ֣ים הֵ֭ם לְמֹצְאֵיהֶ֑ם וּֽלְכׇל־בְּשָׂר֥וֹ מַרְפֵּֽא׃
Translated:
They are life to him who finds them,
Healing for his whole body.
Transliteration: khiy-chayiym hem lemotseeyhem ulekhׇl-vesharvo marefe

Hebrew: מִֽכׇּל־מִ֭שְׁמָר נְצֹ֣ר לִבֶּ֑ךָ כִּֽי־מִ֝מֶּ֗נּוּ תּוֹצְא֥וֹת חַיִּֽים׃
Translated:
More than all that you guard, guard your mind,
For it is the source of life.
Transliteration: mikhׇl-mishemar netsor livekha khiy-mimenu tvotsevot chayiym

Hebrew: הָסֵ֣ר מִ֭מְּךָ עִקְּשׁ֣וּת פֶּ֑ה וּלְז֥וּת שְׂ֝פָתַ֗יִם הַרְחֵ֥ק מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
Translated:
Put crooked speech away from you;
Keep devious talk far from you.
Transliteration: haser mimekha ikeshut feh ulezut shefatayiim harechek mimekha

Hebrew: עֵ֭ינֶיךָ לְנֹ֣כַח יַבִּ֑יטוּ וְ֝עַפְעַפֶּ֗יךָ יַיְשִׁ֥רוּ נֶגְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
Let your eyes look forward,
Your gaze be straight ahead.
Transliteration: eyneykha lenokhach yaviytu veafeafeykha yayeshiru negedekha

Hebrew: פַּ֭לֵּס מַעְגַּ֣ל רַגְלֶ֑ךָ וְֽכׇל־דְּרָכֶ֥יךָ יִכֹּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Survey the course you take,
And all your ways will prosper.
Transliteration: fales maegal ragelekha vekhׇl-derakheykha yikhonu

Hebrew: אַֽל־תֵּט־יָמִ֥ין וּשְׂמֹ֑אול הָסֵ֖ר רַגְלְךָ֣ מֵרָֽע׃ {פ}
Translated:
Do not swerve to the right or the left;
Keep your feet from evil.
Transliteration: al-tet-yamiyn ushemovl haser ragelekha mera {f}

Hebrew: בְּ֭נִי לְחׇכְמָתִ֣י הַקְשִׁ֑יבָה לִ֝תְבוּנָתִ֗י הַט־אׇזְנֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
My son, listen to my wisdom;
Incline your ear to my insight,
Transliteration: veniy lechׇkhematiy hakeshiyvah litevunatiy hat-ׇzenekha

Hebrew: לִשְׁמֹ֥ר מְזִמּ֑וֹת וְ֝דַ֗עַת שְׂפָתֶ֥יךָ יִנְצֹֽרוּ׃
Translated:
That you may have foresight,
While your lips hold fast to knowledge.
Transliteration: lishemor mezimvot vedaat shefateykha yinetsoru

Hebrew: כִּ֤י נֹ֣פֶת תִּ֭טֹּפְנָה שִׂפְתֵ֣י זָרָ֑ה וְחָלָ֖ק מִשֶּׁ֣מֶן חִכָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
For the lips of a forbidden woman drip honey;
Her mouth is smoother than oil;
Transliteration: khiy nofet titofenah shifetey zarah vechalak mishemen chikhah

Hebrew: וְֽ֭אַחֲרִיתָהּ מָרָ֣ה כַֽלַּעֲנָ֑ה חַ֝דָּ֗ה כְּחֶ֣רֶב פִּיּֽוֹת׃
Translated:
But in the end she is as bitter as wormwood,
Sharp as a two-edged sword.
Transliteration: veachariytah marah khalaanah chadah khecherev fiyyvot

Hebrew: רַ֭גְלֶיהָ יֹרְד֣וֹת מָ֑וֶת שְׁ֝א֗וֹל צְעָדֶ֥יהָ יִתְמֹֽכוּ׃
Translated:
Her feet go down to Death;
Her steps take hold of Sheol.
Transliteration: rageleyha yoredvot mavet shevol tseadeyha yitemokhu

Hebrew: אֹ֣רַח חַ֭יִּים פֶּן־תְּפַלֵּ֑ס נָע֥וּ מַ֝עְגְּלֹתֶ֗יהָ לֹ֣א תֵדָֽע׃ {פ}
Translated:
She does not chart a path of life;
Her course meanders for lack of knowledge.
Transliteration: orach chayiym fen-tefales nau maegeloteyha lo teda {f}

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה בָ֭נִים שִׁמְעוּ־לִ֑י וְאַל־תָּ֝ס֗וּרוּ מֵאִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃
Translated:
So now, sons, pay heed to me,
And do not swerve from the words of my mouth.
Transliteration: veatah vaniym shimeu-liy veal-tasuru meimerey-fiy

Hebrew: הַרְחֵ֣ק מֵעָלֶ֣יהָ דַרְכֶּ֑ךָ וְאַל־תִּ֝קְרַ֗ב אֶל־פֶּ֥תַח בֵּיתָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Keep yourself far away from her;
Do not come near the doorway of her house
Transliteration: harechek mealeyha darekhekha veal-tikerav el-fetach veytah

Hebrew: פֶּן־תִּתֵּ֣ן לַאֲחֵרִ֣ים הוֹדֶ֑ךָ וּ֝שְׁנֹתֶ֗יךָ לְאַכְזָרִֽי׃
Translated:
Lest you give up your vigor to others,
Your years to a ruthless one;
Transliteration: fen-titen laacheriym hvodekha ushenoteykha leakhezariy

Hebrew: פֶּֽן־יִשְׂבְּע֣וּ זָרִ֣ים כֹּחֶ֑ךָ וַ֝עֲצָבֶ֗יךָ בְּבֵ֣ית נׇכְרִֽי׃
Translated:
Lest strangers eat their fill of your strength,
And your toil be for the house of another;
Transliteration: fen-yisheveu zariym khochekha vaatsaveykha veveyt nׇkheriy

Hebrew: וְנָהַמְתָּ֥ בְאַחֲרִיתֶ֑ךָ בִּכְל֥וֹת בְּ֝שָׂרְךָ֗ וּשְׁאֵרֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
And in the end you roar,
When your flesh and body are consumed,
Transliteration: venahameta veachariytekha vikhelvot vesharekha usheerekha

Hebrew: וְֽאָמַרְתָּ֗ אֵ֭יךְ שָׂנֵ֣אתִי מוּסָ֑ר וְ֝תוֹכַ֗חַת נָאַ֥ץ לִבִּֽי׃
Translated:
And say,
“O how I hated discipline,
And heartily spurned rebuke.
Transliteration: veamareta eykhe shanetiy musar vetvokhachat naats liviy

Hebrew: וְֽלֹא־שָׁ֭מַעְתִּי בְּק֣וֹל מוֹרָ֑י וְ֝לִֽמְלַמְּדַ֗י לֹא־הִטִּ֥יתִי אׇזְנִֽי׃
Translated:
I did not pay heed to my teachers,
Or incline my ear to my instructors.
Transliteration: velo-shamaetiy vekvol mvoray velimelameday lo-hitiytiy ׇzeniy

Hebrew: כִּ֭מְעַט הָיִ֣יתִי בְכׇל־רָ֑ע בְּת֖וֹךְ קָהָ֣ל וְעֵדָֽה׃
Translated:
Soon I was in dire trouble
Amidst the assembled congregation.”
Transliteration: khimeat hayiytiy vekhׇl-ra vetvokhe kahal veedah

Hebrew: שְׁתֵה־מַ֥יִם מִבּוֹרֶ֑ךָ וְ֝נֹזְלִ֗ים מִתּ֥וֹךְ בְּאֵרֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Drink water from your own cistern,
Running water from your own well.
Transliteration: sheteh-mayiim mivvorekha venozeliym mitvokhe veerekha

Hebrew: יָפ֣וּצוּ מַעְיְנֹתֶ֣יךָ ח֑וּצָה בָּ֝רְחֹב֗וֹת פַּלְגֵי־מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Your springs will gush forth
In streams in the public squares.
Transliteration: yafutsu maeyenoteykha chutsah varechovvot falegey-mayiim

Hebrew: יִֽהְיוּ־לְךָ֥ לְבַדֶּ֑ךָ וְאֵ֖ין לְזָרִ֣ים אִתָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
They will be yours alone,
Others having no part with you.
Transliteration: yiheyu-lekha levadekha veeyn lezariym itakhe

Hebrew: יְהִֽי־מְקוֹרְךָ֥ בָר֑וּךְ וּ֝שְׂמַ֗ח מֵאֵ֥שֶׁת נְעוּרֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Let your fountain be blessed;
Find joy in the wife of your youth—
Transliteration: yehiy-mekvorekha varukhe ushemach meeshet neurekha

Hebrew: אַיֶּ֥לֶת אֲהָבִ֗ים וְֽיַ֫עֲלַת־חֵ֥ן דַּ֭דֶּיהָ יְרַוֻּ֣ךָ בְכׇל־עֵ֑ת בְּ֝אַהֲבָתָ֗הּ תִּשְׁגֶּ֥ה תָמִֽיד׃
Translated:
A loving doe, a graceful mountain goat.
Let her breasts satisfy you at all times;
Be infatuated with love of her always.
Transliteration: ayelet ahaviym veyaalat-chen dadeyha yeravukha vekhׇl-et veahavatah tishegeh tamiyd

Hebrew: וְלָ֤מָּה תִשְׁגֶּ֣ה בְנִ֣י בְזָרָ֑ה וּ֝תְחַבֵּ֗ק חֵ֣ק נׇכְרִיָּֽה׃
Translated:
Why be infatuated, my son, with a forbidden woman?
Why clasp the bosom of an alien woman?
Transliteration: velamah tishegeh veniy vezarah utechavek chek nׇkheriyah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י נֹ֨כַח ׀ עֵינֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה דַּרְכֵי־אִ֑ישׁ וְֽכׇל־מַעְגְּלֹתָ֥יו מְפַלֵּֽס׃
Translated:
For a man’s ways are before the eyes of God;
He surveys his entire course.
Transliteration: khiy nokhach eyney yehovah darekhey-iysh vekhׇl-maegelotayv mefales

Hebrew: עֲֽווֹנֹתָ֗יו יִלְכְּדֻנ֥וֹ אֶת־הָרָשָׁ֑ע וּבְחַבְלֵ֥י חַ֝טָּאת֗וֹ יִתָּמֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
The wicked man will be trapped in his iniquities;
He will be caught up in the ropes of his sin.
Transliteration: avvonotayv yilekhedunvo et-harasha uvechaveley chatatvo yitamekhe

Hebrew: ה֗וּא יָ֭מוּת בְּאֵ֣ין מוּסָ֑ר וּבְרֹ֖ב אִוַּלְתּ֣וֹ יִשְׁגֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
He will die for lack of discipline,
Infatuated by his great folly.
Transliteration: hu yamut veeyn musar uverov ivaletvo yishegeh {f}

Hebrew: בְּ֭נִי אִם־עָרַ֣בְתָּ לְרֵעֶ֑ךָ תָּקַ֖עְתָּ לַזָּ֣ר כַּפֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
My son, if you have stood surety for your fellow,
Given your hand for another,
Transliteration: veniy im-araveta lereekha takaeta lazar khafeykha

Hebrew: נוֹקַ֥שְׁתָּ בְאִמְרֵי־פִ֑יךָ נִ֝לְכַּ֗דְתָּ בְּאִמְרֵי־פִֽיךָ׃
Translated:
You have been trapped by the words of your mouth,
Snared by the words of your mouth.
Transliteration: nvokasheta veimerey-fiykha nilekhadeta veimerey-fiykha

Hebrew: עֲשֵׂ֨ה זֹ֥את אֵפ֪וֹא ׀ בְּנִ֡י וְֽהִנָּצֵ֗ל כִּ֘י־בָ֤אתָ בְכַף־רֵעֶ֑ךָ לֵ֥ךְ הִ֝תְרַפֵּ֗ס וּרְהַ֥ב רֵעֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Do this, then, my son, to extricate yourself,
For you have come into the power of your fellow:
Go grovel—and badger your fellow;
Transliteration: asheh zot efvo veniy vehinatsel khiy-vata vekhaf-reekha lekhe hiterafes urehav reeykha

Hebrew: אַל־תִּתֵּ֣ן שֵׁנָ֣ה לְעֵינֶ֑יךָ וּ֝תְנוּמָ֗ה לְעַפְעַפֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Give your eyes no sleep,
Your pupils no slumber.
Transliteration: al-titen shenah leeyneykha utenumah leafeafeykha

Hebrew: הִ֭נָּצֵל כִּצְבִ֣י מִיָּ֑ד וּ֝כְצִפּ֗וֹר מִיַּ֥ד יָקֽוּשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Save yourself like a deer out of the hand [of a hunter],
Like a bird out of the hand of a fowler.
Transliteration: hinatsel khitseviy miyad ukhetsifvor miyad yakush {f}

Hebrew: לֵֽךְ־אֶל־נְמָלָ֥ה עָצֵ֑ל רְאֵ֖ה דְרָכֶ֣יהָ וַחֲכָֽם׃
Translated:
Lazybones, go to the ant;
Study its ways and learn.
Transliteration: lekhe-el-nemalah atsel reeh derakheyha vachakham

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֵֽין־לָ֥הּ קָצִ֗ין שֹׁטֵ֥ר וּמֹשֵֽׁל׃
Translated: Without leaders, officers, or rulers,
Transliteration: asher eyn-lah katsiyn shoter umoshel

Hebrew: תָּכִ֣ין בַּקַּ֣יִץ לַחְמָ֑הּ אָגְרָ֥ה בַ֝קָּצִ֗יר מַאֲכָלָֽהּ׃
Translated:
It lays up its stores during the summer,
Gathers in its food at the harvest.
Transliteration: takhiyn vakayiits lachemah agerah vakatsiyr maakhalah

Hebrew: עַד־מָתַ֖י עָצֵ֥ל <small>׀</small> תִּשְׁכָּ֑ב מָ֝תַ֗י תָּק֥וּם מִשְּׁנָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
How long will you lie there, lazybones;
When will you wake from your sleep?
Transliteration: ad-matay atsel <small></small> tishekhav matay takum mishenatekha

Hebrew: מְעַ֣ט שֵׁ֭נוֹת מְעַ֣ט תְּנוּמ֑וֹת מְעַ֓ט ׀ חִבֻּ֖ק יָדַ֣יִם לִשְׁכָּֽב׃
Translated:
A bit more sleep, a bit more slumber,
A bit more hugging yourself in bed,
Transliteration: meat shenvot meat tenumvot meat chivuk yadayiim lishekhav

Hebrew: וּבָֽא־כִמְהַלֵּ֥ךְ רֵאשֶׁ֑ךָ וּ֝מַחְסֹרְךָ֗ כְּאִ֣ישׁ מָגֵֽן׃ {פ}
Translated:
And poverty will come calling upon you,
And want, like a man with a shield.
Transliteration: uva-khimehalekhe reshekha umachesorekha kheiysh magen {f}

Hebrew: אָדָ֣ם בְּ֭לִיַּעַל אִ֣ישׁ אָ֑וֶן ה֝וֹלֵ֗ךְ עִקְּשׁ֥וּת פֶּֽה׃
Translated:
A scoundrel, an evil man
Lives by crooked speech,
Transliteration: adam veliyaal iysh aven hvolekhe ikeshut feh

Hebrew: קֹרֵ֣ץ בְּ֭עֵינָו מֹלֵ֣ל בְּרַגְלָ֑ו מֹ֝רֶ֗ה בְּאֶצְבְּעֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
Winking his eyes,
Shuffling his feet,
Pointing his finger.
Transliteration: korets veeynav molel veragelav moreh veetseveotayv

Hebrew: תַּ֥הְפֻּכ֨וֹת ׀ בְּלִבּ֗וֹ חֹרֵ֣שׁ רָ֣ע בְּכׇל־עֵ֑ת (מדנים) [מִדְיָנִ֥ים] יְשַׁלֵּֽחַ׃
Translated:
Duplicity is in his heart;
He plots evil all the time;
He incites quarrels.
Transliteration: tahefukhvot velivvo choresh ra vekhׇl-et (mdnym) [mideyaniym] yeshalecha

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֗ן פִּ֭תְאֹם יָב֣וֹא אֵיד֑וֹ פֶּ֥תַע יִ֝שָּׁבֵ֗ר וְאֵ֣ין מַרְפֵּֽא׃ {פ}
Translated:
Therefore calamity will come upon him without warning;
Suddenly he will be broken beyond repair.
Transliteration: al-khen fiteom yavvo eydvo feta yishaver veeyn marefe {f}

Hebrew: שֶׁשׁ־הֵ֭נָּה שָׂנֵ֣א יְהֹוָ֑ה וְ֝שֶׁ֗בַע (תועבות) [תּוֹעֲבַ֥ת] נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
Six things the LORD hates;
Seven are an abomination to Him:
Transliteration: shesh-henah shane yehovah vesheva (tvvvt) [tvoavat] nafeshvo

Hebrew: עֵינַ֣יִם רָ֭מוֹת לְשׁ֣וֹן שָׁ֑קֶר וְ֝יָדַ֗יִם שֹׁפְכ֥וֹת דָּם־נָקִֽי׃
Translated:
A haughty bearing,
A lying tongue,
Hands that shed innocent blood,
Transliteration: eynayiim ramvot leshvon shaker veyadayiim shofekhvot dam-nakiy

Hebrew: לֵ֗ב חֹ֭רֵשׁ מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת אָ֑וֶן רַגְלַ֥יִם מְ֝מַהֲר֗וֹת לָר֥וּץ לָרָעָֽה׃
Translated:
A mind that hatches evil plots,
Feet quick to run to evil,
Transliteration: lev choresh macheshevvot aven ragelayiim memaharvot laruts laraah

Hebrew: יָפִ֣יחַ כְּ֭זָבִים עֵ֣ד שָׁ֑קֶר וּמְשַׁלֵּ֥חַ מְ֝דָנִ֗ים בֵּ֣ין אַחִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated:
A false witness testifying lies,
And one who incites brothers to quarrel.
Transliteration: yafiycha khezaviym ed shaker umeshalecha medaniym veyn achiym {f}

Hebrew: נְצֹ֣ר בְּ֭נִי מִצְוַ֣ת אָבִ֑יךָ וְאַל־תִּ֝טֹּ֗שׁ תּוֹרַ֥ת אִמֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
My son, keep your father’s commandment;
Do not forsake your mother’s teaching.
Transliteration: netsor veniy mitsevat aviykha veal-titosh tvorat imekha

Hebrew: קׇשְׁרֵ֣ם עַל־לִבְּךָ֣ תָמִ֑יד עׇ֝נְדֵ֗ם עַל־גַּרְגְּרֹתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Tie them over your heart always;
Bind them around your throat.
Transliteration: kׇsherem al-livekha tamiyd ׇnedem al-garegerotekha

Hebrew: בְּהִתְהַלֶּכְךָ֨ ׀ תַּנְחֶ֬ה אֹתָ֗ךְ בְּֽ֭שׇׁכְבְּךָ תִּשְׁמֹ֣ר עָלֶ֑יךָ וַ֝הֲקִיצ֗וֹתָ הִ֣יא תְשִׂיחֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
When you walk it will lead you;
When you lie down it will watch over you;
And when you are awake it will talk with you.
Transliteration: vehitehalekhekha tanecheh otakhe veshׇkhevekha tishemor aleykha vahakiytsvota hiy teshiychekha

Hebrew: כִּ֤י נֵ֣ר מִ֭צְוָה וְת֣וֹרָה א֑וֹר וְדֶ֥רֶךְ חַ֝יִּ֗ים תּוֹכְח֥וֹת מוּסָֽר׃
Translated:
For the commandment is a lamp,
The teaching is a light,
And the way to life is the rebuke that disciplines.
Transliteration: khiy ner mitsevah vetvorah vor vederekhe chayiym tvokhechvot musar

Hebrew: לִ֭שְׁמׇרְךָ מֵאֵ֣שֶׁת רָ֑ע מֵ֝חֶלְקַ֗ת לָשׁ֥וֹן נׇכְרִיָּֽה׃
Translated:
It will keep you from an evil woman,
From the smooth tongue of a forbidden woman.
Transliteration: lishemׇrekha meeshet ra mechelekat lashvon nׇkheriyah

Hebrew: אַל־תַּחְמֹ֣ד יׇ֭פְיָהּ בִּלְבָבֶ֑ךָ וְאַל־תִּ֝קָּחֲךָ֗ בְּעַפְעַפֶּֽיהָ׃
Translated:
Do not lust for her beauty
Or let her captivate you with her eyes.
Transliteration: al-tachemod yׇfeyah vilevavekha veal-tikachakha veafeafeyha

Hebrew: כִּ֤י בְעַד־אִשָּׁ֥ה זוֹנָ֗ה עַֽד־כִּכַּ֫ר־לָ֥חֶם וְאֵ֥שֶׁת אִ֑ישׁ נֶ֖פֶשׁ יְקָרָ֣ה תָצֽוּד׃ {פ}
Translated:
The last loaf of bread will go for a harlot;
A married woman will snare a person of honor.
Transliteration: khiy vead-ishah zvonah ad-khikhar-lachem veeshet iysh nefesh yekarah tatsud {f}

Hebrew: הֲיַחְתֶּ֤ה אִ֓ישׁ אֵ֬שׁ בְּחֵיק֑וֹ וּ֝בְגָדָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִשָּׂרַֽפְנָה׃
Translated:
Can a man rake embers into his bosom
Without burning his clothes?
Transliteration: hayacheteh iysh esh vecheykvo uvegadayv lo tisharafenah

Hebrew: אִם־יְהַלֵּ֣ךְ אִ֭ישׁ עַל־הַגֶּחָלִ֑ים וְ֝רַגְלָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִכָּוֶֽינָה׃
Translated:
Can a man walk on live coals
Without scorching his feet?
Transliteration: im-yehalekhe iysh al-hagechaliym veragelayv lo tikhaveynah

Hebrew: כֵּ֗ן הַ֭בָּא אֶל־אֵ֣שֶׁת רֵעֵ֑הוּ לֹ֥א יִ֝נָּקֶ֗ה כׇּֽל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
It is the same with one who sleeps with his fellow’s wife;
None who touches her will go unpunished.
Transliteration: khen hava el-eshet reehu lo yinakeh khׇl-hanogea vah

Hebrew: לֹא־יָב֣וּזוּ לַ֭גַּנָּב כִּ֣י יִגְנ֑וֹב לְמַלֵּ֥א נַ֝פְשׁ֗וֹ כִּ֣י יִרְעָֽב׃
Translated:
A thief is not held in contempt
For stealing to appease his hunger;
Transliteration: lo-yavuzu laganav khiy yigenvov lemale nafeshvo khiy yireav

Hebrew: וְ֭נִמְצָא יְשַׁלֵּ֣ם שִׁבְעָתָ֑יִם אֶת־כׇּל־ה֖וֹן בֵּית֣וֹ יִתֵּֽן׃
Translated:
Yet if caught he must pay sevenfold;
He must give up all he owns.
Transliteration: venimetsa yeshalem shiveatayiim et-khׇl-hvon veytvo yiten

Hebrew: נֹאֵ֣ף אִשָּׁ֣ה חֲסַר־לֵ֑ב מַֽשְׁחִ֥ית נַ֝פְשׁ֗וֹ ה֣וּא יַעֲשֶֽׂנָּה׃
Translated:
He who commits adultery is devoid of sense;
Only one who would destroy himself does such a thing.
Transliteration: noef ishah chasar-lev mashechiyt nafeshvo hu yaashenah

Hebrew: נֶגַע־וְקָל֥וֹן יִמְצָ֑א וְ֝חֶרְפָּת֗וֹ לֹ֣א תִמָּחֶֽה׃
Translated:
He will meet with disease and disgrace;
His reproach will never be expunged.
Transliteration: nega-vekalvon yimetsa vecherefatvo lo timacheh

Hebrew: כִּֽי־קִנְאָ֥ה חֲמַת־גָּ֑בֶר וְלֹא־יַ֝חְמ֗וֹל בְּי֣וֹם נָקָֽם׃
Translated:
The fury of the husband will be passionate;
He will show no pity on his day of vengeance.
Transliteration: khiy-kineah chamat-gaver velo-yachemvol veyvom nakam

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יִ֭שָּׂא פְּנֵ֣י כׇל־כֹּ֑פֶר וְלֹא־יֹ֝אבֶ֗ה כִּ֣י תַרְבֶּה־שֹּֽׁחַד׃ {פ}
Translated:
He will not have regard for any ransom;
He will refuse your bribe, however great.
Transliteration: lo-yisha feney khׇl-khofer velo-yoveh khiy tareveh-shochad {f}

Hebrew: בְּ֭נִי שְׁמֹ֣ר אֲמָרָ֑י וּ֝מִצְוֺתַ֗י תִּצְפֹּ֥ן אִתָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
My son, heed my words;
And store up my commandments with you.
Transliteration: veniy shemor amaray umitsevotay titsefon itakhe

Hebrew: שְׁמֹ֣ר מִצְוֺתַ֣י וֶחְיֵ֑ה וְ֝תוֹרָתִ֗י כְּאִישׁ֥וֹן עֵינֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Keep my commandments and live,
My teaching, as the apple of your eye.
Transliteration: shemor mitsevotay vecheeih vetvoratiy kheiyshvon eyneykha

Hebrew: קׇשְׁרֵ֥ם עַל־אֶצְבְּעֹתֶ֑יךָ כׇּ֝תְבֵ֗ם עַל־ל֥וּחַ לִבֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
Bind them on your fingers;
Write them on the tablet of your mind.
Transliteration: kׇsherem al-etseveoteykha khׇtevem al-lucha livekha

Hebrew: אֱמֹ֣ר לַ֭חׇכְמָה אֲחֹ֣תִי אָ֑תְּ וּ֝מֹדָ֗ע לַבִּינָ֥ה תִקְרָֽא׃
Translated:
Say to Wisdom, “You are my sister,”
And call Understanding a kinswoman.
Transliteration: emor lachׇkhemah achotiy ate umoda laviynah tikera

Hebrew: לִ֭שְׁמׇרְךָ מֵאִשָּׁ֣ה זָרָ֑ה מִ֝נׇּכְרִיָּ֗ה אֲמָרֶ֥יהָ הֶחֱלִֽיקָה׃
Translated:
She will guard you from a forbidden woman;
From an alien woman whose talk is smooth.
Transliteration: lishemׇrekha meishah zarah minׇkheriyah amareyha hecheliykah

Hebrew: כִּ֭י בְּחַלּ֣וֹן בֵּיתִ֑י בְּעַ֖ד אֶשְׁנַבִּ֣י נִשְׁקָֽפְתִּי׃
Translated:
From the window of my house,
Through my lattice, I looked out
Transliteration: khiy vechalvon veytiy vead eshenaviy nishekafetiy

Hebrew: וָאֵ֤רֶא בַפְּתָאיִ֗ם אָ֘בִ֤ינָה בַבָּנִ֗ים נַ֣עַר חֲסַר־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
And saw among the simple,
Noticed among the youths,
A lad devoid of sense.
Transliteration: vaere vafetayim aviynah vavaniym naar chasar-lev

Hebrew: עֹבֵ֣ר בַּ֭שּׁוּק אֵ֣צֶל פִּנָּ֑הּ וְדֶ֖רֶךְ בֵּיתָ֣הּ יִצְעָֽד׃
Translated:
He was crossing the street near her corner,
Walking toward her house
Transliteration: over vashuk etsel finah vederekhe veytah yitsead

Hebrew: בְּנֶֽשֶׁף־בְּעֶ֥רֶב י֑וֹם בְּאִישׁ֥וֹן לַ֝֗יְלָה וַאֲפֵלָֽה׃
Translated:
In the dusk of evening,
In the dark hours of night.
Transliteration: veneshef-veerev yvom veiyshvon layelah vaafelah

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה אִ֭שָּׁה לִקְרָאת֑וֹ שִׁ֥ית ז֝וֹנָ֗ה וּנְצֻ֥רַת לֵֽב׃
Translated:
A woman comes toward him
Dressed like a harlot, with set purpose.
Transliteration: vehineh ishah likeratvo shiyt zvonah unetsurat lev

Hebrew: הֹמִיָּ֣ה הִ֣יא וְסֹרָ֑רֶת בְּ֝בֵיתָ֗הּ לֹא־יִשְׁכְּנ֥וּ רַגְלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
She is bustling and restive;
She is never at home.
Transliteration: homiyah hiy vesoraret veveytah lo-yishekhenu rageleyha

Hebrew: פַּ֤עַם ׀ בַּח֗וּץ פַּ֥עַם בָּרְחֹב֑וֹת וְאֵ֖צֶל כׇּל־פִּנָּ֣ה תֶאֱרֹֽב׃
Translated:
Now in the street, now in the square,
She lurks at every corner.
Transliteration: faam vachuts faam varechovvot veetsel khׇl-finah teerov

Hebrew: וְהֶחֱזִ֣יקָה בּ֭וֹ וְנָ֣שְׁקָה לּ֑וֹ הֵעֵ֥זָה פָ֝נֶ֗יהָ וַתֹּ֣אמַר לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
She lays hold of him and kisses him;
Brazenly she says to him,
Transliteration: vehecheziykah vvo venashekah lvo heezah faneyha vatomar lvo

Hebrew: זִבְחֵ֣י שְׁלָמִ֣ים עָלָ֑י הַ֝יּ֗וֹם שִׁלַּ֥מְתִּי נְדָרָֽי׃
Translated:
“I had to make a sacrifice of well-being;
Today I fulfilled my vows.
Transliteration: zivechey shelamiym alay hayyvom shilametiy nedaray

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֭ן יָצָ֣אתִי לִקְרָאתֶ֑ךָ לְשַׁחֵ֥ר פָּ֝נֶ֗יךָ וָאֶמְצָאֶֽךָּ׃
Translated:
Therefore I have come out to you,
Seeking you, and have found you.
Transliteration: al-khen yatsatiy likeratekha leshacher faneykha vaemetsaekha

Hebrew: מַ֭רְבַדִּים רָבַ֣דְתִּי עַרְשִׂ֑י חֲ֝טֻב֗וֹת אֵט֥וּן מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated:
I have decked my couch with covers
Of dyed Egyptian linen;
Transliteration: marevadiym ravadetiy areshiy chatuvvot etun mitserayiim

Hebrew: נַ֥פְתִּי מִשְׁכָּבִ֑י מֹ֥ר אֲ֝הָלִ֗ים וְקִנָּמֽוֹן׃
Translated:
I have sprinkled my bed
With myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
Transliteration: nafetiy mishekhaviy mor ahaliym vekinamvon

Hebrew: לְכָ֤ה נִרְוֶ֣ה דֹ֭דִים עַד־הַבֹּ֑קֶר נִ֝תְעַלְּסָ֗ה בׇּאֳהָבִֽים׃
Translated:
Let us drink our fill of love till morning;
Let us delight in amorous embrace.
Transliteration: lekhah nireveh dodiym ad-havoker nitealesah vׇohaviym

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֵ֣ין הָאִ֣ישׁ בְּבֵית֑וֹ הָ֝לַ֗ךְ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ מֵרָחֽוֹק׃
Translated:
For the man of the house is away;
He is off on a distant journey.
Transliteration: khiy eyn haiysh veveytvo halakhe vederekhe merachvok

Hebrew: צְֽרוֹר־הַ֭כֶּסֶף לָקַ֣ח בְּיָד֑וֹ לְי֥וֹם הַ֝כֵּ֗סֶא יָבֹ֥א בֵיתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He took his bag of money with him
And will return only at mid-month.”
Transliteration: tservor-hakhesef lakach veyadvo leyvom hakhese yavo veytvo

Hebrew: הִ֭טַּתּוּ בְּרֹ֣ב לִקְחָ֑הּ בְּחֵ֥לֶק שְׂ֝פָתֶ֗יהָ תַּדִּיחֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
She sways him with her eloquence,
Turns him aside with her smooth talk.
Transliteration: hitatu verov likechah vechelek shefateyha tadiychenu

Hebrew: ה֤וֹלֵ֥ךְ אַחֲרֶ֗יהָ פִּ֫תְאֹ֥ם כְּ֭שׁוֹר אֶל־טֶ֣בַח יָבֹ֑א וּ֝כְעֶ֗כֶס אֶל־מוּסַ֥ר אֱוִֽיל׃
Translated:
Thoughtlessly he follows her,
Like an ox going to the slaughter,
Like a fool to the stocks for punishment—
Transliteration: hvolekhe achareyha fiteom kheshvor el-tevach yavo ukheekhes el-musar eviyl

Hebrew: עַ֤ד יְפַלַּ֪ח חֵ֡ץ כְּֽבֵד֗וֹ כְּמַהֵ֣ר צִפּ֣וֹר אֶל־פָּ֑ח וְלֹא־יָ֝דַ֗ע כִּֽי־בְנַפְשׁ֥וֹ הֽוּא׃
Translated:
Until the arrow pierces his liver.
He is like a bird rushing into a trap,
Not knowing his life is at stake.
Transliteration: ad yefalach chets khevedvo khemaher tsifvor el-fach velo-yada khiy-venafeshvo hu

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה בָ֭נִים שִׁמְעוּ־לִ֑י וְ֝הַקְשִׁ֗יבוּ לְאִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃
Translated:
Now, sons, listen to me;
Pay attention to my words;
Transliteration: veatah vaniym shimeu-liy vehakeshiyvu leimerey-fiy

Hebrew: אַל־יֵ֣שְׂטְ אֶל־דְּרָכֶ֣יהָ לִבֶּ֑ךָ אַל־תֵּ֝֗תַע בִּנְתִיבוֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
Let your mind not wander down her ways;
Do not stray onto her paths.
Transliteration: al-eishete el-derakheyha livekha al-teta vinetiyvvoteyha

Hebrew: כִּֽי־רַבִּ֣ים חֲלָלִ֣ים הִפִּ֑ילָה וַ֝עֲצֻמִ֗ים כׇּל־הֲרֻגֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
For many are those she has struck dead,
And numerous are her victims.
Transliteration: khiy-raviym chalaliym hifiylah vaatsumiym khׇl-harugeyha

Hebrew: דַּרְכֵ֣י שְׁא֣וֹל בֵּיתָ֑הּ יֹ֝רְד֗וֹת אֶל־חַדְרֵי־מָֽוֶת׃ {פ}
Translated:
Her house is a highway to Sheol
Leading down to Death’s inner chambers.
Transliteration: darekhey shevol veytah yoredvot el-chaderey-mavet {f}

Hebrew: הֲלֹֽא־חׇכְמָ֥ה תִקְרָ֑א וּ֝תְבוּנָ֗ה תִּתֵּ֥ן קוֹלָֽהּ׃
Translated:
It is Wisdom calling,
Understanding raising her voice.
Transliteration: halo-chׇkhemah tikera utevunah titen kvolah

Hebrew: בְּרֹאשׁ־מְרֹמִ֥ים עֲלֵי־דָ֑רֶךְ בֵּ֖ית נְתִיב֣וֹת נִצָּֽבָה׃
Translated:
She takes her stand at the topmost heights,
By the wayside, at the crossroads,
Transliteration: verosh-meromiym aley-darekhe veyt netiyvvot nitsavah

Hebrew: לְיַד־שְׁעָרִ֥ים לְפִי־קָ֑רֶת מְב֖וֹא פְתָחִ֣ים תָּרֹֽנָּה׃
Translated:
Near the gates at the city entrance;
At the entryways, she shouts,
Transliteration: leyad-sheariym lefiy-karet mevvo fetachiym taronah

Hebrew: אֲלֵיכֶ֣ם אִישִׁ֣ים אֶקְרָ֑א וְ֝קוֹלִ֗י אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
“O men, I call to you;
My cry is to all mankind.
Transliteration: aleykhem iyshiym ekera vekvoliy el-veney adam

Hebrew: הָבִ֣ינוּ פְתָאיִ֣ם עׇרְמָ֑ה וּ֝כְסִילִ֗ים הָבִ֥ינוּ לֵֽב׃
Translated:
O simple ones, learn shrewdness;
O dullards, instruct your minds.
Transliteration: haviynu fetayim ׇremah ukhesiyliym haviynu lev

Hebrew: שִׁ֭מְעוּ כִּֽי־נְגִידִ֣ים אֲדַבֵּ֑ר וּמִפְתַּ֥ח שְׂ֝פָתַ֗י מֵישָׁרִֽים׃
Translated:
Listen, for I speak noble things;
Uprightness comes from my lips;
Transliteration: shimeu khiy-negiydiym adaver umifetach shefatay meyshariym

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אֱ֭מֶת יֶהְגֶּ֣ה חִכִּ֑י וְתוֹעֲבַ֖ת שְׂפָתַ֣י רֶֽשַׁע׃
Translated:
My mouth utters truth;
Wickedness is abhorrent to my lips.
Transliteration: khiy-emet yehegeh chikhiy vetvoavat shefatay resha

Hebrew: בְּצֶ֥דֶק כׇּל־אִמְרֵי־פִ֑י אֵ֥ין בָּ֝הֶ֗ם נִפְתָּ֥ל וְעִקֵּֽשׁ׃
Translated:
All my words are just,
None of them perverse or crooked;
Transliteration: vetsedek khׇl-imerey-fiy eyn vahem nifetal veikesh

Hebrew: כֻּלָּ֣ם נְ֭כֹחִים לַמֵּבִ֑ין וִ֝ישָׁרִ֗ים לְמֹ֣צְאֵי דָֽעַת׃
Translated:
All are straightforward to the intelligent man,
And right to those who have attained knowledge.
Transliteration: khulam nekhochiym lameviyn viyshariym lemotseey daat

Hebrew: קְחֽוּ־מוּסָרִ֥י וְאַל־כָּ֑סֶף וְ֝דַ֗עַת מֵחָר֥וּץ נִבְחָֽר׃
Translated:
Accept my discipline rather than silver,
Knowledge rather than choice gold.
Transliteration: kechu-musariy veal-khasef vedaat mecharuts nivechar

Hebrew: כִּֽי־טוֹבָ֣ה חׇ֭כְמָה מִפְּנִינִ֑ים וְכׇל־חֲ֝פָצִ֗ים לֹ֣א יִֽשְׁווּ־בָֽהּ׃
Translated:
For wisdom is better than rubies;
No goods can equal her.
Transliteration: khiy-tvovah chׇkhemah mifeniyniym vekhׇl-chafatsiym lo yishevu-vah

Hebrew: אֲֽנִי־חׇ֭כְמָה שָׁכַ֣נְתִּי עׇרְמָ֑ה וְדַ֖עַת מְזִמּ֣וֹת אֶמְצָֽא׃
Translated:
“I, Wisdom, live with Prudence;
I attain knowledge and foresight.
Transliteration: aniy-chׇkhemah shakhanetiy ׇremah vedaat mezimvot emetsa

Hebrew: יִ֥רְאַ֣ת יְהֹוָה֮ שְֽׂנֹ֫את־רָ֥ע גֵּ֘אָ֤ה וְגָא֨וֹן ׀ וְדֶ֣רֶךְ רָ֭ע וּפִ֨י תַהְפֻּכ֬וֹת שָׂנֵֽאתִי׃
Translated:
To fear the LORD is to hate evil;
I hate pride, arrogance, the evil way,
And duplicity in speech.
Transliteration: yireat yehovah shenot-ra geah vegavon vederekhe ra ufiy tahefukhvot shanetiy

Hebrew: לִֽי־עֵ֭צָה וְתוּשִׁיָּ֑ה אֲנִ֥י בִ֝ינָ֗ה לִ֣י גְבוּרָֽה׃
Translated:
Mine are counsel and resourcefulness;
I am understanding; courage is mine.
Transliteration: liy-etsah vetushiyah aniy viynah liy gevurah

Hebrew: בִּ֭י מְלָכִ֣ים יִמְלֹ֑כוּ וְ֝רֹזְנִ֗ים יְחֹ֣קְקוּ צֶֽדֶק׃
Translated:
Through me kings reign
And rulers decree just laws;
Transliteration: viy melakhiym yimelokhu verozeniym yechokeku tsedek

Hebrew: בִּ֭י שָׂרִ֣ים יָשֹׂ֑רוּ וּ֝נְדִיבִ֗ים כׇּל־שֹׁ֥פְטֵי צֶֽדֶק׃
Translated:
Through me princes rule,
Great men and all the righteous judges.
Transliteration: viy shariym yashoru unediyviym khׇl-shofetey tsedek

Hebrew: אֲ֭נִי (אהביה) [אֹהֲבַ֣י] אֵהָ֑ב וּ֝מְשַׁחֲרַ֗י יִמְצָאֻֽנְנִי׃
Translated:
Those who love me I love,
And those who seek me will find me.
Transliteration: aniy (hvyh) [ohavay] ehav umeshacharay yimetsauneniy

Hebrew: עֹֽשֶׁר־וְכָב֥וֹד אִתִּ֑י ה֥וֹן עָ֝תֵ֗ק וּצְדָקָֽה׃
Translated:
Riches and honor belong to me,
Enduring wealth and success.
Transliteration: osher-vekhavvod itiy hvon atek utsedakah

Hebrew: ט֣וֹב פִּ֭רְיִי מֵחָר֣וּץ וּמִפָּ֑ז וּ֝תְבוּאָתִ֗י מִכֶּ֥סֶף נִבְחָֽר׃
Translated:
My fruit is better than gold, fine gold,
And my produce better than choice silver.
Transliteration: tvov fireyiy mecharuts umifaz utevuatiy mikhesef nivechar

Hebrew: בְּאֹֽרַח־צְדָקָ֥ה אֲהַלֵּ֑ךְ בְּ֝ת֗וֹךְ נְתִיב֥וֹת מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
I walk on the way of righteousness,
On the paths of justice.
Transliteration: veorach-tsedakah ahalekhe vetvokhe netiyvvot mishefat

Hebrew: לְהַנְחִ֖יל אֹהֲבַ֥י <small>׀</small> יֵ֑שׁ וְאֹצְרֹ֖תֵיהֶ֣ם אֲמַלֵּֽא׃
Translated:
I endow those who love me with substance;
I will fill their treasuries.
Transliteration: lehanechiyl ohavay <small></small> eish veotseroteyhem amale

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה קָ֭נָנִי רֵאשִׁ֣ית דַּרְכּ֑וֹ קֶ֖דֶם מִפְעָלָ֣יו מֵאָֽז׃
Translated:
“The LORD created me at the beginning of His course
As the first of His works of old.
Transliteration: yehovah kananiy reshiyt darekhvo kedem mifealayv meaz

Hebrew: מֵ֭עוֹלָם נִסַּ֥כְתִּי מֵרֹ֗אשׁ מִקַּדְמֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
In the distant past I was fashioned,
At the beginning, at the origin of earth.
Transliteration: mevolam nisakhetiy merosh mikademey-arets

Hebrew: בְּאֵין־תְּהֹמ֥וֹת חוֹלָ֑לְתִּי בְּאֵ֥ין מַ֝עְיָנ֗וֹת נִכְבַּדֵּי־מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
There was still no deep when I was brought forth,
No springs rich in water;
Transliteration: veeyn-tehomvot chvolaletiy veeyn maeyanvot nikhevadey-mayiim

Hebrew: בְּטֶ֣רֶם הָרִ֣ים הׇטְבָּ֑עוּ לִפְנֵ֖י גְבָע֣וֹת חוֹלָֽלְתִּי׃
Translated:
Before [the foundations of] the mountains were sunk,
Before the hills I was born.
Transliteration: veterem hariym hׇtevau lifeney gevavot chvolaletiy

Hebrew: עַד־לֹ֣א עָ֭שָׂה אֶ֣רֶץ וְחוּצ֑וֹת וְ֝רֹ֗אשׁ עַפְר֥וֹת תֵּבֵֽל׃
Translated:
He had not yet made earth and fields,
Or the world’s first clumps of clay.
Transliteration: ad-lo ashah erets vechutsvot verosh afervot tevel

Hebrew: בַּהֲכִינ֣וֹ שָׁ֭מַיִם שָׁ֣ם אָ֑נִי בְּחֻ֥קוֹ ח֝֗וּג עַל־פְּנֵ֥י תְהֽוֹם׃
Translated:
I was there when He set the heavens into place;
When He fixed the horizon upon the deep;
Transliteration: vahakhiynvo shamayim sham aniy vechukvo chuug al-feney tehvom

Hebrew: בְּאַמְּצ֣וֹ שְׁחָקִ֣ים מִמָּ֑עַל בַּ֝עֲז֗וֹז עִינ֥וֹת תְּהֽוֹם׃
Translated:
When He made the heavens above firm,
And the fountains of the deep gushed forth;
Transliteration: veametsvo shechakiym mimaal vaazvoz iynvot tehvom

Hebrew: בְּשׂ֘וּמ֤וֹ לַיָּ֨ם ׀ חֻקּ֗וֹ וּ֭מַיִם לֹ֣א יַֽעַבְרוּ־פִ֑יו בְּ֝חוּק֗וֹ מ֣וֹסְדֵי אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
When He assigned the sea its limits,
So that its waters never transgress His command;
When He fixed the foundations of the earth,
Transliteration: veshumvo layam chukvo umayim lo yaaveru-fiyv vechukvo mvosedey arets

Hebrew: וָאֶהְיֶ֥ה אֶצְל֗וֹ אָ֫מ֥וֹן וָאֶהְיֶ֣ה שַׁ֭עֲשׁוּעִים י֤וֹם ׀ י֑וֹם מְשַׂחֶ֖קֶת לְפָנָ֣יו בְּכׇל־עֵֽת׃
Translated:
I was with Him as a confidant,
A source of delight every day,
Rejoicing before Him at all times,
Transliteration: vaeheyeh etselvo amvon vaeheyeh shaashuiym yvom yvom meshacheket lefanayv vekhׇl-et

Hebrew: מְ֭שַׂחֶקֶת בְּתֵבֵ֣ל אַרְצ֑וֹ וְ֝שַׁעֲשֻׁעַ֗י אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
Rejoicing in His inhabited world,
Finding delight with mankind.
Transliteration: meshacheket vetevel aretsvo veshaashuay et-veney adam {f}

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה בָ֭נִים שִׁמְעוּ־לִ֑י וְ֝אַשְׁרֵ֗י דְּרָכַ֥י יִשְׁמֹֽרוּ׃
Translated:
Now, sons, listen to me;
Happy are they who keep my ways.
Transliteration: veatah vaniym shimeu-liy veasherey derakhay yishemoru

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֖וּ מוּסָ֥ר וַחֲכָ֗מוּ וְאַל־תִּפְרָֽעוּ׃
Translated:
Heed discipline and become wise;
Do not spurn it.
Transliteration: shimeu musar vachakhamu veal-tiferau

Hebrew: אַ֥שְֽׁרֵי־אָדָם֮ שֹׁמֵ֢עַֽ֫ לִ֥י לִשְׁקֹ֣ד עַל־דַּ֭לְתֹתַי י֤וֹם ׀ י֑וֹם לִ֝שְׁמֹ֗ר מְזוּזֹ֥ת פְּתָחָֽי׃
Translated:
Happy is the man who listens to me,
Coming early to my gates each day,
Waiting outside my doors.
Transliteration: asherey-adam shome֢a liy lishekod al-daletotay yvom yvom lishemor mezuzot fetachay

Hebrew: כִּ֣י מֹ֭צְאִי (מצאי) [מָצָ֣א] חַיִּ֑ים וַיָּ֥פֶק רָ֝צ֗וֹן מֵיְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
For he who finds me finds life
And obtains favor from the LORD.
Transliteration: khiy motseiy (mtsy) [matsa] chayiym vayafek ratsvon meyehovah

Hebrew: וְֽ֭חֹטְאִי חֹמֵ֣ס נַפְשׁ֑וֹ כׇּל־מְ֝שַׂנְאַ֗י אָ֣הֲבוּ מָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
But he who misses me destroys himself;
All who hate me love death.”
Transliteration: vechoteiy chomes nafeshvo khׇl-meshaneay ahavu mavet

Hebrew: חׇ֭כְמוֹת בָּנְתָ֣ה בֵיתָ֑הּ חָצְבָ֖ה עַמּוּדֶ֣יהָ שִׁבְעָֽה׃
Translated:
Wisdom has built her house,
She has hewn her seven pillars.
Transliteration: chׇkhemvot vanetah veytah chatsevah amudeyha shiveah

Hebrew: טָבְחָ֣ה טִ֭בְחָהּ מָסְכָ֣ה יֵינָ֑הּ אַ֝֗ף עָרְכָ֥ה שֻׁלְחָנָֽהּ׃
Translated:
She has prepared the feast,
Mixed the wine,
And also set the table.
Transliteration: tavechah tivechah masekhah eiynah af arekhah shulechanah

Hebrew: שָׁלְחָ֣ה נַעֲרֹתֶ֣יהָ תִקְרָ֑א עַל־גַּ֝פֵּ֗י מְרֹ֣מֵי קָֽרֶת׃
Translated:
She has sent out her maids to announce
On the heights of the town,
Transliteration: shalechah naaroteyha tikera al-gafey meromey karet

Hebrew: מִֽי־פֶ֭תִי יָסֻ֣ר הֵ֑נָּה חֲסַר־לֵ֝֗ב אָ֣מְרָה לּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
“Let the simple enter here”;
To those devoid of sense she says,
Transliteration: miy-fetiy yasur henah chasar-lev amerah lvo

Hebrew: לְ֭כוּ לַחֲמ֣וּ בְֽלַחֲמִ֑י וּ֝שְׁת֗וּ בְּיַ֣יִן מָסָֽכְתִּי׃
Translated:
“Come, eat my food
And drink the wine that I have mixed;
Transliteration: lekhu lachamu velachamiy ushetu veyayiin masakhetiy

Hebrew: עִזְב֣וּ פְתָאיִ֣ם וִֽחְי֑וּ וְ֝אִשְׁר֗וּ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ בִּינָֽה׃
Translated:
Give up simpleness and live,
Walk in the way of understanding.”
Transliteration: izevu fetayim vicheyu veisheru vederekhe viynah

Hebrew: יֹ֤סֵ֨ר ׀ לֵ֗ץ לֹקֵ֣חַֽ ל֣וֹ קָל֑וֹן וּמוֹכִ֖יחַ לְרָשָׁ֣ע מוּמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
To correct a scoffer,
Or rebuke a wicked man for his blemish,
Is to call down abuse on oneself.
Transliteration: yoser lets lokecha lvo kalvon umvokhiycha lerasha mumvo

Hebrew: אַל־תּ֣וֹכַח לֵ֭ץ פֶּן־יִשְׂנָאֶ֑ךָּ הוֹכַ֥ח לְ֝חָכָ֗ם וְיֶאֱהָבֶֽךָּ׃
Translated:
Do not rebuke a scoffer, for he will hate you;
Reprove a wise man, and he will love you.
Transliteration: al-tvokhach lets fen-yishenaekha hvokhach lechakham veyeehavekha

Hebrew: תֵּ֣ן לְ֭חָכָם וְיֶחְכַּם־ע֑וֹד הוֹדַ֥ע לְ֝צַדִּ֗יק וְי֣וֹסֶף לֶֽקַח׃
Translated:
Instruct a wise man, and he will grow wiser;
Teach a righteous man, and he will gain in learning.
Transliteration: ten lechakham veyechekham-vod hvoda letsadiyk veyvosef lekach

Hebrew: תְּחִלַּ֣ת חׇ֭כְמָה יִרְאַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וְדַ֖עַת קְדֹשִׁ֣ים בִּינָֽה׃
Translated:
The beginning of wisdom is fear of the LORD,
And knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
Transliteration: techilat chׇkhemah yireat yehovah vedaat kedoshiym viynah

Hebrew: כִּי־בִ֭י יִרְבּ֣וּ יָמֶ֑יךָ וְיוֹסִ֥יפוּ לְּ֝ךָ֗ שְׁנ֣וֹת חַיִּֽים׃
Translated:
For through me your days will increase,
And years be added to your life.
Transliteration: khiy-viy yirevu yameykha veyvosiyfu lekha shenvot chayiym

Translated:
If you are wise, you are wise for yourself;
If you are a scoffer, you bear it alone.
Transliteration: im-chakhameta chakhameta lakhe velatseta levadekha tisha

Hebrew: אֵ֣שֶׁת כְּ֭סִילוּת הֹמִיָּ֑ה פְּ֝תַיּ֗וּת וּבַל־יָ֥דְעָה מָּֽה׃
Translated:
The stupid woman bustles about;
She is simple and knows nothing.
Transliteration: eshet khesiylut homiyah fetayyut uval-yadeah mah

Hebrew: וְֽ֭יָשְׁבָה לְפֶ֣תַח בֵּיתָ֑הּ עַל־כִּ֝סֵּ֗א מְרֹ֣מֵי קָֽרֶת׃
Translated:
She sits in the doorway of her house,
Or on a chair at the heights of the town,
Transliteration: veyashevah lefetach veytah al-khise meromey karet

Hebrew: לִקְרֹ֥א לְעֹֽבְרֵי־דָ֑רֶךְ הַֽ֝מְיַשְּׁרִ֗ים אֹֽרְחוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
Calling to all the wayfarers
Who go about their own affairs,
Transliteration: likero leoverey-darekhe hameyasheriym orechvotam

Hebrew: מִֽי־פֶ֭תִי יָסֻ֣ר הֵ֑נָּה וַחֲסַר־לֵ֝֗ב וְאָ֣מְרָה לּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
“Let the simple enter here”;
And to those devoid of sense she says,
Transliteration: miy-fetiy yasur henah vachasar-lev veamerah lvo

Hebrew: מַֽיִם־גְּנוּבִ֥ים יִמְתָּ֑קוּ וְלֶ֖חֶם סְתָרִ֣ים יִנְעָֽם׃
Translated:
“Stolen waters are sweet,
And bread eaten furtively is tasty.”
Transliteration: mayiim-genuviym yimetaku velechem setariym yineam

Hebrew: וְֽלֹא־יָ֭דַע כִּֽי־רְפָאִ֣ים שָׁ֑ם בְּעִמְקֵ֖י שְׁא֣וֹל קְרֻאֶֽיהָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
He does not know that the shades are there,
That her guests are in the depths of Sheol.
Transliteration: velo-yada khiy-refaiym sham veimekey shevol kerueyha {f}

Hebrew: מִשְׁלֵ֗י שְׁלֹ֫מֹ֥ה בֵּ֣ן חָ֭כָם יְשַׂמַּח־אָ֑ב וּבֵ֥ן כְּ֝סִ֗יל תּוּגַ֥ת אִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The proverbs of Solomon:

A wise son brings joy to his father;
A dull son is his mother’s sorrow.
Transliteration: misheley shelomoh ven chakham yeshamach-av uven khesiyl tugat imvo

Hebrew: לֹֽא־י֭וֹעִילוּ אוֹצְר֣וֹת רֶ֑שַׁע וּ֝צְדָקָ֗ה תַּצִּ֥יל מִמָּֽוֶת׃
Translated:
Ill-gotten wealth is of no avail,
But righteousness saves from death.
Transliteration: lo-yvoiylu votservot resha utsedakah tatsiyl mimavet

Hebrew: לֹא־יַרְעִ֣יב יְ֭הֹוָה נֶ֣פֶשׁ צַדִּ֑יק וְהַוַּ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים יֶהְדֹּֽף׃
Translated:
The LORD will not let the righteous go hungry,
But He denies the wicked what they crave.
Transliteration: lo-yareiyv yehovah nefesh tsadiyk vehavat reshaiym yehedof

Hebrew: רָ֗אשׁ עֹשֶׂ֥ה כַף־רְמִיָּ֑ה וְיַ֖ד חָרוּצִ֣ים תַּעֲשִֽׁיר׃
Translated:
Negligent hands cause poverty,
But diligent hands enrich.
Transliteration: rash osheh khaf-remiyah veyad charutsiym taashiyr

Hebrew: אֹגֵ֣ר בַּ֭קַּיִץ בֵּ֣ן מַשְׂכִּ֑יל נִרְדָּ֥ם בַּ֝קָּצִ֗יר בֵּ֣ן מֵבִֽישׁ׃
Translated:
He who lays in stores during the summer is a capable son,
But he who sleeps during the harvest is an incompetent.
Transliteration: oger vakayits ven mashekhiyl niredam vakatsiyr ven meviysh

Hebrew: בְּ֭רָכוֹת לְרֹ֣אשׁ צַדִּ֑יק וּפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יְכַסֶּ֥ה חָמָֽס׃
Translated:
Blessings light upon the head of the righteous,
But lawlessness covers the mouth of the wicked.
Transliteration: verakhvot lerosh tsadiyk ufiy reshaiym yekhaseh chamas

Hebrew: זֵ֣כֶר צַ֭דִּיק לִבְרָכָ֑ה וְשֵׁ֖ם רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִרְקָֽב׃
Translated:
The name of the righteous is invoked in blessing,
But the fame of the wicked rots.
Transliteration: zekher tsadiyk liverakhah veshem reshaiym yirekav

Hebrew: חֲכַם־לֵ֭ב יִקַּ֣ח מִצְוֺ֑ת וֶאֱוִ֥יל שְׂ֝פָתַ֗יִם יִלָּבֵֽט׃
Translated:
He whose heart is wise accepts commands,
But he whose speech is foolish comes to grief.
Transliteration: chakham-lev yikach mitsevot veeviyl shefatayiim yilavet

Hebrew: הוֹלֵ֣ךְ בַּ֭תֹּם יֵ֣לֶךְ בֶּ֑טַח וּמְעַקֵּ֥שׁ דְּ֝רָכָ֗יו יִוָּדֵֽעַ׃
Translated:
He who lives blamelessly lives safely,
But he who walks a crooked path will be found out.
Transliteration: hvolekhe vatom eilekhe vetach umeakesh derakhayv yivadea

Hebrew: קֹ֣רֵֽץ עַ֭יִן יִתֵּ֣ן עַצָּ֑בֶת וֶאֱוִ֥יל שְׂ֝פָתַ֗יִם יִלָּבֵֽט׃
Translated:
He who winks his eye causes sorrow;
He whose speech is foolish comes to grief.
Transliteration: korets ayiin yiten atsavet veeviyl shefatayiim yilavet

Hebrew: מְק֣וֹר חַ֭יִּים פִּ֣י צַדִּ֑יק וּפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יְכַסֶּ֥ה חָמָֽס׃
Translated:
The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life,
But lawlessness covers the mouth of the wicked.
Transliteration: mekvor chayiym fiy tsadiyk ufiy reshaiym yekhaseh chamas

Hebrew: שִׂ֭נְאָה תְּעֹרֵ֣ר מְדָנִ֑ים וְעַ֥ל כׇּל־פְּ֝שָׁעִ֗ים תְּכַסֶּ֥ה אַהֲבָֽה׃
Translated:
Hatred stirs up strife,
But love covers up all faults.
Transliteration: shineah teorer medaniym veal khׇl-feshaiym tekhaseh ahavah

Hebrew: בְּשִׂפְתֵ֣י נָ֭בוֹן תִּמָּצֵ֣א חׇכְמָ֑ה וְ֝שֵׁ֗בֶט לְגֵ֣ו חֲסַר־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
Wisdom is to be found on the lips of the intelligent,
But a rod is ready for the back of the senseless.
Transliteration: veshifetey navvon timatse chׇkhemah veshevet legev chasar-lev

Hebrew: חֲכָמִ֥ים יִצְפְּנוּ־דָ֑עַת וּפִֽי־אֱ֝וִ֗יל מְחִתָּ֥ה קְרֹבָֽה׃
Translated:
The wise store up knowledge;
The mouth of the fool is an imminent ruin.
Transliteration: chakhamiym yitsefenu-daat ufiy-eviyl mechitah kerovah

Hebrew: ה֣וֹן עָ֭שִׁיר קִרְיַ֣ת עֻזּ֑וֹ מְחִתַּ֖ת דַּלִּ֣ים רֵישָֽׁם׃
Translated:
The wealth of a rich man is his fortress;
The poverty of the poor is his ruin.
Transliteration: hvon ashiyr kireyat uzvo mechitat daliym reysham

Hebrew: פְּעֻלַּ֣ת צַדִּ֣יק לְחַיִּ֑ים תְּבוּאַ֖ת רָשָׁ֣ע לְחַטָּֽאת׃
Translated:
The labor of the righteous man makes for life;
The produce of the wicked man makes for want.
Transliteration: feulat tsadiyk lechayiym tevuat rasha lechatat

Hebrew: אֹ֣רַח לְ֭חַיִּים שׁוֹמֵ֣ר מוּסָ֑ר וְעֹזֵ֖ב תּוֹכַ֣חַת מַתְעֶֽה׃
Translated:
He who follows discipline shows the way to life,
But he who ignores reproof leads astray.
Transliteration: orach lechayiym shvomer musar veozev tvokhachat mateeh

Hebrew: מְכַסֶּ֣ה שִׂ֭נְאָה שִׂפְתֵי־שָׁ֑קֶר וּמוֹצִ֥א דִ֝בָּ֗ה ה֣וּא כְסִֽיל׃
Translated:
He who conceals hatred has lying lips,
While he who speaks forth slander is a dullard.
Transliteration: mekhaseh shineah shifetey-shaker umvotsi divah hu khesiyl

Hebrew: בְּרֹ֣ב דְּ֭בָרִים לֹ֣א יֶחְדַּל־פָּ֑שַׁע וְחוֹשֵׂ֖ךְ שְׂפָתָ֣יו מַשְׂכִּֽיל׃
Translated:
Where there is much talking, there is no lack of transgressing,
But he who curbs his tongue shows sense.
Transliteration: verov devariym lo yechedal-fasha vechvoshekhe shefatayv mashekhiyl

Hebrew: כֶּ֣סֶף נִ֭בְחָר לְשׁ֣וֹן צַדִּ֑יק לֵ֖ב רְשָׁעִ֣ים כִּמְעָֽט׃
Translated:
The tongue of a righteous man is choice silver,
But the mind of the wicked is of little worth.
Transliteration: khesef nivechar leshvon tsadiyk lev reshaiym khimeat

Hebrew: שִׂפְתֵ֣י צַ֭דִּיק יִרְע֣וּ רַבִּ֑ים וֶ֝אֱוִילִ֗ים בַּחֲסַר־לֵ֥ב יָמֽוּתוּ׃
Translated:
The lips of the righteous sustain many,
But fools die for lack of sense.
Transliteration: shifetey tsadiyk yireu raviym veeviyliym vachasar-lev yamutu

Hebrew: בִּרְכַּ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה הִ֣יא תַעֲשִׁ֑יר וְלֹֽא־יוֹסִ֖ף עֶ֣צֶב עִמָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
It is the blessing of the LORD that enriches,
And no toil can increase it.
Transliteration: virekhat yehovah hiy taashiyr velo-yvosif etsev imah

Hebrew: כִּשְׂח֣וֹק לִ֭כְסִיל עֲשׂ֣וֹת זִמָּ֑ה וְ֝חׇכְמָ֗ה לְאִ֣ישׁ תְּבוּנָֽה׃
Translated:
As mischief is sport for the dullard,
So is wisdom for the man of understanding.
Transliteration: khishechvok likhesiyl ashvot zimah vechׇkhemah leiysh tevunah

Hebrew: מְגוֹרַ֣ת רָ֭שָׁע הִ֣יא תְבוֹאֶ֑נּוּ וְתַאֲוַ֖ת צַדִּיקִ֣ים יִתֵּֽן׃
Translated:
What the wicked man plots overtakes him;
What the righteous desire is granted.
Transliteration: megvorat rasha hiy tevvoenu vetaavat tsadiykiym yiten

Hebrew: כַּעֲב֣וֹר ס֭וּפָה וְאֵ֣ין רָשָׁ֑ע וְ֝צַדִּ֗יק יְס֣וֹד עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
When the storm passes the wicked man is gone,
But the righteous is an everlasting foundation.
Transliteration: khaavvor sufah veeyn rasha vetsadiyk yesvod volam

Hebrew: כַּחֹ֤מֶץ ׀ לַשִּׁנַּ֗יִם וְכֶעָשָׁ֥ן לָעֵינָ֑יִם כֵּ֥ן הֶ֝עָצֵ֗ל לְשֹׁלְחָֽיו׃
Translated:
Like vinegar to the teeth,
Like smoke to the eyes,
Is a lazy man to those who send him on a mission.
Transliteration: khachomets lashinayiim vekheashan laeynayiim khen heatsel lesholechayv

Hebrew: יִרְאַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה תּוֹסִ֣יף יָמִ֑ים וּשְׁנ֖וֹת רְשָׁעִ֣ים תִּקְצֹֽרְנָה׃
Translated:
The fear of the LORD prolongs life,
While the years of the wicked will be shortened.
Transliteration: yireat yehovah tvosiyf yamiym ushenvot reshaiym tiketsorenah

Hebrew: תּוֹחֶ֣לֶת צַדִּיקִ֣ים שִׂמְחָ֑ה וְתִקְוַ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים תֹּאבֵֽד׃
Translated:
The righteous can look forward to joy,
But the hope of the wicked is doomed.
Transliteration: tvochelet tsadiykiym shimechah vetikevat reshaiym toved

Hebrew: מָע֣וֹז לַ֭תֹּם דֶּ֣רֶךְ יְהֹוָ֑ה וּ֝מְחִתָּ֗ה לְפֹ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
The way of the LORD is a stronghold for the blameless,
But a ruin for evildoers.
Transliteration: mavoz latom derekhe yehovah umechitah lefoaley aven

Hebrew: צַ֭דִּיק לְעוֹלָ֣ם בַּל־יִמּ֑וֹט וּ֝רְשָׁעִ֗ים לֹ֣א יִשְׁכְּנוּ־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
The righteous will never be shaken;
The wicked will not inhabit the earth.
Transliteration: tsadiyk levolam val-yimvot ureshaiym lo yishekhenu-arets

Hebrew: פִּֽי־צַ֭דִּיק יָנ֣וּב חׇכְמָ֑ה וּלְשׁ֥וֹן תַּ֝הְפֻּכ֗וֹת תִּכָּרֵֽת׃
Translated:
The mouth of the righteous produces wisdom,
But the treacherous tongue shall be cut off.
Transliteration: fiy-tsadiyk yanuv chׇkhemah uleshvon tahefukhvot tikharet

Hebrew: שִׂפְתֵ֣י צַ֭דִּיק יֵדְע֣וּן רָצ֑וֹן וּפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים תַּהְפֻּכֽוֹת׃
Translated:
The lips of the righteous know what is pleasing;
The mouth of the wicked [knows] duplicity.
Transliteration: shifetey tsadiyk eideun ratsvon ufiy reshaiym tahefukhvot

Hebrew: מֹאזְנֵ֣י מִ֭רְמָה תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאֶ֖בֶן שְׁלֵמָ֣ה רְצוֹנֽוֹ׃
Translated:
False scales are an abomination to the LORD;
An honest weight pleases Him.
Transliteration: mozeney miremah tvoavat yehovah veeven shelemah retsvonvo

Hebrew: בָּֽא־זָ֭דוֹן וַיָּבֹ֣א קָל֑וֹן וְֽאֶת־צְנוּעִ֥ים חׇכְמָֽה׃
Translated:
When arrogance appears, disgrace follows,
But wisdom is with those who are unassuming.
Transliteration: va-zadvon vayavo kalvon veet-tsenuiym chׇkhemah

Hebrew: תֻּמַּ֣ת יְשָׁרִ֣ים תַּנְחֵ֑ם וְסֶ֖לֶף בֹּגְדִ֣ים (ושדם) [יְשׇׁדֵּֽם]׃
Translated:
The integrity of the upright guides them;
The deviousness of the treacherous leads them to ruin.
Transliteration: tumat yeshariym tanechem veselef vogediym (vshdm) [yeshׇdem]

Hebrew: לֹא־יוֹעִ֣יל ה֭וֹן בְּי֣וֹם עֶבְרָ֑ה וּ֝צְדָקָ֗ה תַּצִּ֥יל מִמָּֽוֶת׃
Translated:
Wealth is of no avail on the day of wrath,
But righteousness saves from death.
Transliteration: lo-yvoiyl hvon veyvom everah utsedakah tatsiyl mimavet

Hebrew: צִדְקַ֣ת תָּ֭מִים תְּיַשֵּׁ֣ר דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וּ֝בְרִשְׁעָת֗וֹ יִפֹּ֥ל רָשָֽׁע׃
Translated:
The righteousness of the blameless man smooths his way,
But the wicked man is felled by his wickedness.
Transliteration: tsidekat tamiym teyasher darekhvo uverisheatvo yifol rasha

Hebrew: צִדְקַ֣ת יְ֭שָׁרִים תַּצִּילֵ֑ם וּ֝בְהַוַּ֗ת בֹּגְדִ֥ים יִלָּכֵֽדוּ׃
Translated:
The righteousness of the upright saves them,
But the treacherous are trapped by their malice.
Transliteration: tsidekat yeshariym tatsiylem uvehavat vogediym yilakhedu

Hebrew: בְּמ֤וֹת אָדָ֣ם רָ֭שָׁע תֹּאבַ֣ד תִּקְוָ֑ה וְתוֹחֶ֖לֶת אוֹנִ֣ים אָבָֽדָה׃
Translated:
At death the hopes of a wicked man are doomed,
And the ambition of evil men comes to nothing.
Transliteration: vemvot adam rasha tovad tikevah vetvochelet voniym avadah

Hebrew: צַ֭דִּיק מִצָּרָ֣ה נֶחֱלָ֑ץ וַיָּבֹ֖א רָשָׁ֣ע תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated:
The righteous man is rescued from trouble
And the wicked man takes his place.
Transliteration: tsadiyk mitsarah nechelats vayavo rasha tachetayv

Hebrew: בְּפֶ֗ה חָ֭נֵף יַשְׁחִ֣ת רֵעֵ֑הוּ וּ֝בְדַ֗עַת צַדִּיקִ֥ים יֵחָלֵֽצוּ׃
Translated:
The impious man destroys his neighbor through speech,
But through their knowledge the righteous are rescued.
Transliteration: vefeh chanef yashechit reehu uvedaat tsadiykiym eichaletsu

Hebrew: בְּט֣וּב צַ֭דִּיקִים תַּעֲלֹ֣ץ קִרְיָ֑ה וּבַאֲבֹ֖ד רְשָׁעִ֣ים רִנָּֽה׃
Translated:
When the righteous prosper the city exults;
When the wicked perish there are shouts of joy.
Transliteration: vetuv tsadiykiym taalots kireyah uvaavod reshaiym rinah

Hebrew: בְּבִרְכַּ֣ת יְ֭שָׁרִים תָּר֣וּם קָ֑רֶת וּבְפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים תֵּהָרֵֽס׃
Translated:
A city is built up by the blessing of the upright,
But it is torn down by the speech of the wicked.
Transliteration: vevirekhat yeshariym tarum karet uvefiy reshaiym tehares

Hebrew: בׇּז־לְרֵעֵ֥הוּ חֲסַר־לֵ֑ב וְאִ֖ישׁ תְּבוּנ֣וֹת יַחֲרִֽישׁ׃
Translated:
He who speaks contemptuously of his fellowman is devoid of sense;
A prudent man keeps his peace.
Transliteration: vׇz-lereehu chasar-lev veiysh tevunvot yachariysh

Hebrew: הוֹלֵ֣ךְ רָ֭כִיל מְגַלֶּה־סּ֑וֹד וְנֶאֱמַן־ר֝֗וּחַ מְכַסֶּ֥ה דָבָֽר׃
Translated:
A base fellow gives away secrets,
But a trustworthy soul keeps a confidence.
Transliteration: hvolekhe rakhiyl megaleh-svod veneeman-ruucha mekhaseh davar

Hebrew: בְּאֵ֣ין תַּ֭חְבֻּלוֹת יִפׇּל־עָ֑ם וּ֝תְשׁוּעָ֗ה בְּרֹ֣ב יוֹעֵֽץ׃
Translated:
For want of strategy an army falls,
But victory comes with much planning.
Transliteration: veeyn tachevulvot yifׇl-am uteshuah verov yvoets

Hebrew: רַע־יֵ֭רוֹעַ כִּי־עָ֣רַב זָ֑ר וְשֹׂנֵ֖א תֹקְעִ֣ים בּוֹטֵֽחַ׃
Translated:
Harm awaits him who stands surety for another;
He who spurns pledging shall be secure.
Transliteration: ra-eirvoa khiy-arav zar veshone tokeiym vvotecha

Hebrew: אֵֽשֶׁת־חֵ֭ן תִּתְמֹ֣ךְ כָּב֑וֹד וְ֝עָרִיצִ֗ים יִתְמְכוּ־עֹֽשֶׁר׃
Translated:
A graceful woman obtains honor;
Ruthless men obtain wealth.
Transliteration: eshet-chen titemokhe khavvod veariytsiym yitemekhu-osher

Hebrew: גֹּמֵ֣ל נַ֭פְשׁוֹ אִ֣ישׁ חָ֑סֶד וְעֹכֵ֥ר שְׁ֝אֵר֗וֹ אַכְזָרִֽי׃
Translated:
A kindly man benefits himself;
A cruel man makes trouble for himself.
Transliteration: gomel nafeshvo iysh chased veokher sheervo akhezariy

Hebrew: רָשָׁ֗ע עֹשֶׂ֥ה פְעֻלַּת־שָׁ֑קֶר וְזֹרֵ֥עַ צְ֝דָקָ֗ה שֶׂ֣כֶר אֱמֶֽת׃
Translated:
The wicked man earns illusory wages,
But he who sows righteousness has a true reward.
Transliteration: rasha osheh feulat-shaker vezorea tsedakah shekher emet

Hebrew: כֵּן־צְדָקָ֥ה לְחַיִּ֑ים וּמְרַדֵּ֖ף רָעָ֣ה לְמוֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Righteousness is a prop of life,
But to pursue evil leads to death.
Transliteration: khen-tsedakah lechayiym umeradef raah lemvotvo

Hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה עִקְּשֵׁי־לֵ֑ב וּ֝רְצוֹנ֗וֹ תְּמִ֣ימֵי דָֽרֶךְ׃
Translated:
Men of crooked mind are an abomination to the LORD,
But those whose way is blameless please Him.
Transliteration: tvoavat yehovah ikeshey-lev uretsvonvo temiymey darekhe

Hebrew: יָ֣ד לְ֭יָד לֹא־יִנָּ֣קֶה רָּ֑ע וְזֶ֖רַע צַדִּיקִ֣ים נִמְלָֽט׃
Translated:
Assuredly, the evil man will not escape,
But the offspring of the righteous will be safe.
Transliteration: yad leyad lo-yinakeh ra vezera tsadiykiym nimelat

Hebrew: נֶ֣זֶם זָ֭הָב בְּאַ֣ף חֲזִ֑יר אִשָּׁ֥ה יָ֝פָ֗ה וְסָ֣רַת טָֽעַם׃
Translated:
Like a gold ring in the snout of a pig
Is a beautiful woman bereft of sense.
Transliteration: nezem zahav veaf chaziyr ishah yafah vesarat taam

Hebrew: תַּאֲוַ֣ת צַדִּיקִ֣ים אַךְ־ט֑וֹב תִּקְוַ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים עֶבְרָֽה׃
Translated:
What the righteous desire can only be good;
What the wicked hope for [stirs] wrath.
Transliteration: taavat tsadiykiym akhe-tvov tikevat reshaiym everah

Hebrew: יֵ֣שׁ מְ֭פַזֵּר וְנוֹסָ֥ף ע֑וֹד וְחֹשֵׂ֥ךְ מִ֝יֹּ֗שֶׁר אַךְ־לְמַחְסֽוֹר׃
Translated:
One man gives generously and ends with more;
Another stints on doing the right thing and incurs a loss.
Transliteration: eish mefazer venvosaf vod vechoshekhe miyosher akhe-lemachesvor

Hebrew: נֶֽפֶשׁ־בְּרָכָ֥ה תְדֻשָּׁ֑ן וּ֝מַרְוֶ֗ה גַּם־ה֥וּא יוֹרֶֽא׃
Translated:
A generous person enjoys prosperity;
He who satisfies others shall himself be sated.
Transliteration: nefesh-verakhah tedushan umareveh gam-hu yvore

Hebrew: מֹ֣נֵֽעַ בָּ֭ר יִקְּבֻ֣הוּ לְא֑וֹם וּ֝בְרָכָ֗ה לְרֹ֣אשׁ מַשְׁבִּֽיר׃
Translated:
He who withholds grain earns the curses of the people,
But blessings are on the head of the one who dispenses it.
Transliteration: monea var yikevuhu levom uverakhah lerosh masheviyr

Hebrew: שֹׁ֣חֵֽר ט֭וֹב יְבַקֵּ֣שׁ רָצ֑וֹן וְדֹרֵ֖שׁ רָעָ֣ה תְבוֹאֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
He who earnestly seeks what is good pursues what is pleasing;
He who is bent on evil, upon him it shall come.
Transliteration: shocher tvov yevakesh ratsvon vedoresh raah tevvoenu

Hebrew: בּוֹטֵ֣חַ בְּ֭עׇשְׁרוֹ ה֣וּא יִפּ֑וֹל וְ֝כֶעָלֶ֗ה צַדִּיקִ֥ים יִפְרָֽחוּ׃
Translated:
He who trusts in his wealth shall fall,
But the righteous shall flourish like foliage.
Transliteration: vvotecha veׇshervo hu yifvol vekhealeh tsadiykiym yiferachu

Hebrew: עֹכֵ֣ר בֵּ֭יתוֹ יִנְחַל־ר֑וּחַ וְעֶ֥בֶד אֱ֝וִ֗יל לַֽחֲכַם־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
He who makes trouble for his household shall inherit the wind;
A fool is a slave to the wise-hearted.
Transliteration: okher veytvo yinechal-rucha veeved eviyl lachakham-lev

Hebrew: פְּֽרִי־צַ֭דִּיק עֵ֣ץ חַיִּ֑ים וְלֹקֵ֖חַ נְפָשׁ֣וֹת חָכָֽם׃
Translated:
The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life;
A wise man captivates people.
Transliteration: feriy-tsadiyk ets chayiym velokecha nefashvot chakham

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן צַ֭דִּיק בָּאָ֣רֶץ יְשֻׁלָּ֑ם אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־רָשָׁ֥ע וְחוֹטֵֽא׃
Translated:
If the righteous on earth get their deserts,
How much more the wicked man and the sinner.
Transliteration: hen tsadiyk vaarets yeshulam af khiy-rasha vechvote

Hebrew: אֹהֵ֣ב מ֭וּסָר אֹ֣הֵֽב דָּ֑עַת וְשׂוֹנֵ֖א תוֹכַ֣חַת בָּֽעַר׃
Translated:
He who loves discipline loves knowledge;
He who spurns reproof is a brutish man.
Transliteration: ohev musar ohev daat veshvone tvokhachat vaar

Hebrew: ט֗וֹב יָפִ֣יק רָ֭צוֹן מֵיְהֹוָ֑ה וְאִ֖ישׁ מְזִמּ֣וֹת יַרְשִֽׁיעַ׃
Translated:
A good man earns the favor of the LORD,
A man of intrigues, His condemnation.
Transliteration: tvov yafiyk ratsvon meyehovah veiysh mezimvot yareshiya

Hebrew: לֹא־יִכּ֣וֹן אָדָ֣ם בְּרֶ֑שַׁע וְשֹׁ֥רֶשׁ צַ֝דִּיקִ֗ים בַּל־יִמּֽוֹט׃
Translated:
A man cannot be established in wickedness,
But the root of the righteous will not be shaken loose.
Transliteration: lo-yikhvon adam veresha veshoresh tsadiykiym val-yimvot

Hebrew: אֵֽשֶׁת־חַ֭יִל עֲטֶ֣רֶת בַּעְלָ֑הּ וּכְרָקָ֖ב בְּעַצְמוֹתָ֣יו מְבִישָֽׁה׃
Translated:
A capable wife is a crown for her husband,
But an incompetent one is like rot in his bones.
Transliteration: eshet-chayiil ateret vaelah ukherakav veatsemvotayv meviyshah

Hebrew: מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת צַדִּיקִ֣ים מִשְׁפָּ֑ט תַּחְבֻּל֖וֹת רְשָׁעִ֣ים מִרְמָֽה׃
Translated:
The purposes of the righteous are justice,
The schemes of the wicked are deceit.
Transliteration: macheshevvot tsadiykiym mishefat tachevulvot reshaiym miremah

Hebrew: דִּבְרֵ֣י רְשָׁעִ֣ים אֱרׇב־דָּ֑ם וּפִ֥י יְ֝שָׁרִ֗ים יַצִּילֵֽם׃
Translated:
The words of the wicked are a deadly ambush,
But the speech of the upright saves them.
Transliteration: diverey reshaiym erׇv-dam ufiy yeshariym yatsiylem

Hebrew: הָפ֣וֹךְ רְשָׁעִ֣ים וְאֵינָ֑ם וּבֵ֖ית צַדִּיקִ֣ים יַעֲמֹֽד׃
Translated:
Overturn the wicked and they are gone,
But the house of the righteous will endure.
Transliteration: hafvokhe reshaiym veeynam uveyt tsadiykiym yaamod

Hebrew: לְֽפִי־שִׂ֭כְלוֹ יְהֻלַּל־אִ֑ישׁ וְנַעֲוֵה־לֵ֝֗ב יִהְיֶ֥ה לָבֽוּז׃
Translated:
A man is commended according to his intelligence;
A twisted mind is held up to contempt.
Transliteration: lefiy-shikhelvo yehulal-iysh venaaveh-lev yiheyeh lavuz

Hebrew: ט֣וֹב נִ֭קְלֶה וְעֶ֣בֶד ל֑וֹ מִ֝מִּתְכַּבֵּ֗ד וַחֲסַר־לָֽחֶם׃
Translated:
Better to be lightly esteemed and have a servant
Than to put on airs and have no food.
Transliteration: tvov nikeleh veeved lvo mimitekhaved vachasar-lachem

Hebrew: יוֹדֵ֣עַ צַ֭דִּיק נֶ֣פֶשׁ בְּהֶמְתּ֑וֹ וְֽרַחֲמֵ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים אַכְזָרִֽי׃
Translated:
A righteous man knows the needs of his beast,
But the compassion of the wicked is cruelty.
Transliteration: yvodea tsadiyk nefesh vehemetvo verachamey reshaiym akhezariy

Hebrew: עֹבֵ֣ד אַ֭דְמָתוֹ יִֽשְׂבַּֽע־לָ֑חֶם וּמְרַדֵּ֖ף רֵיקִ֣ים חֲסַר־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
He who tills his land shall have food in plenty,
But he who pursues vanities is devoid of sense.
Transliteration: oved adematvo yisheva-lachem umeradef reykiym chasar-lev

Hebrew: חָמַ֣ד רָ֭שָׁע מְצ֣וֹד רָעִ֑ים וְשֹׁ֖רֶשׁ צַדִּיקִ֣ים יִתֵּֽן׃
Translated:
The wicked covet the catch of evil men;
The root of the righteous yields [fruit].
Transliteration: chamad rasha metsvod raiym veshoresh tsadiykiym yiten

Hebrew: בְּפֶ֣שַׁע שְׂ֭פָתַיִם מוֹקֵ֣שׁ רָ֑ע וַיֵּצֵ֖א מִצָּרָ֣ה צַדִּֽיק׃
Translated:
Sinful speech is a trap for the evil man,
But the righteous escapes from trouble.
Transliteration: vefesha shefatayim mvokesh ra vayetse mitsarah tsadiyk

Hebrew: מִפְּרִ֣י פִי־אִ֭ישׁ יִשְׂבַּע־ט֑וֹב וּגְמ֥וּל יְדֵי־אָ֝דָ֗ם (ישוב) [יָשִׁ֥יב] לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
A man gets his fill of good from the fruit of his speech;
One is repaid in kind for one’s deeds.
Transliteration: miferiy fiy-iysh yisheva-tvov ugemul yedey-adam (yshvv) [yashiyv] lvo
