Hebrew: דֶּ֣רֶךְ אֱ֭וִיל יָשָׁ֣ר בְּעֵינָ֑יו וְשֹׁמֵ֖עַ לְעֵצָ֣ה חָכָֽם׃
Translated:
The way of a fool is right in his own eyes;
But the wise man accepts advice.
Transliteration: derekhe eviyl yashar veeynayv veshomea leetsah chakham

Hebrew: אֱוִ֗יל בַּ֭יּוֹם יִוָּדַ֣ע כַּעְס֑וֹ וְכֹסֶ֖ה קָל֣וֹן עָרֽוּם׃
Translated:
A fool’s vexation is known at once,
But a clever man conceals his humiliation.
Transliteration: eviyl vayyvom yivada khaesvo vekhoseh kalvon arum

Hebrew: יָפִ֣יחַ אֱ֭מוּנָה יַגִּ֣יד צֶ֑דֶק וְעֵ֖ד שְׁקָרִ֣ים מִרְמָֽה׃
Translated:
He who testifies faithfully tells the truth,
But a false witness, deceit.
Transliteration: yafiycha emunah yagiyd tsedek veed shekariym miremah

Hebrew: יֵ֣שׁ בּ֭וֹטֶה כְּמַדְקְר֣וֹת חָ֑רֶב וּלְשׁ֖וֹן חֲכָמִ֣ים מַרְפֵּֽא׃
Translated:
There is blunt talk like sword-thrusts,
But the speech of the wise is healing.
Transliteration: eish vvoteh khemadekervot charev uleshvon chakhamiym marefe

Hebrew: שְֽׂפַת־אֱ֭מֶת תִּכּ֣וֹן לָעַ֑ד וְעַד־אַ֝רְגִּ֗יעָה לְשׁ֣וֹן שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translated:
Truthful speech abides forever,
A lying tongue for but a moment.
Transliteration: shefat-emet tikhvon laad vead-aregiyah leshvon shaker

Hebrew: מִ֭רְמָה בְּלֶב־חֹ֣רְשֵׁי רָ֑ע וּֽלְיֹעֲצֵ֖י שָׁל֣וֹם שִׂמְחָֽה׃
Translated:
Deceit is in the minds of those who plot evil;
For those who plan good there is joy.
Transliteration: miremah velev-choreshey ra uleyoatsey shalvom shimechah

Hebrew: לֹא־יְאֻנֶּ֣ה לַצַּדִּ֣יק כׇּל־אָ֑וֶן וּ֝רְשָׁעִ֗ים מָ֣לְאוּ רָֽע׃
Translated:
No harm befalls the righteous,
But the wicked have their fill of misfortune.
Transliteration: lo-yeuneh latsadiyk khׇl-aven ureshaiym maleu ra

Hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה שִׂפְתֵי־שָׁ֑קֶר וְעֹשֵׂ֖י אֱמוּנָ֣ה רְצוֹנֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Lying speech is an abomination to the LORD,
But those who act faithfully please Him.
Transliteration: tvoavat yehovah shifetey-shaker veoshey emunah retsvonvo

Hebrew: אָדָ֣ם עָ֭רוּם כֹּ֣סֶה דָּ֑עַת וְלֵ֥ב כְּ֝סִילִ֗ים יִקְרָ֥א אִוֶּֽלֶת׃
Translated:
A clever man conceals what he knows,
But the mind of a dullard cries out folly.
Transliteration: adam arum khoseh daat velev khesiyliym yikera ivelet

Hebrew: יַד־חָרוּצִ֥ים תִּמְשׁ֑וֹל וּ֝רְמִיָּ֗ה תִּהְיֶ֥ה לָמַֽס׃
Translated:
The hand of the diligent wields authority;
The negligent are held in subjection.
Transliteration: yad-charutsiym timeshvol uremiyah tiheyeh lamas

Hebrew: דְּאָגָ֣ה בְלֶב־אִ֣ישׁ יַשְׁחֶ֑נָּה וְדָבָ֖ר ט֣וֹב יְשַׂמְּחֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
If there is anxiety in a man’s mind let him quash it,
And turn it into joy with a good word.
Transliteration: deagah velev-iysh yashechenah vedavar tvov yeshamechenah

Hebrew: יָתֵ֣ר מֵרֵעֵ֣הוּ צַדִּ֑יק וְדֶ֖רֶךְ רְשָׁעִ֣ים תַּתְעֵֽם׃
Translated:
A righteous man gives his friend direction,
But the way of the wicked leads astray.
Transliteration: yater mereehu tsadiyk vederekhe reshaiym tateem

Hebrew: לֹא־יַחֲרֹ֣ךְ רְמִיָּ֣ה צֵיד֑וֹ וְהוֹן־אָדָ֖ם יָקָ֣ר חָרֽוּץ׃
Translated:
A negligent man never has game to roast;
A diligent man has precious wealth.
Transliteration: lo-yacharokhe remiyah tseydvo vehvon-adam yakar charuts

Hebrew: בְּאֹֽרַח־צְדָקָ֥ה חַיִּ֑ים וְדֶ֖רֶךְ נְתִיבָ֣הֿ אַל־מָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
The road of righteousness leads to life;
By way of its path there is no death.
Transliteration: veorach-tsedakah chayiym vederekhe netiyvahֿ al-mavet

Hebrew: בֵּ֣ן חָ֭כָם מ֣וּסַר אָ֑ב וְ֝לֵ֗ץ לֹא־שָׁמַ֥ע גְּעָרָֽה׃
Translated:
A wise son—it is through the discipline of his father;
A scoffer—he never heard reproof.
Transliteration: ven chakham musar av velets lo-shama gearah

Hebrew: מִפְּרִ֣י פִי־אִ֭ישׁ יֹ֣אכַל ט֑וֹב וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ בֹּגְדִ֣ים חָמָֽס׃
Translated:
A man enjoys good from the fruit of his speech;
But out of the throat of the treacherous comes lawlessness.
Transliteration: miferiy fiy-iysh yokhal tvov venefesh vogediym chamas

Hebrew: נֹצֵ֣ר פִּ֭יו שֹׁמֵ֣ר נַפְשׁ֑וֹ פֹּשֵׂ֥ק שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו מְחִתָּה־לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He who guards his tongue preserves his life;
He who opens wide his lips, it is his ruin.
Transliteration: notser fiyv shomer nafeshvo foshek shefatayv mechitah-lvo

Hebrew: מִתְאַוָּ֣ה וָ֭אַיִן נַפְשׁ֣וֹ עָצֵ֑ל וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ חָרֻצִ֣ים תְּדֻשָּֽׁן׃
Translated:
A lazy man craves, but has nothing;
The diligent shall feast on rich fare.
Transliteration: miteavah vaayin nafeshvo atsel venefesh charutsiym tedushan

Hebrew: דְּבַר־שֶׁ֭קֶר יִשְׂנָ֣א צַדִּ֑יק וְ֝רָשָׁ֗ע יַבְאִ֥ישׁ וְיַחְפִּֽיר׃
Translated:
A righteous man hates lies;
The wicked man is vile and disgraceful.
Transliteration: devar-sheker yishena tsadiyk verasha yaveiysh veyachefiyr

Hebrew: צְ֭דָקָה תִּצֹּ֣ר תׇּם־דָּ֑רֶךְ וְ֝רִשְׁעָ֗ה תְּסַלֵּ֥ף חַטָּֽאת׃
Translated:
Righteousness protects him whose way is blameless;
Wickedness subverts the sinner.
Transliteration: tsedakah titsor tׇm-darekhe verisheah tesalef chatat

Hebrew: יֵ֣שׁ מִ֭תְעַשֵּׁר וְאֵ֣ין כֹּ֑ל מִ֝תְרוֹשֵׁ֗שׁ וְה֣וֹן רָֽב׃
Translated:
One man pretends to be rich and has nothing;
Another professes to be poor and has much wealth.
Transliteration: eish miteasher veeyn khol mitervoshesh vehvon rav

Hebrew: כֹּ֣פֶר נֶפֶשׁ־אִ֣ישׁ עׇשְׁר֑וֹ וְ֝רָ֗שׁ לֹא־שָׁמַ֥ע גְּעָרָֽה׃
Translated:
Riches are ransom for a man’s life,
The poor never heard a reproof.
Transliteration: khofer nefesh-iysh ׇshervo verash lo-shama gearah

Hebrew: אוֹר־צַדִּיקִ֥ים יִשְׂמָ֑ח וְנֵ֖ר רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִדְעָֽךְ׃
Translated:
The light of the righteous is radiant;
The lamp of the wicked is extinguished.
Transliteration: vor-tsadiykiym yishemach vener reshaiym yideakhe

Hebrew: רַק־בְּ֭זָדוֹן יִתֵּ֣ן מַצָּ֑ה וְאֶת־נ֖וֹעָצִ֣ים חׇכְמָֽה׃
Translated:
Arrogance yields nothing but strife;
Wisdom belongs to those who seek advice.
Transliteration: rak-vezadvon yiten matsah veet-nvoatsiym chׇkhemah

Hebrew: ה֭וֹן מֵהֶ֣בֶל יִמְעָ֑ט וְקֹבֵ֖ץ עַל־יָ֣ד יַרְבֶּֽה׃
Translated:
Wealth may dwindle to less than nothing,
But he who gathers little by little increases it.
Transliteration: hvon mehevel yimeat vekovets al-yad yareveh

Hebrew: תּוֹחֶ֣לֶת מְ֭מֻשָּׁכָה מַחֲלָה־לֵ֑ב וְעֵ֥ץ חַ֝יִּ֗ים תַּאֲוָ֥ה בָאָֽה׃
Translated:
Hope deferred sickens the heart,
But desire realized is a tree of life.
Transliteration: tvochelet memushakhah machalah-lev veets chayiym taavah vaah

Hebrew: בָּ֣ז לְ֭דָבָר יֵחָ֣בֶל ל֑וֹ וִירֵ֥א מִ֝צְוָ֗ה ה֣וּא יְשֻׁלָּֽם׃
Translated:
He who disdains a precept will be injured thereby;
He who respects a command will be rewarded.
Transliteration: vaz ledavar eichavel lvo viyre mitsevah hu yeshulam

Hebrew: תּוֹרַ֣ת חָ֭כָם מְק֣וֹר חַיִּ֑ים לָ֝ס֗וּר מִמֹּ֥קְשֵׁי מָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
The instruction of a wise man is a fountain of life,
Enabling one to avoid deadly snares.
Transliteration: tvorat chakham mekvor chayiym lasur mimokeshey mavet

Hebrew: שֵֽׂכֶל־ט֭וֹב יִתֶּן־חֵ֑ן וְדֶ֖רֶךְ בֹּגְדִ֣ים אֵיתָֽן׃
Translated:
Good sense wins favor;
The way of treacherous men is unchanging.
Transliteration: shekhel-tvov yiten-chen vederekhe vogediym eytan

Hebrew: כׇּל־עָ֭רוּם יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה בְדָ֑עַת וּ֝כְסִ֗יל יִפְרֹ֥שׂ אִוֶּֽלֶת׃
Translated:
Every clever man acts knowledgeably,
But a dullard exposes his stupidity.
Transliteration: khׇl-arum yaasheh vedaat ukhesiyl yiferosh ivelet

Hebrew: מַלְאָ֣ךְ רָ֭שָׁע יִפֹּ֣ל בְּרָ֑ע וְצִ֖יר אֱמוּנִ֣ים מַרְפֵּֽא׃
Translated:
Harm befalls a wicked messenger;
A faithful courier brings healing.
Transliteration: maleakhe rasha yifol vera vetsiyr emuniym marefe

Hebrew: רֵ֣ישׁ וְ֭קָלוֹן פּוֹרֵ֣עַ מוּסָ֑ר וְשֹׁמֵ֖ר תּוֹכַ֣חַת יְכֻבָּֽד׃
Translated:
Poverty and humiliation are for him who spurns discipline;
But he who takes reproof to heart gets honor.
Transliteration: reysh vekalvon fvorea musar veshomer tvokhachat yekhuvad

Hebrew: תַּאֲוָ֣ה נִ֭הְיָה תֶּעֱרַ֣ב לְנָ֑פֶשׁ וְתוֹעֲבַ֥ת כְּ֝סִילִ֗ים ס֣וּר מֵרָֽע׃
Translated:
Desire realized is sweet to the soul;
To turn away from evil is abhorrent to the stupid.
Transliteration: taavah niheyah teerav lenafesh vetvoavat khesiyliym sur mera

Hebrew: (הלוך) [הוֹלֵ֣ךְ] אֶת־חֲכָמִ֣ים (וחכם) [יֶחְכָּ֑ם] וְרֹעֶ֖ה כְסִילִ֣ים יֵרֽוֹעַ׃
Translated:
He who keeps company with the wise becomes wise,
But he who consorts with dullards comes to grief.
Transliteration: (hlvkh) [hvolekhe] et-chakhamiym (vchkhm) [yechekham] veroeh khesiyliym eirvoa

Hebrew: חַ֭טָּאִים תְּרַדֵּ֣ף רָעָ֑ה וְאֶת־צַ֝דִּיקִ֗ים יְשַׁלֶּם־טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
Misfortune pursues sinners,
But the righteous are well rewarded.
Transliteration: chataiym teradef raah veet-tsadiykiym yeshalem-tvov

Hebrew: ט֗וֹב יַנְחִ֥יל בְּנֵֽי־בָנִ֑ים וְצָפ֥וּן לַ֝צַּדִּ֗יק חֵ֣יל חוֹטֵֽא׃
Translated:
A good man has what to bequeath to his grandchildren,
For the wealth of sinners is stored up for the righteous.
Transliteration: tvov yanechiyl veney-vaniym vetsafun latsadiyk cheyl chvote

Hebrew: רׇב־אֹ֭כֶל נִ֣יר רָאשִׁ֑ים וְיֵ֥שׁ נִ֝סְפֶּ֗ה בְּלֹ֣א מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
The tillage of the poor yields much food;
But substance is swept away for lack of moderation.
Transliteration: rׇv-okhel niyr rashiym veeish nisefeh velo mishefat

Hebrew: חוֹשֵׂ֣ךְ שִׁ֭בְטוֹ שׂוֹנֵ֣א בְנ֑וֹ וְ֝אֹהֲב֗וֹ שִׁחֲר֥וֹ מוּסָֽר׃
Translated:
He who spares the rod hates his son,
But he who loves him disciplines him early.
Transliteration: chvoshekhe shivetvo shvone venvo veohavvo shicharvo musar

Hebrew: צַדִּ֗יק אֹ֭כֵֽל לְשֹׂ֣בַע נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וּבֶ֖טֶן רְשָׁעִ֣ים תֶּחְסָֽר׃
Translated:
The righteous man eats to his heart’s content,
But the belly of the wicked is empty.
Transliteration: tsadiyk okhel leshova nafeshvo uveten reshaiym techesar

Hebrew: חַכְמ֣וֹת נָ֭שִׁים בָּנְתָ֣ה בֵיתָ֑הּ וְ֝אִוֶּ֗לֶת בְּיָדֶ֥יהָ תֶהֶרְסֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
The wisest of women builds her house,
But folly tears it down with its own hands.
Transliteration: chakhemvot nashiym vanetah veytah veivelet veyadeyha teheresenu

Hebrew: הוֹלֵ֣ךְ בְּ֭יׇשְׁרוֹ יְרֵ֣א יְהֹוָ֑ה וּנְל֖וֹז דְּרָכָ֣יו בּוֹזֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
He who maintains his integrity fears the LORD;
A man of devious ways scorns Him.
Transliteration: hvolekhe veyׇshervo yere yehovah unelvoz derakhayv vvozehu

Hebrew: בְּֽפִי־אֱ֭וִיל חֹ֣טֶר גַּאֲוָ֑ה וְשִׂפְתֵ֥י חֲ֝כָמִ֗ים תִּשְׁמוּרֵֽם׃
Translated:
In the mouth of a fool is a rod of haughtiness,
But the lips of the wise protect them.
Transliteration: vefiy-eviyl choter gaavah veshifetey chakhamiym tishemurem

Hebrew: בְּאֵ֣ין אֲ֭לָפִים אֵב֣וּס בָּ֑ר וְרׇב־תְּ֝בוּא֗וֹת בְּכֹ֣חַ שֽׁוֹר׃
Translated:
If there are no oxen the crib is clean,
But a rich harvest comes through the strength of the ox.
Transliteration: veeyn alafiym evus var verׇv-tevuvot vekhocha shvor

Hebrew: עֵ֣ד אֱ֭מוּנִים לֹ֣א יְכַזֵּ֑ב וְיָפִ֥יחַ כְּ֝זָבִ֗ים עֵ֣ד שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translated:
An honest witness will not lie;
A false witness testifies lies.
Transliteration: ed emuniym lo yekhazev veyafiycha khezaviym ed shaker

Hebrew: בִּקֶּשׁ־לֵ֣ץ חׇכְמָ֣ה וָאָ֑יִן וְדַ֖עַת לְנָב֣וֹן נָקָֽל׃
Translated:
A scoffer seeks wisdom in vain,
But knowledge comes easily to the intelligent man.
Transliteration: vikesh-lets chׇkhemah vaayiin vedaat lenavvon nakal

Hebrew: לֵ֣ךְ מִ֭נֶּגֶד לְאִ֣ישׁ כְּסִ֑יל וּבַל־יָ֝דַ֗עְתָּ שִׂפְתֵי־דָֽעַת׃
Translated:
Keep your distance from a dullard,
For you will not learn wise speech.
Transliteration: lekhe mineged leiysh khesiyl uval-yadaeta shifetey-daat

Hebrew: חׇכְמַ֣ת עָ֭רוּם הָבִ֣ין דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וְאִוֶּ֖לֶת כְּסִילִ֣ים מִרְמָֽה׃
Translated:
It is the wisdom of a clever man to understand his course;
But the stupidity of the dullard is delusion.
Transliteration: chׇkhemat arum haviyn darekhvo veivelet khesiyliym miremah

Hebrew: אֱ֭וִלִים יָלִ֣יץ אָשָׁ֑ם וּבֵ֖ין יְשָׁרִ֣ים רָצֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Reparations mediate between fools,
Between the upright, good will.
Transliteration: eviliym yaliyts asham uveyn yeshariym ratsvon

Hebrew: לֵ֗ב י֭וֹדֵעַ מׇרַּ֣ת נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וּ֝בְשִׂמְחָת֗וֹ לֹא־יִתְעָ֥רַב זָֽר׃
Translated:
The heart alone knows its bitterness,
And no outsider can share in its joy.
Transliteration: lev yvodea mׇrat nafeshvo uveshimechatvo lo-yitearav zar

Hebrew: בֵּ֣ית רְ֭שָׁעִים יִשָּׁמֵ֑ד וְאֹ֖הֶל יְשָׁרִ֣ים יַפְרִֽיחַ׃
Translated:
The house of the wicked will be demolished,
But the tent of the upright will flourish.
Transliteration: veyt reshaiym yishamed veohel yeshariym yaferiycha

Hebrew: יֵ֤שׁ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יָ֭שָׁר לִפְנֵי־אִ֑ישׁ וְ֝אַחֲרִיתָ֗הּ דַּרְכֵי־מָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
A road may seem right to a man,
But in the end it is a road to death.
Transliteration: eish derekhe yashar lifeney-iysh veachariytah darekhey-mavet

Hebrew: גַּם־בִּשְׂחֹ֥ק יִכְאַב־לֵ֑ב וְאַחֲרִיתָ֖הּ שִׂמְחָ֣ה תוּגָֽה׃
Translated:
The heart may ache even in laughter,
And joy may end in grief.
Transliteration: gam-vishechok yikheav-lev veachariytah shimechah tugah

Hebrew: מִדְּרָכָ֣יו יִ֭שְׂבַּע ס֣וּג לֵ֑ב וּ֝מֵעָלָ֗יו אִ֣ישׁ טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
An unprincipled man reaps the fruits of his ways;
A good man, of his deeds.
Transliteration: miderakhayv yisheva sug lev umealayv iysh tvov

Hebrew: פֶּ֭תִי יַאֲמִ֣ין לְכׇל־דָּבָ֑ר וְ֝עָר֗וּם יָבִ֥ין לַאֲשֻׁרֽוֹ׃
Translated:
A simple person believes anything;
A clever man ponders his course.
Transliteration: fetiy yaamiyn lekhׇl-davar vearum yaviyn laashurvo

Hebrew: חָכָ֣ם יָ֭רֵא וְסָ֣ר מֵרָ֑ע וּ֝כְסִ֗יל מִתְעַבֵּ֥ר וּבוֹטֵֽחַ׃
Translated:
A wise man is diffident and shuns evil,
But a dullard rushes in confidently.
Transliteration: chakham yare vesar mera ukhesiyl miteaver uvvotecha

Hebrew: קְֽצַר־אַ֭פַּיִם יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה אִוֶּ֑לֶת וְאִ֥ישׁ מְ֝זִמּ֗וֹת יִשָּׂנֵֽא׃
Translated:
An impatient man commits folly;
A man of intrigues will be hated.
Transliteration: ketsar-afayim yaasheh ivelet veiysh mezimvot yishane

Hebrew: נָחֲל֣וּ פְתָאיִ֣ם אִוֶּ֑לֶת וַ֝עֲרוּמִ֗ים יַכְתִּ֥רוּ דָֽעַת׃
Translated:
Folly is the lot of the simple,
But clever men glory in knowledge.
Transliteration: nachalu fetayim ivelet vaarumiym yakhetiru daat

Hebrew: שַׁח֣וּ רָ֭עִים לִפְנֵ֣י טוֹבִ֑ים וּ֝רְשָׁעִ֗ים עַֽל־שַׁעֲרֵ֥י צַדִּֽיק׃
Translated:
Evil men are brought low before the good,
So are the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
Transliteration: shachu raiym lifeney tvoviym ureshaiym al-shaarey tsadiyk

Hebrew: גַּם־לְ֭רֵעֵהוּ יִשָּׂ֣נֵא רָ֑שׁ וְאֹהֲבֵ֖י עָשִׁ֣יר רַבִּֽים׃
Translated:
A pauper is despised even by his peers,
But a rich man has many friends.
Transliteration: gam-lereehu yishane rash veohavey ashiyr raviym

Hebrew: בׇּז־לְרֵעֵ֥הוּ חוֹטֵ֑א וּמְחוֹנֵ֖ן (עניים) [עֲנָוִ֣ים] אַשְׁרָֽיו׃
Translated:
He who despises his fellow is wrong;
He who shows pity for the lowly is happy.
Transliteration: vׇz-lereehu chvote umechvonen (nyym) [anaviym] asherayv

Hebrew: הֲֽלוֹא־יִ֭תְעוּ חֹ֣רְשֵׁי רָ֑ע וְחֶ֥סֶד וֶ֝אֱמֶ֗ת חֹ֣רְשֵׁי טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
Surely those who plan evil go astray,
While those who plan good earn steadfast love.
Transliteration: halvo-yiteu choreshey ra vechesed veemet choreshey tvov

Hebrew: בְּכׇל־עֶ֭צֶב יִהְיֶ֣ה מוֹתָ֑ר וּדְבַר־שְׂ֝פָתַ֗יִם אַךְ־לְמַחְסֽוֹר׃
Translated:
From all toil there is some gain,
But idle chatter is pure loss.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-etsev yiheyeh mvotar udevar-shefatayiim akhe-lemachesvor

Hebrew: עֲטֶ֣רֶת חֲכָמִ֣ים עׇשְׁרָ֑ם אִוֶּ֖לֶת כְּסִילִ֣ים אִוֶּֽלֶת׃
Translated:
The ornament of the wise is their wealth;
The stupidity of dullards is stupidity.
Transliteration: ateret chakhamiym ׇsheram ivelet khesiyliym ivelet

Hebrew: מַצִּ֣יל נְ֭פָשׁוֹת עֵ֣ד אֱמֶ֑ת וְיָפִ֖חַ כְּזָבִ֣ים מִרְמָֽה׃
Translated:
A truthful witness saves lives;
He who testifies lies [spreads] deceit.
Transliteration: matsiyl nefashvot ed emet veyaficha khezaviym miremah

Hebrew: בְּיִרְאַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה מִבְטַח־עֹ֑ז וּ֝לְבָנָ֗יו יִהְיֶ֥ה מַחְסֶֽה׃
Translated:
Fear of the LORD is a stronghold,
A refuge for a man’s children.
Transliteration: veyireat yehovah mivetach-oz ulevanayv yiheyeh macheseh

Hebrew: יִרְאַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה מְק֣וֹר חַיִּ֑ים לָ֝ס֗וּר מִמֹּ֥קְשֵׁי מָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
Fear of the LORD is a fountain of life,
Enabling one to avoid deadly snares.
Transliteration: yireat yehovah mekvor chayiym lasur mimokeshey mavet

Hebrew: בְּרׇב־עָ֥ם הַדְרַת־מֶ֑לֶךְ וּבְאֶ֥פֶס לְ֝אֹ֗ם מְחִתַּ֥ת רָזֽוֹן׃
Translated:
A numerous people is the glory of a king;
Without a nation a ruler is ruined.
Transliteration: verׇv-am haderat-melekhe uveefes leom mechitat razvon

Hebrew: אֶ֣רֶךְ אַ֭פַּיִם רַב־תְּבוּנָ֑ה וּקְצַר־ר֝֗וּחַ מֵרִ֥ים אִוֶּֽלֶת׃
Translated:
Patience results in much understanding;
Impatience gets folly as its portion.
Transliteration: erekhe afayim rav-tevunah uketsar-ruucha meriym ivelet

Hebrew: חַיֵּ֣י בְ֭שָׂרִים לֵ֣ב מַרְפֵּ֑א וּרְקַ֖ב עֲצָמ֣וֹת קִנְאָֽה׃
Translated:
A calm disposition gives bodily health;
Passion is rot to the bones.
Transliteration: chayey veshariym lev marefe urekav atsamvot kineah

Hebrew: עֹ֣שֵֽׁק דָּ֭ל חֵרֵ֣ף עֹשֵׂ֑הוּ וּ֝מְכַבְּד֗וֹ חֹנֵ֥ן אֶבְיֽוֹן׃
Translated:
He who withholds what is due to the poor affronts his Maker;
He who shows pity for the needy honors Him.
Transliteration: oshek dal cheref oshehu umekhavedvo chonen eveyvon

Hebrew: בְּֽ֭רָעָתוֹ יִדָּחֶ֣ה רָשָׁ֑ע וְחֹסֶ֖ה בְמוֹת֣וֹ צַדִּֽיק׃
Translated:
The wicked man is felled by his own evil;
The righteous man finds security in his death.
Transliteration: veraatvo yidacheh rasha vechoseh vemvotvo tsadiyk

Hebrew: בְּלֵ֣ב נָ֭בוֹן תָּנ֣וּחַ חׇכְמָ֑ה וּבְקֶ֥רֶב כְּ֝סִילִ֗ים תִּוָּדֵֽעַ׃
Translated:
Wisdom rests quietly in the mind of a prudent man,
But among dullards it makes itself known.
Transliteration: velev navvon tanucha chׇkhemah uvekerev khesiyliym tivadea

Hebrew: צְדָקָ֥ה תְרוֹמֵֽם־גּ֑וֹי וְחֶ֖סֶד לְאֻמִּ֣ים חַטָּֽאת׃
Translated:
Righteousness exalts a nation;
Sin is a reproach to any people.
Transliteration: tsedakah tervomem-gvoy vechesed leumiym chatat

Hebrew: רְֽצוֹן־מֶ֭לֶךְ לְעֶ֣בֶד מַשְׂכִּ֑יל וְ֝עֶבְרָת֗וֹ תִּהְיֶ֥ה מֵבִֽישׁ׃
Translated:
The king favors a capable servant;
He rages at an incompetent one.
Transliteration: retsvon-melekhe leeved mashekhiyl veeveratvo tiheyeh meviysh

Hebrew: מַֽעֲנֶה־רַּ֭ךְ יָשִׁ֣יב חֵמָ֑ה וּדְבַר־עֶ֝֗צֶב יַעֲלֶה־אָֽף׃
Translated:
A gentle response allays wrath;
A harsh word provokes anger.
Transliteration: maaneh-rakhe yashiyv chemah udevar-etsev yaaleh-af

Hebrew: לְשׁ֣וֹן חֲ֭כָמִים תֵּיטִ֣יב דָּ֑עַת וּפִ֥י כְ֝סִילִ֗ים יַבִּ֥יעַ אִוֶּֽלֶת׃
Translated:
The tongue of the wise produces much knowledge,
But the mouth of dullards pours out folly.
Transliteration: leshvon chakhamiym teytiyv daat ufiy khesiyliym yaviya ivelet

Hebrew: בְּֽכׇל־מָ֭קוֹם עֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה צֹ֝פ֗וֹת רָעִ֥ים וְטוֹבִֽים׃
Translated:
The eyes of the LORD are everywhere,
Observing the bad and the good.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-makvom eyney yehovah tsofvot raiym vetvoviym

Hebrew: מַרְפֵּ֣א לָ֭שׁוֹן עֵ֣ץ חַיִּ֑ים וְסֶ֥לֶף בָּ֝֗הּ שֶׁ֣בֶר בְּרֽוּחַ׃
Translated:
A healing tongue is a tree of life,
But a devious one makes for a broken spirit.
Transliteration: marefe lashvon ets chayiym veselef vah shever verucha

Hebrew: אֱוִ֗יל יִ֭נְאַץ מוּסַ֣ר אָבִ֑יו וְשֹׁמֵ֖ר תּוֹכַ֣חַת יַעְרִֽים׃
Translated:
A fool spurns the discipline of his father,
But one who heeds reproof becomes clever.
Transliteration: eviyl yineats musar aviyv veshomer tvokhachat yaeriym

Hebrew: בֵּ֣ית צַ֭דִּיק חֹ֣סֶן רָ֑ב וּבִתְבוּאַ֖ת רָשָׁ֣ע נֶעְכָּֽרֶת׃
Translated:
In the house of the righteous there is much treasure,
But in the harvest of the wicked there is trouble.
Transliteration: veyt tsadiyk chosen rav uvitevuat rasha neekharet

Hebrew: שִׂפְתֵ֣י חֲ֭כָמִים יְזָ֣רוּ דָ֑עַת וְלֵ֖ב כְּסִילִ֣ים לֹא־כֵֽן׃
Translated:
The lips of the wise disseminate knowledge;
Not so the minds of dullards.
Transliteration: shifetey chakhamiym yezaru daat velev khesiyliym lo-khen

Hebrew: זֶ֣בַח רְ֭שָׁעִים תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וּתְפִלַּ֖ת יְשָׁרִ֣ים רְצוֹנֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD,
But the prayer of the upright pleases Him.
Transliteration: zevach reshaiym tvoavat yehovah utefilat yeshariym retsvonvo

Hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה דֶּ֣רֶךְ רָשָׁ֑ע וּמְרַדֵּ֖ף צְדָקָ֣ה יֶאֱהָֽב׃
Translated:
The way of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD,
But He loves him who pursues righteousness.
Transliteration: tvoavat yehovah derekhe rasha umeradef tsedakah yeehav

Hebrew: מוּסָ֣ר רָ֭ע לְעֹזֵ֣ב אֹ֑רַח שׂוֹנֵ֖א תוֹכַ֣חַת יָמֽוּת׃
Translated:
Discipline seems bad to him who forsakes the way;
He who spurns reproof will die.
Transliteration: musar ra leozev orach shvone tvokhachat yamut

Hebrew: שְׁא֣וֹל וַ֭אֲבַדּוֹן נֶ֣גֶד יְהֹוָ֑ה אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־לִבּ֥וֹת בְּֽנֵי־אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
Sheol and Abaddon lie exposed to the LORD,
How much more the minds of men!
Transliteration: shevol vaavadvon neged yehovah af khiy-livvot veney-adam

Hebrew: לֹ֣א יֶאֱהַב־לֵ֭ץ הוֹכֵ֣חַֽ ל֑וֹ אֶל־חֲ֝כָמִ֗ים לֹ֣א יֵלֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
The scoffer dislikes being reproved;
He will not resort to the wise.
Transliteration: lo yeehav-lets hvokhecha lvo el-chakhamiym lo eilekhe

Hebrew: לֵ֣ב שָׂ֭מֵחַ יֵיטִ֣ב פָּנִ֑ים וּבְעַצְּבַת־לֵ֝֗ב ר֣וּחַ נְכֵאָֽה׃
Translated:
A joyful heart makes a cheerful face;
A sad heart makes a despondent mood.
Transliteration: lev shamecha eiytiv faniym uveatsevat-lev rucha nekheah

Hebrew: לֵ֣ב נָ֭בוֹן יְבַקֶּשׁ־דָּ֑עַת (ופני) [וּפִ֥י] כְ֝סִילִ֗ים יִרְעֶ֥ה אִוֶּֽלֶת׃
Translated:
The mind of a prudent man seeks knowledge;
The mouth of the dullard pursues folly.
Transliteration: lev navvon yevakesh-daat (vfny) [ufiy] khesiyliym yireeh ivelet

Hebrew: כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י עָנִ֣י רָעִ֑ים וְטֽוֹב־לֵ֝֗ב מִשְׁתֶּ֥ה תָמִֽיד׃
Translated:
All the days of a poor man are wretched,
But contentment is a feast without end.
Transliteration: khׇl-yemey aniy raiym vetvov-lev misheteh tamiyd

Hebrew: טוֹב־מְ֭עַט בְּיִרְאַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה מֵאוֹצָ֥ר רָ֝֗ב וּמְה֥וּמָה בֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Better a little with fear of the LORD
Than great wealth with confusion.
Transliteration: tvov-meat veyireat yehovah mevotsar rav umehumah vvo

Hebrew: ט֤וֹב אֲרֻחַ֣ת יָ֭רָק וְאַהֲבָה־שָׁ֑ם מִשּׁ֥וֹר אָ֝ב֗וּס וְשִׂנְאָה־בֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Better a meal of vegetables where there is love
Than a fattened ox where there is hate.
Transliteration: tvov aruchat yarak veahavah-sham mishvor avus veshineah-vvo

Hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ חֵ֭מָה יְגָרֶ֣ה מָד֑וֹן וְאֶ֥רֶךְ אַ֝פַּ֗יִם יַשְׁקִ֥יט רִֽיב׃
Translated:
A hot-tempered man provokes a quarrel;
A patient man calms strife.
Transliteration: iysh chemah yegareh madvon veerekhe afayiim yashekiyt riyv

Hebrew: דֶּ֣רֶךְ עָ֭צֵל כִּמְשֻׂ֣כַת חָ֑דֶק וְאֹ֖רַח יְשָׁרִ֣ים סְלֻלָֽה׃
Translated:
The way of a lazy man is like a hedge of thorns,
But the path of the upright is paved.
Transliteration: derekhe atsel khimeshukhat chadek veorach yeshariym selulah

Hebrew: בֵּ֣ן חָ֭כָם יְשַׂמַּח־אָ֑ב וּכְסִ֥יל אָ֝דָ֗ם בּוֹזֶ֥ה אִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
A wise son makes his father happy;
A fool of a man humiliates his mother.
Transliteration: ven chakham yeshamach-av ukhesiyl adam vvozeh imvo

Hebrew: אִ֭וֶּלֶת שִׂמְחָ֣ה לַחֲסַר־לֵ֑ב וְאִ֥ישׁ תְּ֝בוּנָ֗ה יְיַשֶּׁר־לָֽכֶת׃
Translated:
Folly is joy to one devoid of sense;
A prudent man walks a straight path.
Transliteration: ivelet shimechah lachasar-lev veiysh tevunah yeyasher-lakhet

Hebrew: הָפֵ֣ר מַ֭חֲשָׁבוֹת בְּאֵ֣ין ס֑וֹד וּבְרֹ֖ב יוֹעֲצִ֣ים תָּקֽוּם׃
Translated:
Plans are foiled for want of counsel,
But they succeed through many advisers.
Transliteration: hafer machashavvot veeyn svod uverov yvoatsiym takum

Hebrew: שִׂמְחָ֣ה לָ֭אִישׁ בְּמַעֲנֵה־פִ֑יו וְדָבָ֖ר בְּעִתּ֣וֹ מַה־טּֽוֹב׃
Translated:
A ready response is a joy to a man,
And how good is a word rightly timed!
Transliteration: shimechah laiysh vemaaneh-fiyv vedavar veitvo mah-tvov

Hebrew: אֹ֣רַח חַ֭יִּים לְמַ֣עְלָה לְמַשְׂכִּ֑יל לְמַ֥עַן ס֝֗וּר מִשְּׁא֥וֹל מָֽטָּה׃
Translated:
For an intelligent man the path of life leads upward,
In order to avoid Sheol below.
Transliteration: orach chayiym lemaelah lemashekhiyl lemaan suur mishevol matah

Hebrew: בֵּ֣ית גֵּ֭אִים יִסַּ֥ח <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֑ה וְ֝יַצֵּ֗ב גְּב֣וּל אַלְמָנָֽה׃
Translated:
The LORD will tear down the house of the proud,
But He will establish the homestead of the widow.
Transliteration: veyt geiym yisach <small></small> yehovah veyatsev gevul alemanah

Hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת רָ֑ע וּ֝טְהֹרִ֗ים אִמְרֵי־נֹֽעַם׃
Translated:
Evil thoughts are an abomination to the LORD,
But pleasant words are pure.
Transliteration: tvoavat yehovah macheshevvot ra utehoriym imerey-noam

Hebrew: עֹכֵ֣ר בֵּ֭יתוֹ בּוֹצֵ֣עַ בָּ֑צַע וְשׂוֹנֵ֖א מַתָּנֹ֣ת יִחְיֶֽה׃
Translated:
He who pursues ill-gotten gain makes trouble for his household;
He who spurns gifts will live long.
Transliteration: okher veytvo vvotsea vatsa veshvone matanot yicheyeh

Hebrew: לֵ֣ב צַ֭דִּיק יֶהְגֶּ֣ה לַעֲנ֑וֹת וּפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יַבִּ֥יעַ רָעֽוֹת׃
Translated:
The heart of the righteous man rehearses his answer,
But the mouth of the wicked blurts out evil things.
Transliteration: lev tsadiyk yehegeh laanvot ufiy reshaiym yaviya ravot

Hebrew: רָח֣וֹק יְ֭הֹוָה מֵרְשָׁעִ֑ים וּתְפִלַּ֖ת צַדִּיקִ֣ים יִשְׁמָֽע׃
Translated:
The LORD is far from the wicked,
But He hears the prayer of the righteous.
Transliteration: rachvok yehovah mereshaiym utefilat tsadiykiym yishema

Hebrew: מְֽאוֹר־עֵ֭ינַיִם יְשַׂמַּֽח־לֵ֑ב שְׁמוּעָ֥ה ט֝וֹבָ֗ה תְּדַשֶּׁן־עָֽצֶם׃
Translated:
What brightens the eye gladdens the heart;
Good news puts fat on the bones.
Transliteration: mevor-eynayim yeshamach-lev shemuah tvovah tedashen-atsem

Hebrew: אֹ֗זֶן שֹׁ֭מַעַת תּוֹכַ֣חַת חַיִּ֑ים בְּקֶ֖רֶב חֲכָמִ֣ים תָּלִֽין׃
Translated:
He whose ear heeds the discipline of life
Lodges among the wise.
Transliteration: ozen shomaat tvokhachat chayiym vekerev chakhamiym taliyn

Hebrew: פּוֹרֵ֣עַ מ֭וּסָר מוֹאֵ֣ס נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וְשׁוֹמֵ֥עַ תּ֝וֹכַ֗חַת ק֣וֹנֶה לֵּֽב׃
Translated:
He who spurns discipline hates himself;
He who heeds reproof gains understanding.
Transliteration: fvorea musar mvoes nafeshvo veshvomea tvokhachat kvoneh lev

Hebrew: יִרְאַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה מוּסַ֣ר חׇכְמָ֑ה וְלִפְנֵ֖י כָב֣וֹד עֲנָוָֽה׃
Translated:
The fear of the LORD is the discipline of wisdom;
Humility precedes honor.
Transliteration: yireat yehovah musar chׇkhemah velifeney khavvod anavah

Hebrew: לְאָדָ֥ם מַעַרְכֵי־לֵ֑ב וּ֝מֵיְהֹוָ֗ה מַעֲנֵ֥ה לָשֽׁוֹן׃
Translated:
A man may arrange his thoughts,
But what he says depends on the LORD.
Transliteration: leadam maarekhey-lev umeyehovah maaneh lashvon

Hebrew: כׇּֽל־דַּרְכֵי־אִ֭ישׁ זַ֣ךְ בְּעֵינָ֑יו וְתֹכֵ֖ן רוּח֣וֹת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
All the ways of a man seem right to him,
But the LORD probes motives.
Transliteration: khׇl-darekhey-iysh zakhe veeynayv vetokhen ruchvot yehovah

Hebrew: גֹּ֣ל אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה מַעֲשֶׂ֑יךָ וְ֝יִכֹּ֗נוּ מַחְשְׁבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Entrust your affairs to the LORD,
And your plans will succeed.
Transliteration: gol el-yehovah maasheykha veyiikhonu macheshevoteykha

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ל פָּעַ֣ל יְ֭הֹוָה לַֽמַּעֲנֵ֑הוּ וְגַם־רָ֝שָׁ֗ע לְי֣וֹם רָעָֽה׃
Translated:
The LORD made everything for a purpose,
Even the wicked for an evil day.
Transliteration: khol faal yehovah lamaanehu vegam-rasha leyvom raah

Hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־גְּבַהּ־לֵ֑ב יָ֥ד לְ֝יָ֗ד לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶֽה׃
Translated:
Every haughty person is an abomination to the LORD;
Assuredly, he will not go unpunished.
Transliteration: tvoavat yehovah khׇl-gevah-lev yad leyad lo yinakeh

Hebrew: בְּחֶ֣סֶד וֶ֭אֱמֶת יְכֻפַּ֣ר עָוֺ֑ן וּבְיִרְאַ֥ת יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה ס֣וּר מֵרָֽע׃
Translated:
Iniquity is expiated by loyalty and faithfulness,
And evil is avoided through fear of the LORD.
Transliteration: vechesed veemet yekhufar avon uveyireat yehovah sur mera

Hebrew: בִּרְצ֣וֹת יְ֭הֹוָה דַּרְכֵי־אִ֑ישׁ גַּם־א֝וֹיְבָ֗יו יַשְׁלִ֥ם אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
When the LORD is pleased with a man’s conduct,
He may turn even his enemies into allies.
Transliteration: viretsvot yehovah darekhey-iysh gam-voyevayv yashelim itvo

Hebrew: טוֹב־מְ֭עַט בִּצְדָקָ֑ה מֵרֹ֥ב תְּ֝בוּא֗וֹת בְּלֹ֣א מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
Better a little with righteousness
Than a large income with injustice.
Transliteration: tvov-meat vitsedakah merov tevuvot velo mishefat

Hebrew: לֵ֣ב אָ֭דָם יְחַשֵּׁ֣ב דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה יָכִ֥ין צַעֲדֽוֹ׃
Translated:
A man may plot out his course,
But it is the LORD who directs his steps.
Transliteration: lev adam yechashev darekhvo vayhovah yakhiyn tsaadvo

Hebrew: קֶ֤סֶם ׀ עַֽל־שִׂפְתֵי־מֶ֑לֶךְ בְּ֝מִשְׁפָּ֗ט לֹ֣א יִמְעַל־פִּֽיו׃
Translated:
There is magic on the lips of the king;
He cannot err in judgment.
Transliteration: kesem al-shifetey-melekhe vemishefat lo yimeal-fiyv

Hebrew: פֶּ֤לֶס ׀ וּמֹאזְנֵ֣י מִ֭שְׁפָּט לַיהֹוָ֑ה מַ֝עֲשֵׂ֗הוּ כׇּל־אַבְנֵי־כִֽיס׃
Translated:
Honest scales and balances are the LORD’s;
All the weights in the bag are His work.
Transliteration: feles umozeney mishefat layhovah maashehu khׇl-aveney-khiys

Hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת מְ֭לָכִים עֲשׂ֣וֹת רֶ֑שַׁע כִּ֥י בִ֝צְדָקָ֗ה יִכּ֥וֹן כִּסֵּֽא׃
Translated:
Wicked deeds are an abomination to kings,
For the throne is established by righteousness.
Transliteration: tvoavat melakhiym ashvot resha khiy vitsedakah yikhvon khise

Hebrew: רְצ֣וֹן מְ֭לָכִים שִׂפְתֵי־צֶ֑דֶק וְדֹבֵ֖ר יְשָׁרִ֣ים יֶאֱהָֽב׃
Translated:
Truthful speech wins the favor of kings;
They love those who speak honestly.
Transliteration: retsvon melakhiym shifetey-tsedek vedover yeshariym yeehav

Hebrew: חֲמַת־מֶ֥לֶךְ מַלְאֲכֵי־מָ֑וֶת וְאִ֖ישׁ חָכָ֣ם יְכַפְּרֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
The king’s wrath is a messenger of death,
But a wise man can appease it.
Transliteration: chamat-melekhe maleakhey-mavet veiysh chakham yekhaferenah

Hebrew: בְּאוֹר־פְּנֵי־מֶ֥לֶךְ חַיִּ֑ים וּ֝רְצוֹנ֗וֹ כְּעָ֣ב מַלְקֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated:
The king’s smile means life;
His favor is like a rain cloud in spring.
Transliteration: vevor-feney-melekhe chayiym uretsvonvo kheav malekvosh

Hebrew: קְֽנֹה־חׇכְמָ֗ה מַה־טּ֥וֹב מֵחָר֑וּץ וּקְנ֥וֹת בִּ֝ינָ֗ה נִבְחָ֥ר מִכָּֽסֶף׃
Translated:
How much better to acquire wisdom than gold;
To acquire understanding is preferable to silver.
Transliteration: kenoh-chׇkhemah mah-tvov mecharuts ukenvot viynah nivechar mikhasef

Hebrew: מְסִלַּ֣ת יְ֭שָׁרִים ס֣וּר מֵרָ֑ע שֹׁמֵ֥ר נַ֝פְשׁ֗וֹ נֹצֵ֥ר דַּרְכּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The highway of the upright avoids evil;
He who would preserve his life watches his way.
Transliteration: mesilat yeshariym sur mera shomer nafeshvo notser darekhvo

Hebrew: לִפְנֵי־שֶׁ֥בֶר גָּא֑וֹן וְלִפְנֵ֥י כִ֝שָּׁל֗וֹן גֹּ֣בַהּ רֽוּחַ׃
Translated:
Pride goes before ruin,
Arrogance, before failure.
Transliteration: lifeney-shever gavon velifeney khishalvon govah rucha

Hebrew: ט֣וֹב שְׁפַל־ר֭וּחַ אֶת־[עֲנָוִ֑ים] (עניים) מֵחַלֵּ֥ק שָׁ֝לָ֗ל אֶת־גֵּאִֽים׃
Translated:
Better to be humble and among the lowly
Than to share spoils with the proud.
Transliteration: tvov shefal-rucha et-[anaviym] (nyym) mechalek shalal et-geiym

Hebrew: מַשְׂכִּ֣יל עַל־דָּ֭בָר יִמְצָא־ט֑וֹב וּבוֹטֵ֖חַ בַּיהֹוָ֣ה אַשְׁרָֽיו׃
Translated:
He who is adept in a matter will attain success;
Happy is he who trusts in the LORD.
Transliteration: mashekhiyl al-davar yimetsa-tvov uvvotecha vayhovah asherayv

Hebrew: לַֽחֲכַם־לֵ֭ב יִקָּרֵ֣א נָב֑וֹן וּמֶ֥תֶק שְׂ֝פָתַ֗יִם יֹסִ֥יף לֶֽקַח׃
Translated:
The wise-hearted is called discerning;
One whose speech is pleasing gains wisdom.
Transliteration: lachakham-lev yikare navvon umetek shefatayiim yosiyf lekach

Hebrew: מְק֣וֹר חַ֭יִּים שֵׂ֣כֶל בְּעָלָ֑יו וּמוּסַ֖ר אֱוִלִ֣ים אִוֶּֽלֶת׃
Translated:
Good sense is a fountain of life to those who have it,
And folly is the punishment of fools.
Transliteration: mekvor chayiym shekhel vealayv umusar eviliym ivelet

Hebrew: לֵ֣ב חָ֭כָם יַשְׂכִּ֣יל פִּ֑יהוּ וְעַל־שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו יֹסִ֥יף לֶֽקַח׃
Translated:
The mind of the wise man makes his speech effective
And increases the wisdom on his lips.
Transliteration: lev chakham yashekhiyl fiyhu veal-shefatayv yosiyf lekach

Hebrew: צוּף־דְּ֭בַשׁ אִמְרֵי־נֹ֑עַם מָת֥וֹק לַ֝נֶּ֗פֶשׁ וּמַרְפֵּ֥א לָעָֽצֶם׃
Translated:
Pleasant words are like a honeycomb,
Sweet to the palate and a cure for the body.
Transliteration: tsuf-devash imerey-noam matvok lanefesh umarefe laatsem

Hebrew: יֵ֤שׁ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יָ֭שָׁר לִפְנֵי־אִ֑ישׁ וְ֝אַחֲרִיתָ֗הּ דַּרְכֵי־מָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
A road may seem right to a man,
But in the end it is a road to death.
Transliteration: eish derekhe yashar lifeney-iysh veachariytah darekhey-mavet

Hebrew: נֶ֣פֶשׁ עָ֭מֵל עָ֣מְלָה לּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־אָכַ֖ף עָלָ֣יו פִּֽיהוּ׃
Translated:
The appetite of a laborer labors for him,
Because his hunger forces him on.
Transliteration: nefesh amel amelah lvo khiy-akhaf alayv fiyhu

Hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ בְּ֭לִיַּעַל כֹּרֶ֣ה רָעָ֑ה וְעַל־[שְׂ֝פָת֗וֹ] (שפתיו) כְּאֵ֣שׁ צָרָֽבֶת׃
Translated:
A scoundrel plots evil;
What is on his lips is like a scorching fire.
Transliteration: iysh veliyaal khoreh raah veal-[shefatvo] (shftyv) kheesh tsaravet

Hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ תַּ֭הְפֻּכוֹת יְשַׁלַּ֣ח מָד֑וֹן וְ֝נִרְגָּ֗ן מַפְרִ֥יד אַלּֽוּף׃
Translated:
A shifty man stirs up strife,
And a querulous one alienates his friend.
Transliteration: iysh tahefukhvot yeshalach madvon veniregan maferiyd aluf

Hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ חָ֭מָס יְפַתֶּ֣ה רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְ֝הוֹלִיכ֗וֹ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ לֹא־טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
A lawless man misleads his friend,
Making him take the wrong way.
Transliteration: iysh chamas yefateh reehu vehvoliykhvo vederekhe lo-tvov

Hebrew: עֹצֶ֣ה עֵ֭ינָיו לַחְשֹׁ֣ב תַּהְפֻּכ֑וֹת קֹרֵ֥ץ שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו כִּלָּ֥ה רָעָֽה׃
Translated:
He closes his eyes while meditating deception;
He purses his lips while deciding upon evil.
Transliteration: otseh eynayv lacheshov tahefukhvot korets shefatayv khilah raah

Hebrew: עֲטֶ֣רֶת תִּפְאֶ֣רֶת שֵׂיבָ֑ה בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ צְ֝דָקָ֗ה תִּמָּצֵֽא׃
Translated:
Gray hair is a crown of glory;
It is attained by the way of righteousness.
Transliteration: ateret tifeeret sheyvah vederekhe tsedakah timatse

Hebrew: ט֤וֹב אֶ֣רֶךְ אַ֭פַּיִם מִגִּבּ֑וֹר וּמֹשֵׁ֥ל בְּ֝רוּח֗וֹ מִלֹּכֵ֥ד עִֽיר׃
Translated:
Better to be forbearing than mighty,
To have self-control than to conquer a city.
Transliteration: tvov erekhe afayim migivvor umoshel veruchvo milokhed iyr

Hebrew: בַּ֭חֵיק יוּטַ֣ל אֶת־הַגּוֹרָ֑ל וּ֝מֵיְהֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־מִשְׁפָּטֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Lots are cast into the lap;
The decision depends on the LORD.
Transliteration: vacheyk yutal et-hagvoral umeyehovah khׇl-mishefatvo

Hebrew: ט֤וֹב פַּ֣ת חֲ֭רֵבָה וְשַׁלְוָה־בָ֑הּ מִ֝בַּ֗יִת מָלֵ֥א זִבְחֵי־רִֽיב׃
Translated:
Better a dry crust with peace
Than a house full of feasting with strife.
Transliteration: tvov fat charevah veshalevah-vah mivayiit male zivechey-riyv

Hebrew: עֶֽבֶד־מַשְׂכִּ֗יל יִ֭מְשֹׁל בְּבֵ֣ן מֵבִ֑ישׁ וּבְת֥וֹךְ אַ֝חִ֗ים יַחֲלֹ֥ק נַחֲלָֽה׃
Translated:
A capable servant will dominate an incompetent son
And share the inheritance with the brothers.
Transliteration: eved-mashekhiyl yimeshol veven meviysh uvetvokhe achiym yachalok nachalah

Hebrew: מַצְרֵ֣ף לַ֭כֶּסֶף וְכ֣וּר לַזָּהָ֑ב וּבֹחֵ֖ן לִבּ֣וֹת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
For silver—the crucible;
For gold—the furnace,
And the LORD tests the mind.
Transliteration: matseref lakhesef vekhur lazahav uvochen livvot yehovah

Hebrew: מֵ֭רַע מַקְשִׁ֣יב עַל־שְׂפַת־אָ֑וֶן שֶׁ֥קֶר מֵ֝זִ֗ין עַל־לְשׁ֥וֹן הַוֺּֽת׃
Translated:
An evildoer listens to mischievous talk;
A liar gives ear to malicious words.
Transliteration: mera makeshiyv al-shefat-aven sheker meziyn al-leshvon havot

Hebrew: לֹעֵ֣ג לָ֭רָשׁ חֵרֵ֣ף עֹשֵׂ֑הוּ שָׂמֵ֥חַ לְ֝אֵ֗יד לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶֽה׃
Translated:
He who mocks the poor affronts his Maker;
He who rejoices over another’s misfortune will not go unpunished.
Transliteration: loeg larash cheref oshehu shamecha leeyd lo yinakeh

Hebrew: עֲטֶ֣רֶת זְ֭קֵנִים בְּנֵ֣י בָנִ֑ים וְתִפְאֶ֖רֶת בָּנִ֣ים אֲבוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
Grandchildren are the crown of their elders,
And the glory of children is their parents.
Transliteration: ateret zekeniym veney vaniym vetifeeret vaniym avvotam

Hebrew: לֹא־נָאוָ֣ה לְנָבָ֣ל שְׂפַת־יֶ֑תֶר אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־לְנָדִ֥יב שְׂפַת־שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translated:
Lofty words are not fitting for a villain;
Much less lying words for a great man.
Transliteration: lo-navah lenaval shefat-yeter af khiy-lenadiyv shefat-shaker

Hebrew: אֶבֶן־חֵ֣ן הַ֭שֹּׁחַד בְּעֵינֵ֣י בְעָלָ֑יו אֶֽל־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֖ר יִפְנֶ֣ה יַשְׂכִּֽיל׃
Translated:
A bribe seems like a charm to him who uses it;
He succeeds at every turn.
Transliteration: even-chen hashochad veeyney vealayv el-khׇl-asher yifeneh yashekhiyl

Hebrew: מְֽכַסֶּה־פֶּ֭שַׁע מְבַקֵּ֣שׁ אַהֲבָ֑ה וְשֹׁנֶ֥ה בְ֝דָבָ֗ר מַפְרִ֥יד אַלּֽוּף׃
Translated:
He who seeks love overlooks faults,
But he who harps on a matter alienates his friend.
Transliteration: mekhaseh-fesha mevakesh ahavah veshoneh vedavar maferiyd aluf

Hebrew: תֵּ֣חַת גְּעָרָ֣ה בְמֵבִ֑ין מֵהַכּ֖וֹת כְּסִ֣יל מֵאָֽה׃
Translated:
A rebuke works on an intelligent man
More than one hundred blows on a fool.
Transliteration: techat gearah vemeviyn mehakhvot khesiyl meah

Hebrew: אַךְ־מְרִ֥י יְבַקֶּשׁ־רָ֑ע וּמַלְאָ֥ךְ אַ֝כְזָרִ֗י יְשֻׁלַּח־בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
An evil man seeks only to rebel;
A ruthless messenger will be sent against him.
Transliteration: akhe-meriy yevakesh-ra umaleakhe akhezariy yeshulach-vvo

Hebrew: פָּג֬וֹשׁ דֹּ֣ב שַׁכּ֣וּל בְּאִ֑ישׁ וְאַל־כְּ֝סִ֗יל בְּאִוַּלְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Sooner meet a bereaved she-bear
Than a fool with his nonsense.
Transliteration: fagvosh dov shakhul veiysh veal-khesiyl veivaletvo

Hebrew: מֵשִׁ֣יב רָ֭עָה תַּ֣חַת טוֹבָ֑ה לֹא־[תָמ֥וּשׁ] (תמיש) רָ֝עָ֗ה מִבֵּיתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Evil will never depart from the house
Of him who repays good with evil.
Transliteration: meshiyv raah tachat tvovah lo-[tamush] (tmysh) raah miveytvo

Hebrew: פּ֣וֹטֵֽר מַ֭יִם רֵאשִׁ֣ית מָד֑וֹן וְלִפְנֵ֥י הִ֝תְגַּלַּ֗ע הָרִ֥יב נְטֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated:
To start a quarrel is to open a sluice;
Before a dispute flares up, drop it.
Transliteration: fvoter mayiim reshiyt madvon velifeney hitegala hariyv netvosh

Hebrew: מַצְדִּ֣יק רָ֭שָׁע וּמַרְשִׁ֣יעַ צַדִּ֑יק תּוֹעֲבַ֥ת יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה גַּם־שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
To acquit the guilty and convict the innocent—
Both are an abomination to the LORD.
Transliteration: matsediyk rasha umareshiya tsadiyk tvoavat yehovah gam-sheneyhem

Hebrew: לָמָּה־זֶּ֣ה מְחִ֣יר בְּיַד־כְּסִ֑יל לִקְנ֖וֹת חׇכְמָ֣ה וְלֶב־אָֽיִן׃
Translated:
What good is money in the hand of a fool
To purchase wisdom, when he has no mind?
Transliteration: lamah-zeh mechiyr veyad-khesiyl likenvot chׇkhemah velev-ayiin

Hebrew: בְּכׇל־עֵ֭ת אֹהֵ֣ב הָרֵ֑עַ וְאָ֥ח לְ֝צָרָ֗ה יִוָּלֵֽד׃
Translated:
A friend is devoted at all times;
A brother is born to share adversity.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-et ohev harea veach letsarah yivaled

Hebrew: אָדָ֣ם חֲסַר־לֵ֭ב תּוֹקֵ֣עַ כָּ֑ף עֹרֵ֥ב עֲ֝רֻבָּ֗ה לִפְנֵ֥י רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
Devoid of sense is he who gives his hand
To stand surety for his fellow.
Transliteration: adam chasar-lev tvokea khaf orev aruvah lifeney reehu

Hebrew: אֹ֣הֵֽב פֶּ֭שַׁע אֹהֵ֣ב מַצָּ֑ה מַגְבִּ֥יהַּ פִּ֝תְח֗וֹ מְבַקֶּשׁ־שָֽׁבֶר׃
Translated:
He who loves transgression loves strife;
He who builds a high threshold invites broken bones.
Transliteration: ohev fesha ohev matsah mageviyha fitechvo mevakesh-shaver

Hebrew: עִקֶּשׁ־לֵ֭ב לֹ֣א יִמְצָא־ט֑וֹב וְנֶהְפָּ֥ךְ בִּ֝לְשׁוֹנ֗וֹ יִפּ֥וֹל בְּרָעָֽה׃
Translated:
Man of crooked mind comes to no good,
And he who speaks duplicity falls into trouble.
Transliteration: ikesh-lev lo yimetsa-tvov venehefakhe vileshvonvo yifvol veraah

Hebrew: יֹלֵ֣ד כְּ֭סִיל לְת֣וּגָה ל֑וֹ וְלֹא־יִ֝שְׂמַ֗ח אֲבִ֣י נָבָֽל׃
Translated:
One begets a dullard to one’s own grief;
The father of a villain has no joy.
Transliteration: yoled khesiyl letugah lvo velo-yishemach aviy naval

Hebrew: לֵ֣ב שָׂ֭מֵחַ יֵיטִ֣יב גֵּהָ֑ה וְר֥וּחַ נְ֝כֵאָ֗ה תְּיַבֶּשׁ־גָּֽרֶם׃
Translated:
A joyful heart makes for good health;
Despondency dries up the bones.
Transliteration: lev shamecha eiytiyv gehah verucha nekheah teyavesh-garem

Hebrew: שֹׁ֣חַד מֵ֭חֵק רָשָׁ֣ע יִקָּ֑ח לְ֝הַטּ֗וֹת אׇרְח֥וֹת מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
The wicked man draws a bribe out of his bosom
To pervert the course of justice.
Transliteration: shochad mechek rasha yikach lehatvot ׇrechvot mishefat

Hebrew: אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י מֵבִ֣ין חׇכְמָ֑ה וְעֵינֵ֥י כְ֝סִ֗יל בִּקְצֵה־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Wisdom lies before the intelligent man;
The eyes of the dullard range to the ends of the earth.
Transliteration: et-feney meviyn chׇkhemah veeyney khesiyl viketseh-arets

Hebrew: כַּ֣עַס לְ֭אָבִיו בֵּ֣ן כְּסִ֑יל וּ֝מֶ֗מֶר לְיֽוֹלַדְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
A stupid son is vexation for his father
And a heartache for the woman who bore him.
Transliteration: khaas leaviyv ven khesiyl umemer leyvoladetvo

Hebrew: גַּ֤ם עֲנ֣וֹשׁ לַצַּדִּ֣יק לֹא־ט֑וֹב לְהַכּ֖וֹת נְדִיבִ֣ים עַל־יֹֽשֶׁר׃
Translated:
To punish the innocent is surely not right,
Or to flog the great for their uprightness.
Transliteration: gam anvosh latsadiyk lo-tvov lehakhvot nediyviym al-yosher

Hebrew: חוֹשֵׂ֣ךְ אֲ֭מָרָיו יוֹדֵ֣עַ דָּ֑עַת (וקר) [יְקַר־]ר֝֗וּחַ אִ֣ישׁ תְּבוּנָֽה׃
Translated:
A knowledgeable man is sparing with his words;
A man of understanding is reticent.
Transliteration: chvoshekhe amarayv yvodea daat (vkr) [yekar-]ruucha iysh tevunah

Hebrew: גַּ֤ם אֱוִ֣יל מַ֭חֲרִישׁ חָכָ֣ם יֵחָשֵׁ֑ב אֹטֵ֖ם שְׂפָתָ֣יו נָבֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Even a fool, if he keeps silent, is deemed wise;
Intelligent, if he seals his lips.
Transliteration: gam eviyl machariysh chakham eichashev otem shefatayv navvon

Hebrew: לְֽ֭תַאֲוָה יְבַקֵּ֣שׁ נִפְרָ֑ד בְּכׇל־תּ֝וּשִׁיָּ֗ה יִתְגַּלָּֽע׃
Translated:
He who isolates himself pursues his desires;
He disdains all competence.
Transliteration: letaavah yevakesh niferad vekhׇl-tushiyah yitegala

Hebrew: לֹא־יַחְפֹּ֣ץ כְּ֭סִיל בִּתְבוּנָ֑ה כִּ֝֗י אִֽם־בְּהִתְגַּלּ֥וֹת לִבּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The fool does not desire understanding,
But only to air his thoughts.
Transliteration: lo-yachefots khesiyl vitevunah khiy im-vehitegalvot livvo

Hebrew: בְּֽבוֹא־רָ֭שָׁע בָּ֣א גַם־בּ֑וּז וְֽעִם־קָל֥וֹן חֶרְפָּֽה׃
Translated:
Comes the wicked man comes derision,
And with the rogue, contempt.
Transliteration: vevvo-rasha va gam-vuz veim-kalvon cherefah

Hebrew: מַ֣יִם עֲ֭מֻקִּים דִּבְרֵ֣י פִי־אִ֑ישׁ נַ֥חַל נֹ֝בֵ֗עַ מְק֣וֹר חׇכְמָֽה׃
Translated:
The words a man speaks are deep waters,
A flowing stream, a fountain of wisdom.
Transliteration: mayiim amukiym diverey fiy-iysh nachal novea mekvor chׇkhemah

Hebrew: שְׂאֵ֣ת פְּנֵי־רָשָׁ֣ע לֹא־ט֑וֹב לְהַטּ֥וֹת צַ֝דִּ֗יק בַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
It is not right to be partial to the guilty
And subvert the innocent in judgment.
Transliteration: sheet feney-rasha lo-tvov lehatvot tsadiyk vamishefat

Hebrew: שִׂפְתֵ֣י כְ֭סִיל יָבֹ֣אוּ בְרִ֑יב וּ֝פִ֗יו לְֽמַהֲלֻמ֥וֹת יִקְרָֽא׃
Translated:
The words of a fool lead to strife;
His speech invites blows.
Transliteration: shifetey khesiyl yavou veriyv ufiyv lemahalumvot yikera

Hebrew: פִּֽי־כְ֭סִיל מְחִתָּה־ל֑וֹ וּ֝שְׂפָתָ֗יו מוֹקֵ֥שׁ נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
The fool’s speech is his ruin;
His words are a trap for him.
Transliteration: fiy-khesiyl mechitah-lvo ushefatayv mvokesh nafeshvo

Hebrew: דִּבְרֵ֣י נִ֭רְגָּן כְּמִֽתְלַהֲמִ֑ים וְ֝הֵ֗ם יָרְד֥וּ חַדְרֵי־בָֽטֶן׃
Translated:
The words of a querulous man are bruising;
They penetrate one’s inmost parts.
Transliteration: diverey niregan khemitelahamiym vehem yaredu chaderey-vaten

Hebrew: גַּ֭ם מִתְרַפֶּ֣ה בִמְלַאכְתּ֑וֹ אָ֥ח ה֝֗וּא לְבַ֣עַל מַשְׁחִֽית׃
Translated:
One who is slack in his work
Is a brother to a vandal.
Transliteration: gam miterafeh vimelakhetvo ach huu levaal mashechiyt

Hebrew: מִגְדַּל־עֹ֭ז שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה בּֽוֹ־יָר֖וּץ צַדִּ֣יק וְנִשְׂגָּֽב׃
Translated:
The name of the LORD is a tower of strength
To which the righteous man runs and is safe.
Transliteration: migedal-oz shem yehovah vvo-yaruts tsadiyk venishegav

Hebrew: ה֣וֹן עָ֭שִׁיר קִרְיַ֣ת עֻזּ֑וֹ וּכְחוֹמָ֥ה נִ֝שְׂגָּבָ֗ה בְּמַשְׂכִּתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The wealth of a rich man is his fortress;
In his fancy it is a protective wall.
Transliteration: hvon ashiyr kireyat uzvo ukhechvomah nishegavah vemashekhitvo

Hebrew: לִפְנֵי־שֶׁ֭בֶר יִגְבַּ֣הּ לֶב־אִ֑ישׁ וְלִפְנֵ֖י כָב֣וֹד עֲנָוָֽה׃
Translated:
Before ruin a man’s heart is proud;
Humility goes before honor.
Transliteration: lifeney-shever yigevah lev-iysh velifeney khavvod anavah

Hebrew: מֵשִׁ֣יב דָּ֭בָר בְּטֶ֣רֶם יִשְׁמָ֑ע אִוֶּ֥לֶת הִיא־ל֝֗וֹ וּכְלִמָּֽה׃
Translated:
To answer a man before hearing him out
Is foolish and disgraceful.
Transliteration: meshiyv davar veterem yishema ivelet hiy-lvo ukhelimah

Hebrew: רֽוּחַ־אִ֭ישׁ יְכַלְכֵּ֣ל מַחֲלֵ֑הוּ וְר֥וּחַ נְ֝כֵאָ֗ה מִ֣י יִשָּׂאֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
A man’s spirit can sustain him through illness;
But low spirits—who can bear them?
Transliteration: rucha-iysh yekhalekhel machalehu verucha nekheah miy yishaenah

Hebrew: לֵ֣ב נָ֭בוֹן יִקְנֶה־דָּ֑עַת וְאֹ֥זֶן חֲ֝כָמִ֗ים תְּבַקֶּשׁ־דָּֽעַת׃
Translated:
The mind of an intelligent man acquires knowledge;
The ears of the wise seek out knowledge.
Transliteration: lev navvon yikeneh-daat veozen chakhamiym tevakesh-daat

Hebrew: מַתָּ֣ן אָ֭דָם יַרְחִ֣יב ל֑וֹ וְלִפְנֵ֖י גְדֹלִ֣ים יַנְחֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
A man’s gift eases his way
And gives him access to the great.
Transliteration: matan adam yarechiyv lvo velifeney gedoliym yanechenu

Hebrew: צַדִּ֣יק הָרִאשׁ֣וֹן בְּרִיב֑וֹ (יבא) [וּבָֽא־]רֵ֝עֵ֗הוּ וַחֲקָרֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The first to plead his case seems right
Till the other party examines him.
Transliteration: tsadiyk harishvon veriyvvo (yv) [uva-]reehu vachakarvo

Hebrew: מִ֭דְיָנִים יַשְׁבִּ֣ית הַגּוֹרָ֑ל וּבֵ֖ין עֲצוּמִ֣ים יַפְרִֽיד׃
Translated:
The lot puts an end to strife
And separates those locked in dispute.
Transliteration: mideyaniym yasheviyt hagvoral uveyn atsumiym yaferiyd

Hebrew: אָ֗ח נִפְשָׁ֥ע מִקִּרְיַת־עֹ֑ז (ומדונים) [וּ֝מִדְיָנִ֗ים] כִּבְרִ֥יחַ אַרְמֽוֹן׃
Translated:
A brother offended is more formidable than a stronghold;
Such strife is like the bars of a fortress.
Transliteration: ach nifesha mikireyat-oz (vmdvnym) [umideyaniym] khiveriycha aremvon

Hebrew: מִפְּרִ֣י פִי־אִ֭ישׁ תִּשְׂבַּ֣ע בִּטְנ֑וֹ תְּבוּאַ֖ת שְׂפָתָ֣יו יִשְׂבָּֽע׃
Translated:
A man’s belly is filled by the fruit of his mouth;
He will be filled by the produce of his lips.
Transliteration: miferiy fiy-iysh tisheva vitenvo tevuat shefatayv yisheva

Hebrew: מָ֣וֶת וְ֭חַיִּים בְּיַד־לָשׁ֑וֹן וְ֝אֹהֲבֶ֗יהָ יֹאכַ֥ל פִּרְיָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Death and life are in the power of the tongue;
Those who love it will eat its fruit.
Transliteration: mavet vechayiym veyad-lashvon veohaveyha yokhal fireyah

Hebrew: מָצָ֣א אִ֭שָּׁה מָ֣צָא ט֑וֹב וַיָּ֥פֶק רָ֝צ֗וֹן מֵיְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
He who finds a wife has found happiness
And has won the favor of the LORD.
Transliteration: matsa ishah matsa tvov vayafek ratsvon meyehovah

Hebrew: תַּחֲנוּנִ֥ים יְדַבֶּר־רָ֑שׁ וְ֝עָשִׁ֗יר יַעֲנֶ֥ה עַזּֽוֹת׃
Translated:
The poor man speaks beseechingly;
The rich man’s answer is harsh.
Transliteration: tachanuniym yedaver-rash veashiyr yaaneh azvot

Hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ רֵ֭עִים לְהִתְרֹעֵ֑עַ וְיֵ֥שׁ אֹ֝הֵ֗ב דָּבֵ֥ק מֵאָֽח׃
Translated:
There are companions to keep one company,
And there is a friend more devoted than a brother.
Transliteration: iysh reiym lehiteroea veeish ohev davek meach

Hebrew: טֽוֹב־רָ֭שׁ הוֹלֵ֣ךְ בְּתֻמּ֑וֹ מֵעִקֵּ֥שׁ שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו וְה֣וּא כְסִֽיל׃
Translated:
Better a poor man who lives blamelessly
Than one who speaks perversely and is a dullard.
Transliteration: tvov-rash hvolekhe vetumvo meikesh shefatayv vehu khesiyl

Hebrew: גַּ֤ם בְּלֹא־דַ֣עַת נֶ֣פֶשׁ לֹא־ט֑וֹב וְאָ֖ץ בְּרַגְלַ֣יִם חוֹטֵֽא׃
Translated:
A person without knowledge is surely not good;
He who moves hurriedly blunders.
Transliteration: gam velo-daat nefesh lo-tvov veats veragelayiim chvote

Hebrew: אִוֶּ֣לֶת אָ֭דָם תְּסַלֵּ֣ף דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וְעַל־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה יִזְעַ֥ף לִבּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
A man’s folly subverts his way,
And his heart rages against the LORD.
Transliteration: ivelet adam tesalef darekhvo veal-yehovah yizeaf livvo

Hebrew: ה֗וֹן יֹ֭סִיף רֵעִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים וְ֝דָ֗ל מֵרֵעֵ֥הוּ יִפָּרֵֽד׃
Translated:
Wealth makes many friends,
But a poor man loses his last friend.
Transliteration: hvon yosiyf reiym raviym vedal mereehu yifared

Hebrew: עֵ֣ד שְׁ֭קָרִים לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶ֑ה וְיָפִ֥יחַ כְּ֝זָבִ֗ים לֹ֣א יִמָּלֵֽט׃
Translated:
A false witness will not go unpunished;
He who testifies lies will not escape.
Transliteration: ed shekariym lo yinakeh veyafiycha khezaviym lo yimalet

Hebrew: רַ֭בִּים יְחַלּ֣וּ פְנֵֽי־נָדִ֑יב וְכׇל־הָ֝רֵ֗עַ לְאִ֣ישׁ מַתָּֽן׃
Translated:
Many court the favor of a great man,
And all are the friends of a dispenser of gifts.
Transliteration: raviym yechalu feney-nadiyv vekhׇl-harea leiysh matan

Hebrew: כׇּ֥ל־אֲחֵי־רָ֨שׁ ׀ שְֽׂנֵאֻ֗הוּ אַ֤ף כִּ֣י מְ֭רֵעֵהוּ רָחֲק֣וּ מִמֶּ֑נּוּ מְרַדֵּ֖ף אֲמָרִ֣ים (לא) [לוֹ־]הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated:
All the brothers of a poor man despise him;
How much more is he shunned by his friends!
He who pursues words—they are of no avail.
Transliteration: khׇl-achey-rash sheneuhu af khiy mereehu rachaku mimenu meradef amariym (l) [lvo-]hemah

Hebrew: קֹֽנֶה־לֵּ֭ב אֹהֵ֣ב נַפְשׁ֑וֹ שֹׁמֵ֥ר תְּ֝בוּנָ֗ה לִמְצֹא־טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
He who acquires wisdom is his own best friend;
He preserves understanding and attains happiness.
Transliteration: koneh-lev ohev nafeshvo shomer tevunah limetso-tvov

Hebrew: עֵ֣ד שְׁ֭קָרִים לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶ֑ה וְיָפִ֖יחַ כְּזָבִ֣ים יֹאבֵֽד׃ {פ}
Translated:
A false witness will not go unpunished;
He who testifies falsely is doomed.
Transliteration: ed shekariym lo yinakeh veyafiycha khezaviym yoved {f}

Hebrew: לֹא־נָאוֶ֣ה לִכְסִ֣יל תַּעֲנ֑וּג אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־לְעֶ֤בֶד ׀ מְשֹׁ֬ל בְּשָׂרִֽים׃
Translated:
Luxury is not fitting for a dullard,
Much less that a servant rule over princes.
Transliteration: lo-naveh likhesiyl taanug af khiy-leeved meshol veshariym

Hebrew: שֵׂ֣כֶל אָ֭דָם הֶאֱרִ֣יךְ אַפּ֑וֹ וְ֝תִפְאַרְתּ֗וֹ עֲבֹ֣ר עַל־פָּֽשַׁע׃
Translated:
A man shows intelligence by his forebearance;
It is his glory when he overlooks an offense.
Transliteration: shekhel adam heeriykhe afvo vetifearetvo avor al-fasha

Hebrew: נַ֣הַם כַּ֭כְּפִיר זַ֣עַף מֶ֑לֶךְ וּכְטַ֖ל עַל־עֵ֣שֶׂב רְצוֹנֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The rage of a king is like the roar of a lion;
His favor is like dew upon the grass.
Transliteration: naham khakhefiyr zaaf melekhe ukhetal al-eshev retsvonvo

Hebrew: הַוֺּ֣ת לְ֭אָבִיו בֵּ֣ן כְּסִ֑יל וְדֶ֥לֶף טֹ֝רֵ֗ד מִדְיְנֵ֥י אִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated:
A stupid son is a calamity to his father;
The nagging of a wife is like the endless dripping of water.
Transliteration: havot leaviyv ven khesiyl vedelef tored mideyeney ishah

Hebrew: בַּ֣יִת וָ֭הוֹן נַחֲלַ֣ת אָב֑וֹת וּ֝מֵיְהֹוָ֗ה אִשָּׁ֥ה מַשְׂכָּֽלֶת׃
Translated:
Property and riches are bequeathed by fathers,
But an efficient wife comes from the LORD.
Transliteration: vayiit vahvon nachalat avvot umeyehovah ishah mashekhalet

Hebrew: עַ֭צְלָה תַּפִּ֣יל תַּרְדֵּמָ֑ה וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ רְמִיָּ֣ה תִרְעָֽב׃
Translated:
Laziness induces sleep,
And a negligent person will go hungry.
Transliteration: atselah tafiyl taredemah venefesh remiyah tireav

Hebrew: שֹׁמֵ֣ר מִ֭צְוָה שֹׁמֵ֣ר נַפְשׁ֑וֹ בּוֹזֵ֖ה דְרָכָ֣יו (יומת) [יָמֽוּת]׃
Translated:
He who has regard for his life pays regard to commandments;
He who is heedless of his ways will die.
Transliteration: shomer mitsevah shomer nafeshvo vvozeh derakhayv (yvmt) [yamut]

Hebrew: מַלְוֵ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה ח֣וֹנֵֽן דָּ֑ל וּ֝גְמֻל֗וֹ יְשַׁלֶּם־לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He who is generous to the poor makes a loan to the LORD;
He will repay him his due.
Transliteration: maleveh yehovah chvonen dal ugemulvo yeshalem-lvo

Hebrew: יַסֵּ֣ר בִּ֭נְךָ כִּֽי־יֵ֣שׁ תִּקְוָ֑ה וְאֶל־הֲ֝מִית֗וֹ אַל־תִּשָּׂ֥א נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated:
Discipline your son while there is still hope,
And do not set your heart on his destruction.
Transliteration: yaser vinekha khiy-eish tikevah veel-hamiytvo al-tisha nafeshekha

Hebrew: (גרל) [גְּֽדׇל־]חֵ֭מָה נֹ֣שֵׂא עֹ֑נֶשׁ כִּ֥י אִם־תַּ֝צִּ֗יל וְע֣וֹד תּוֹסִֽף׃
Translated:
A hot-tempered man incurs punishment;
If you try to save him you will only make it worse.
Transliteration: (grl) [gedׇl-]chemah noshe onesh khiy im-tatsiyl vevod tvosif

Hebrew: שְׁמַ֣ע עֵ֭צָה וְקַבֵּ֣ל מוּסָ֑ר לְ֝מַ֗עַן תֶּחְכַּ֥ם בְּאַחֲרִיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Listen to advice and accept discipline
In order that you may be wise in the end.
Transliteration: shema etsah vekavel musar lemaan techekham veachariytekha

Hebrew: רַבּ֣וֹת מַחֲשָׁב֣וֹת בְּלֶב־אִ֑ישׁ וַעֲצַ֥ת יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה הִ֣יא תָקֽוּם׃
Translated:
Many designs are in a man’s mind,
But it is the LORD’s plan that is accomplished.
Transliteration: ravvot machashavvot velev-iysh vaatsat yehovah hiy takum

Hebrew: תַּאֲוַ֣ת אָדָ֣ם חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְטֽוֹב־רָ֝֗שׁ מֵאִ֥ישׁ כָּזָֽב׃
Translated:
Greed is a reproach to a man;
Better be poor than a liar.
Transliteration: taavat adam chasedvo vetvov-rash meiysh khazav

Hebrew: יִרְאַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֣ה לְחַיִּ֑ים וְשָׂבֵ֥עַ יָ֝לִ֗ין בַּל־יִפָּ֥קֶד רָֽע׃
Translated:
He who fears the LORD earns life;
He shall abide in contentment,
Free from misfortune.
Transliteration: yireat yehovah lechayiym veshavea yaliyn val-yifaked ra

Hebrew: טָ֘מַ֤ן עָצֵ֣ל יָ֭דוֹ בַּצַּלָּ֑חַת גַּם־אֶל־פִּ֝֗יהוּ לֹ֣א יְשִׁיבֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
The lazy man buries his hand in the bowl;
He will not even bring it to his mouth.
Transliteration: taman atsel yadvo vatsalachat gam-el-fiyhu lo yeshiyvenah

Hebrew: לֵ֣ץ תַּ֭כֶּה וּפֶ֣תִי יַעְרִ֑ם וְהוֹכִ֥יחַ לְ֝נָב֗וֹן יָבִ֥ין דָּֽעַת׃
Translated:
Beat the scoffer and the simple will become clever;
Reprove an intelligent man and he gains knowledge.
Transliteration: lets takheh ufetiy yaerim vehvokhiycha lenavvon yaviyn daat

Hebrew: מְֽשַׁדֶּד־אָ֭ב יַבְרִ֣יחַ אֵ֑ם בֵּ֝֗ן מֵבִ֥ישׁ וּמַחְפִּֽיר׃
Translated:
A son who causes shame and disgrace
Plunders his father, puts his mother to flight.
Transliteration: meshaded-av yaveriycha em ven meviysh umachefiyr

Hebrew: חֲֽדַל־בְּ֭נִי לִשְׁמֹ֣עַ מוּסָ֑ר לִ֝שְׁג֗וֹת מֵאִמְרֵי־דָֽעַת׃
Translated:
My son, cease to stray from words of knowledge
And receive discipline.
Transliteration: chadal-veniy lishemoa musar lishegvot meimerey-daat

Hebrew: עֵ֣ד בְּ֭לִיַּעַל יָלִ֣יץ מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יְבַלַּע־אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
A malicious witness scoffs at justice,
And the speech of the wicked conceals mischief.
Transliteration: ed veliyaal yaliyts mishefat ufiy reshaiym yevala-aven

Hebrew: נָכ֣וֹנוּ לַלֵּצִ֣ים שְׁפָטִ֑ים וּ֝מַהֲלֻמ֗וֹת לְגֵ֣ו כְּסִילִֽים׃
Translated:
Punishments are in store for scoffers
And blows for the backs of dullards.
Transliteration: nakhvonu laletsiym shefatiym umahalumvot legev khesiyliym

Hebrew: לֵ֣ץ הַ֭יַּיִן הֹמֶ֣ה שֵׁכָ֑ר וְכׇל־שֹׁ֥גֶה בּ֝֗וֹ לֹ֣א יֶחְכָּֽם׃
Translated:
Wine is a scoffer, strong drink a roisterer;
He who is muddled by them will not grow wise.
Transliteration: lets hayayin homeh shekhar vekhׇl-shogeh vvo lo yechekham

Hebrew: נַ֣הַם כַּ֭כְּפִיר אֵ֣ימַת מֶ֑לֶךְ מִ֝תְעַבְּר֗וֹ חוֹטֵ֥א נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
The terror of a king is like the roar of a lion;
He who provokes his anger risks his life.
Transliteration: naham khakhefiyr eymat melekhe miteavervo chvote nafeshvo

Hebrew: כָּב֣וֹד לָ֭אִישׁ שֶׁ֣בֶת מֵרִ֑יב וְכׇל־אֱ֝וִ֗יל יִתְגַּלָּֽע׃
Translated:
It is honorable for a man to desist from strife,
But every fool becomes embroiled.
Transliteration: khavvod laiysh shevet meriyv vekhׇl-eviyl yitegala

Hebrew: מֵ֭חֹרֶף עָצֵ֣ל לֹא־יַחֲרֹ֑שׁ (ישאל) [וְשָׁאַ֖ל] בַּקָּצִ֣יר וָאָֽיִן׃
Translated:
In winter the lazy man does not plow;
At harvesttime he seeks, and finds nothing.
Transliteration: mechoref atsel lo-yacharosh (yshl) [veshaal] vakatsiyr vaayiin

Hebrew: מַ֣יִם עֲ֭מֻקִּים עֵצָ֣ה בְלֶב־אִ֑ישׁ וְאִ֖ישׁ תְּבוּנָ֣ה יִדְלֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
The designs in a man’s mind are deep waters,
But a man of understanding can draw them out.
Transliteration: mayiim amukiym etsah velev-iysh veiysh tevunah yidelenah

Hebrew: רׇב־אָדָ֗ם יִ֭קְרָא אִ֣ישׁ חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְאִ֥ישׁ אֱ֝מוּנִ֗ים מִ֣י יִמְצָֽא׃
Translated:
He calls many a man his loyal friend,
But who can find a faithful man?
Transliteration: rׇv-adam yikera iysh chasedvo veiysh emuniym miy yimetsa

Hebrew: מִתְהַלֵּ֣ךְ בְּתֻמּ֣וֹ צַדִּ֑יק אַשְׁרֵ֖י בָנָ֣יו אַחֲרָֽיו׃
Translated:
The righteous man lives blamelessly;
Happy are his children who come after him.
Transliteration: mitehalekhe vetumvo tsadiyk asherey vanayv acharayv

Hebrew: מֶ֗לֶךְ יוֹשֵׁ֥ב עַל־כִּסֵּא־דִ֑ין מְזָרֶ֖ה בְעֵינָ֣יו כׇּל־רָֽע׃
Translated:
The king seated on the throne of judgment
Can winnow out all evil by his glance.
Transliteration: melekhe yvoshev al-khise-diyn mezareh veeynayv khׇl-ra

Hebrew: מִֽי־יֹ֭אמַר זִכִּ֣יתִי לִבִּ֑י טָ֝הַ֗רְתִּי מֵחַטָּאתִֽי׃
Translated:
Who can say, “I have cleansed my heart,
I am purged of my sin”?
Transliteration: miy-yomar zikhiytiy liviy taharetiy mechatatiy

Hebrew: אֶ֣בֶן וָ֭אֶבֶן אֵיפָ֣ה וְאֵיפָ֑ה תּוֹעֲבַ֥ת יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה גַּם־שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
False weights and false measures,
Both are an abomination to the LORD.
Transliteration: even vaeven eyfah veeyfah tvoavat yehovah gam-sheneyhem

Hebrew: גַּ֣ם בְּ֭מַעֲלָלָיו יִתְנַכֶּר־נָ֑עַר אִם־זַ֖ךְ וְאִם־יָשָׁ֣ר פׇּעֳלֽוֹ׃
Translated:
A child may be dissembling in his behavior
Even though his actions are blameless and proper.
Transliteration: gam vemaalalayv yitenakher-naar im-zakhe veim-yashar fׇolvo

Hebrew: אֹ֣זֶן שֹׁ֭מַעַת וְעַ֣יִן רֹאָ֑ה יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה עָשָׂ֥ה גַם־שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
The ear that hears, the eye that sees—
The LORD made them both.
Transliteration: ozen shomaat veayiin roah yehovah ashah gam-sheneyhem

Hebrew: אַל־תֶּאֱהַ֣ב שֵׁ֭נָה פֶּן־תִּוָּרֵ֑שׁ פְּקַ֖ח עֵינֶ֣יךָ שְֽׂבַֽע־לָֽחֶם׃
Translated:
Do not love sleep lest you be impoverished;
Keep your eyes open and you will have plenty of food.
Transliteration: al-teehav shenah fen-tivaresh fekach eyneykha sheva-lachem

Hebrew: רַ֣ע רַ֭ע יֹאמַ֣ר הַקּוֹנֶ֑ה וְאֹזֵ֥ל ל֝֗וֹ אָ֣ז יִתְהַלָּֽל׃
Translated:
“Bad, bad,” says the buyer,
But having moved off, he congratulates himself.
Transliteration: ra ra yomar hakvoneh veozel lvo az yitehalal

Hebrew: יֵ֣שׁ זָ֭הָב וְרׇב־פְּנִינִ֑ים וּכְלִ֥י יְ֝קָ֗ר שִׂפְתֵי־דָֽעַת׃
Translated:
Gold is plentiful, jewels abundant,
But wise speech is a precious object.
Transliteration: eish zahav verׇv-feniyniym ukheliy yekar shifetey-daat

Hebrew: לְֽקַח־בִּ֭גְדוֹ כִּי־עָ֣רַב זָ֑ר וּבְעַ֖ד (נכרים) [נׇכְרִיָּ֣ה] חַבְלֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
Seize his garment, for he stood surety for another;
Take it as a pledge, [for he stood surety] for an unfamiliar woman.
Transliteration: lekach-vigedvo khiy-arav zar uvead (nkhrym) [nׇkheriyah] chavelehu

Hebrew: עָרֵ֣ב לָ֭אִישׁ לֶ֣חֶם שָׁ֑קֶר וְ֝אַחַ֗ר יִמָּֽלֵא־פִ֥יהוּ חָצָֽץ׃
Translated:
Bread gained by fraud may be tasty to a man,
But later his mouth will be filled with gravel.
Transliteration: arev laiysh lechem shaker veachar yimale-fiyhu chatsats

Hebrew: מַ֭חֲשָׁבוֹת בְּעֵצָ֣ה תִכּ֑וֹן וּ֝בְתַחְבֻּל֗וֹת עֲשֵׂ֣ה מִלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
Plans laid in council will succeed;
Wage war with stratagems.
Transliteration: machashavvot veetsah tikhvon uvetachevulvot asheh milechamah

Hebrew: גּֽוֹלֶה־סּ֭וֹד הוֹלֵ֣ךְ רָכִ֑יל וּלְפֹתֶ֥ה שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִתְעָרָֽב׃
Translated:
He who gives away secrets is a base fellow;
Do not take up with a garrulous man.
Transliteration: gvoleh-svod hvolekhe rakhiyl ulefoteh shefatayv lo titearav

Hebrew: מְ֭קַלֵּל אָבִ֣יו וְאִמּ֑וֹ יִֽדְעַ֥ךְ נֵ֝ר֗וֹ (באישון) [בֶּאֱשׁ֥וּן] חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
Translated:
One who reviles his father or mother,
Light will fail him when darkness comes.
Transliteration: mekalel aviyv veimvo yideakhe nervo (vyshvn) [veeshun] choshekhe

Hebrew: נַ֭חֲלָה (מבחלת) [מְבֹהֶ֣לֶת] בָּרִאשׁוֹנָ֑ה וְ֝אַחֲרִיתָ֗הּ לֹ֣א תְבֹרָֽךְ׃
Translated:
An estate acquired in haste at the outset
Will not be blessed in the end.
Transliteration: nachalah (mvchlt) [mevohelet] varishvonah veachariytah lo tevorakhe

Hebrew: אַל־תֹּאמַ֥ר אֲשַׁלְּמָה־רָ֑ע קַוֵּ֥ה לַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה וְיֹ֣שַֽׁע לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
Do not say, “I will requite evil”;
Put your hope in the LORD and He will deliver you.
Transliteration: al-tomar ashalemah-ra kaveh layhovah veyosha lakhe

Hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה אֶ֣בֶן וָאָ֑בֶן וּמֹאזְנֵ֖י מִרְמָ֣ה לֹא־טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
False weights are an abomination to the LORD;
Dishonest scales are not right.
Transliteration: tvoavat yehovah even vaaven umozeney miremah lo-tvov

Hebrew: מֵיְהֹוָ֥ה מִצְעֲדֵי־גָ֑בֶר וְ֝אָדָ֗ם מַה־יָּבִ֥ין דַּרְכּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
A man’s steps are decided by the LORD;
What does a man know about his own way?
Transliteration: meyehovah mitseadey-gaver veadam mah-yaviyn darekhvo

Hebrew: מוֹקֵ֣שׁ אָ֭דָם יָ֣לַע קֹ֑דֶשׁ וְאַחַ֖ר נְדָרִ֣ים לְבַקֵּֽר׃
Translated:
It is a snare for a man to pledge a sacred gift rashly
And to give thought to his vows only after they have been made.
Transliteration: mvokesh adam yala kodesh veachar nedariym levaker

Hebrew: מְזָרֶ֣ה רְ֭שָׁעִים מֶ֣לֶךְ חָכָ֑ם וַיָּ֖שֶׁב עֲלֵיהֶ֣ם אוֹפָֽן׃
Translated:
A wise king winnows out the wicked,
And turns the wheel upon them.
Transliteration: mezareh reshaiym melekhe chakham vayashev aleyhem vofan

Hebrew: נֵ֣ר יְ֭הֹוָה נִשְׁמַ֣ת אָדָ֑ם חֹ֝פֵ֗שׂ כׇּל־חַדְרֵי־בָֽטֶן׃
Translated:
The lifebreath of man is the lamp of the LORD
Revealing all his inmost parts.
Transliteration: ner yehovah nishemat adam chofesh khׇl-chaderey-vaten

Hebrew: חֶ֣סֶד וֶ֭אֱמֶת יִצְּרוּ־מֶ֑לֶךְ וְסָעַ֖ד בַּחֶ֣סֶד כִּסְאֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Faithfulness and loyalty protect the king;
He maintains his throne by faithfulness.
Transliteration: chesed veemet yitseru-melekhe vesaad vachesed khisevo

Hebrew: תִּפְאֶ֣רֶת בַּחוּרִ֣ים כֹּחָ֑ם וַהֲדַ֖ר זְקֵנִ֣ים שֵׂיבָֽה׃
Translated:
The glory of youths is their strength;
The majesty of old men is their gray hair.
Transliteration: tifeeret vachuriym khocham vahadar zekeniym sheyvah

Hebrew: חַבֻּר֣וֹת פֶּ֭צַע (תמריק) [תַּמְר֣וּק] בְּרָ֑ע וּ֝מַכּ֗וֹת חַדְרֵי־בָֽטֶן׃
Translated:
Bruises and wounds are repayment for evil,
Striking at one’s inmost parts.
Transliteration: chavurvot fetsa (tmryk) [tameruk] vera umakhvot chaderey-vaten

Hebrew: פַּלְגֵי־מַ֣יִם לֶב־מֶ֭לֶךְ בְּיַד־יְהֹוָ֑ה עַֽל־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֖ר יַחְפֹּ֣ץ יַטֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
Like channeled water is the mind of the king in the LORD’s hand;
He directs it to whatever He wishes.
Transliteration: falegey-mayiim lev-melekhe veyad-yehovah al-khׇl-asher yachefots yatenu

Hebrew: כׇּֽל־דֶּרֶךְ־אִ֭ישׁ יָשָׁ֣ר בְּעֵינָ֑יו וְתֹכֵ֖ן לִבּ֣וֹת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
All the ways of a man seem right to him,
But the LORD probes the mind.
Transliteration: khׇl-derekhe-iysh yashar veeynayv vetokhen livvot yehovah

Hebrew: עֲ֭שֹׂה צְדָקָ֣ה וּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט נִבְחָ֖ר לַיהֹוָ֣ה מִזָּֽבַח׃
Translated:
To do what is right and just
Is more desired by the LORD than sacrifice.
Transliteration: ashoh tsedakah umishefat nivechar layhovah mizavach

Hebrew: רוּם־עֵ֭ינַיִם וּרְחַב־לֵ֑ב נִ֖ר רְשָׁעִ֣ים חַטָּֽאת׃
Translated:
Haughty looks, a proud heart—
The tillage of the wicked is sinful.
Transliteration: rum-eynayim urechav-lev nir reshaiym chatat

Hebrew: מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת חָ֭רוּץ אַךְ־לְמוֹתָ֑ר וְכׇל־אָ֝֗ץ אַךְ־לְמַחְסֽוֹר׃
Translated:
The plans of the diligent make only for gain;
All rash haste makes only for loss.
Transliteration: macheshevvot charuts akhe-lemvotar vekhׇl-ats akhe-lemachesvor

Hebrew: פֹּ֣עַל אֹ֭צָרוֹת בִּלְשׁ֣וֹן שָׁ֑קֶר הֶ֥בֶל נִ֝דָּ֗ף מְבַקְשֵׁי־מָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
Treasures acquired by a lying tongue
Are like driven vapor, heading for extinction.
Transliteration: foal otsarvot vileshvon shaker hevel nidaf mevakeshey-mavet

Hebrew: שֹׁד־רְשָׁעִ֥ים יְגוֹרֵ֑ם כִּ֥י מֵ֝אֲנ֗וּ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
The violence of the wicked sweeps them away,
For they refuse to act justly.
Transliteration: shod-reshaiym yegvorem khiy meanu laashvot mishefat

Hebrew: הֲפַכְפַּ֬ךְ דֶּ֣רֶךְ אִ֣ישׁ וָזָ֑ר וְ֝זַ֗ךְ יָשָׁ֥ר פׇּעֳלֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The way of a man may be tortuous and strange,
Though his actions are blameless and proper.
Transliteration: hafakhefakhe derekhe iysh vazar vezakhe yashar fׇolvo

Hebrew: ט֗וֹב לָשֶׁ֥בֶת עַל־פִּנַּת־גָּ֑ג מֵאֵ֥שֶׁת מִ֝דְיָנִ֗ים וּבֵ֥ית חָֽבֶר׃
Translated:
Dwelling in the corner of a roof is better
Than a contentious wife in a spacious house.
Transliteration: tvov lashevet al-finat-gag meeshet mideyaniym uveyt chaver

Hebrew: נֶ֣פֶשׁ רָ֭שָׁע אִוְּתָה־רָ֑ע לֹֽא־יֻחַ֖ן בְּעֵינָ֣יו רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
The desire of the wicked is set upon evil;
His fellowman finds no favor in his eyes.
Transliteration: nefesh rasha ivetah-ra lo-yuchan veeynayv reehu

Hebrew: בַּֽעֲנׇשׁ־לֵ֭ץ יֶחְכַּם־פֶּ֑תִי וּבְהַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְ֝חָכָ֗ם יִקַּח־דָּֽעַת׃
Translated:
When a scoffer is punished, the simple man is edified;
When a wise man is taught, he gains insight.
Transliteration: vaanׇsh-lets yechekham-fetiy uvehashekhiyl lechakham yikach-daat

Hebrew: מַשְׂכִּ֣יל צַ֭דִּיק לְבֵ֣ית רָשָׁ֑ע מְסַלֵּ֖ף רְשָׁעִ֣ים לָרָֽע׃
Translated:
The Righteous One observes the house of the wicked man;
He subverts the wicked to their ruin.
Transliteration: mashekhiyl tsadiyk leveyt rasha mesalef reshaiym lara

Hebrew: אֹטֵ֣ם אׇ֭זְנוֹ מִזַּעֲקַת־דָּ֑ל גַּֽם־ה֥וּא יִ֝קְרָ֗א וְלֹ֣א יֵעָנֶֽה׃
Translated:
Who stops his ears at the cry of the wretched,
He too will call and not be answered.
Transliteration: otem ׇzenvo mizaakat-dal gam-hu yikera velo eianeh

Hebrew: מַתָּ֣ן בַּ֭סֵּתֶר יִכְפֶּה־אָ֑ף וְשֹׁ֥חַד בַּ֝חֵ֗ק חֵמָ֥ה עַזָּֽה׃
Translated:
A gift in secret subdues anger,
A present in private, fierce rage.
Transliteration: matan vaseter yikhefeh-af veshochad vachek chemah azah

Hebrew: שִׂמְחָ֣ה לַ֭צַּדִּיק עֲשׂ֣וֹת מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּ֝מְחִתָּ֗ה לְפֹ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
Justice done is a joy to the righteous,
To evildoers, ruination.
Transliteration: shimechah latsadiyk ashvot mishefat umechitah lefoaley aven

Hebrew: אָדָ֗ם תּ֭וֹעֶה מִדֶּ֣רֶךְ הַשְׂכֵּ֑ל בִּקְהַ֖ל רְפָאִ֣ים יָנֽוּחַ׃
Translated:
A man who strays from the path of prudence
Will rest in the company of ghosts.
Transliteration: adam tvoeh miderekhe hashekhel vikehal refaiym yanucha

Hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ מַ֭חְסוֹר אֹהֵ֣ב שִׂמְחָ֑ה אֹהֵ֥ב יַֽיִן־וָ֝שֶׁ֗מֶן לֹ֣א יַעֲשִֽׁיר׃
Translated:
He who loves pleasure comes to want;
He who loves wine and oil does not grow rich.
Transliteration: iysh machesvor ohev shimechah ohev yayiin-vashemen lo yaashiyr

Hebrew: כֹּ֣פֶר לַצַּדִּ֣יק רָשָׁ֑ע וְתַ֖חַת יְשָׁרִ֣ים בּוֹגֵֽד׃
Translated:
The wicked are the ransom of the righteous;
The traitor comes in place of the upright.
Transliteration: khofer latsadiyk rasha vetachat yeshariym vvoged

Hebrew: ט֗וֹב שֶׁ֥בֶת בְּאֶֽרֶץ־מִדְבָּ֑ר מֵאֵ֖שֶׁת (מדונים) [מִדְיָנִ֣ים] וָכָֽעַס׃
Translated:
It is better to live in the desert
Than with a contentious, vexatious wife.
Transliteration: tvov shevet veerets-midevar meeshet (mdvnym) [mideyaniym] vakhaas

Hebrew: אוֹצָ֤ר ׀ נֶחְמָ֣ד וָ֭שֶׁמֶן בִּנְוֵ֣ה חָכָ֑ם וּכְסִ֖יל אָדָ֣ם יְבַלְּעֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
Precious treasure and oil are in the house of the wise man,
And a fool of a man will run through them.
Transliteration: votsar nechemad vashemen vineveh chakham ukhesiyl adam yevaleenu

Hebrew: רֹ֭דֵף צְדָקָ֣ה וָחָ֑סֶד יִמְצָ֥א חַ֝יִּ֗ים צְדָקָ֥ה וְכָבֽוֹד׃
Translated:
He who strives to do good and kind deeds
Attains life, success, and honor.
Transliteration: rodef tsedakah vachased yimetsa chayiym tsedakah vekhavvod

Hebrew: עִ֣יר גִּ֭בֹּרִים עָלָ֣ה חָכָ֑ם וַ֝יֹּ֗רֶד עֹ֣ז מִבְטֶחָֽהֿ׃
Translated:
One wise man prevailed over a city of warriors
And brought down its mighty stronghold.
Transliteration: iyr givoriym alah chakham vayored oz mivetechahֿ

Hebrew: שֹׁמֵ֣ר פִּ֭יו וּלְשׁוֹנ֑וֹ שֹׁמֵ֖ר מִצָּר֣וֹת נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
He who guards his mouth and tongue
Guards himself from trouble.
Transliteration: shomer fiyv uleshvonvo shomer mitsarvot nafeshvo

Hebrew: זֵ֣ד יָ֭הִיר לֵ֣ץ שְׁמ֑וֹ ע֝וֹשֶׂ֗ה בְּעֶבְרַ֥ת זָדֽוֹן׃
Translated:
The proud, insolent man, scoffer is his name,
Acts in a frenzy of insolence.
Transliteration: zed yahiyr lets shemvo vosheh veeverat zadvon

Hebrew: תַּאֲוַ֣ת עָצֵ֣ל תְּמִיתֶ֑נּוּ כִּֽי־מֵאֲנ֖וּ יָדָ֣יו לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
Translated:
The craving of a lazy man kills him,
For his hands refuse to work.
Transliteration: taavat atsel temiytenu khiy-meanu yadayv laashvot

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַ֭יּוֹם הִתְאַוָּ֣ה תַאֲוָ֑ה וְצַדִּ֥יק יִ֝תֵּ֗ן וְלֹ֣א יַחְשֹֽׂךְ׃
Translated:
All day long he is seized with craving
While the righteous man gives without stint.
Transliteration: khׇl-hayyvom hiteavah taavah vetsadiyk yiten velo yacheshokhe

Hebrew: זֶ֣בַח רְ֭שָׁעִים תּוֹעֵבָ֑ה אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־בְזִמָּ֥ה יְבִיאֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
The sacrifice of the wicked man is an abomination,
The more so as he offers it in depravity.
Transliteration: zevach reshaiym tvoevah af khiy-vezimah yeviyenu

Hebrew: עֵד־כְּזָבִ֥ים יֹאבֵ֑ד וְאִ֥ישׁ שׁ֝וֹמֵ֗עַ לָנֶ֥צַח יְדַבֵּֽר׃
Translated:
A false witness is doomed,
But one who really heard will testify with success.
Transliteration: ed-khezaviym yoved veiysh shvomea lanetsach yedaver

Hebrew: הֵעֵ֬ז אִ֣ישׁ רָשָׁ֣ע בְּפָנָ֑יו וְ֝יָשָׁ֗ר ה֤וּא ׀ (יכין דרכיו) [יָבִ֬ין דַּרְכּֽוֹ]׃
Translated:
The wicked man is brazen-faced;
The upright man discerns his course.
Transliteration: heez iysh rasha vefanayv veyashar hu (ykhyn drkhyv) [yaviyn darekhvo]

Hebrew: אֵ֣ין חׇ֭כְמָה וְאֵ֣ין תְּבוּנָ֑ה וְאֵ֥ין עֵ֝צָ֗ה לְנֶ֣גֶד יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
No wisdom, no prudence, and no counsel
Can prevail against the LORD.
Transliteration: eyn chׇkhemah veeyn tevunah veeyn etsah leneged yehovah {f}

Hebrew: ס֗וּס מ֭וּכָן לְי֣וֹם מִלְחָמָ֑ה וְ֝לַיהֹוָ֗ה הַתְּשׁוּעָֽה׃
Translated:
The horse is readied for the day of battle,
But victory comes from the LORD.
Transliteration: sus mukhan leyvom milechamah velayhovah hateshuah

Hebrew: נִבְחָ֣ר שֵׁ֭ם מֵעֹ֣שֶׁר רָ֑ב מִכֶּ֥סֶף וּ֝מִזָּהָ֗ב חֵ֣ן טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
Repute is preferable to great wealth,
Grace is better than silver and gold.
Transliteration: nivechar shem meosher rav mikhesef umizahav chen tvov

Hebrew: עָשִׁ֣יר וָרָ֣שׁ נִפְגָּ֑שׁוּ עֹשֵׂ֖ה כֻלָּ֣ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Rich man and poor man meet;
The LORD made them both.
Transliteration: ashiyr varash nifegashu osheh khulam yehovah

Hebrew: עָר֤וּם ׀ רָאָ֣ה רָעָ֣ה (ויסתר) [וְנִסְתָּ֑ר] וּ֝פְתָיִ֗ים עָבְר֥וּ וְֽנֶעֱנָֽשׁוּ׃
Translated:
The shrewd man saw trouble and took cover;
The simple kept going and paid the penalty.
Transliteration: arum raah raah (vystr) [venisetar] ufetayiym averu veneenashu

Hebrew: עֵ֣קֶב עֲ֭נָוָה יִרְאַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה עֹ֖שֶׁר וְכָב֣וֹד וְחַיִּֽים׃
Translated:
The effect of humility is fear of the LORD,
Wealth, honor, and life.
Transliteration: ekev anavah yireat yehovah osher vekhavvod vechayiym

Hebrew: צִנִּ֣ים פַּ֭חִים בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ עִקֵּ֑שׁ שׁוֹמֵ֥ר נַ֝פְשׁ֗וֹ יִרְחַ֥ק מֵהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Thorns and snares are in the path of the crooked;
He who values his life will keep far from them.
Transliteration: tsiniym fachiym vederekhe ikesh shvomer nafeshvo yirechak mehem

Hebrew: חֲנֹ֣ךְ לַ֭נַּעַר עַל־פִּ֣י דַרְכּ֑וֹ גַּ֥ם כִּי־יַ֝זְקִ֗ין לֹא־יָס֥וּר מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
Translated:
Train a lad in the way he ought to go;
He will not swerve from it even in old age.
Transliteration: chanokhe lanaar al-fiy darekhvo gam khiy-yazekiyn lo-yasur mimenah

Hebrew: עָ֭שִׁיר בְּרָשִׁ֣ים יִמְשׁ֑וֹל וְעֶ֥בֶד לֹ֝וֶ֗ה לְאִ֣ישׁ מַלְוֶֽה׃
Translated:
The rich rule the poor,
And the borrower is a slave to the lender.
Transliteration: ashiyr verashiym yimeshvol veeved loveh leiysh maleveh

Hebrew: זוֹרֵ֣עַ עַ֭וְלָה (יקצור) [יִקְצׇר־]אָ֑וֶן וְשֵׁ֖בֶט עֶבְרָת֣וֹ יִכְלֶֽה׃
Translated:
He who sows injustice shall reap misfortune;
His rod of wrath shall fail.
Transliteration: zvorea avelah (yktsvr) [yiketsׇr-]aven veshevet everatvo yikheleh

Hebrew: טֽוֹב־עַ֭יִן ה֣וּא יְבֹרָ֑ךְ כִּֽי־נָתַ֖ן מִלַּחְמ֣וֹ לַדָּֽל׃
Translated:
The generous man is blessed,
For he gives of his bread to the poor.
Transliteration: tvov-ayiin hu yevorakhe khiy-natan milachemvo ladal

Hebrew: גָּ֣רֵֽשׁ לֵ֭ץ וְיֵצֵ֣א מָד֑וֹן וְ֝יִשְׁבֹּ֗ת דִּ֣ין וְקָלֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Expel the scoffer and contention departs,
Quarrel and contumely cease.
Transliteration: garesh lets veeitse madvon veyiishevot diyn vekalvon

Hebrew: אֹהֵ֥ב (טהור) [טְהׇר־]לֵ֑ב חֵ֥ן שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו רֵעֵ֥הוּ מֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated:
A pure-hearted friend,
His speech is gracious;
He has the king for his companion.
Transliteration: ohev (thvr) [tehׇr-]lev chen shefatayv reehu melekhe

Hebrew: עֵינֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה נָ֣צְרוּ דָ֑עַת וַ֝יְסַלֵּ֗ף דִּבְרֵ֥י בֹגֵֽד׃
Translated:
The eyes of the LORD watch the wise man;
He subverts the words of the treacherous.
Transliteration: eyney yehovah natseru daat vayesalef diverey voged

Hebrew: אָמַ֣ר עָ֭צֵל אֲרִ֣י בַח֑וּץ בְּת֥וֹךְ רְ֝חֹב֗וֹת אֵרָצֵֽחַ׃
Translated:
The lazy man says, “There’s a lion in the street;
I shall be killed if I step outside.”
Transliteration: amar atsel ariy vachuts vetvokhe rechovvot eratsecha

Hebrew: שׁוּחָ֣ה עֲ֭מֻקָּה פִּ֣י זָר֑וֹת זְע֥וּם יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה (יפול) [יִפׇּל־]שָֽׁם׃
Translated:
The mouth of a forbidden woman is a deep pit;
He who is doomed by the LORD falls into it.
Transliteration: shuchah amukah fiy zarvot zeum yehovah (yfvl) [yifׇl-]sham

Hebrew: אִ֭וֶּלֶת קְשׁוּרָ֣ה בְלֶב־נָ֑עַר שֵׁ֥בֶט מ֝וּסָ֗ר יַרְחִיקֶ֥נָּה מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
If folly settles in the heart of a lad,
The rod of discipline will remove it.
Transliteration: ivelet keshurah velev-naar shevet musar yarechiykenah mimenu

Hebrew: עֹ֣שֵֽׁק דָּ֭ל לְהַרְבּ֣וֹת ל֑וֹ נֹתֵ֥ן לְ֝עָשִׁ֗יר אַךְ־לְמַחְסֽוֹר׃
Translated:
To profit by withholding what is due to the poor
Is like making gifts to the rich—pure loss.
Transliteration: oshek dal leharevvot lvo noten leashiyr akhe-lemachesvor

Hebrew: הַ֥ט אׇזְנְךָ֗ וּ֭שְׁמַע דִּבְרֵ֣י חֲכָמִ֑ים וְ֝לִבְּךָ֗ תָּשִׁ֥ית לְדַעְתִּֽי׃
Translated:
Incline your ear and listen to the words of the sages;
Pay attention to my wisdom.
Transliteration: hat ׇzenekha ushema diverey chakhamiym velivekha tashiyt ledaetiy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־נָ֭עִים כִּֽי־תִשְׁמְרֵ֣ם בְּבִטְנֶ֑ךָ יִכֹּ֥נוּ יַ֝חְדָּ֗ו עַל־שְׂפָתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
It is good that you store them inside you,
And that all of them be constantly on your lips,
Transliteration: khiy-naiym khiy-tishemerem vevitenekha yikhonu yachedav al-shefateykha

Hebrew: לִֽהְי֣וֹת בַּ֭יהֹוָה מִבְטַחֶ֑ךָ הוֹדַעְתִּ֖יךָ הַיּ֣וֹם אַף־אָֽתָּה׃
Translated:
That you may put your trust in the LORD.
I let you know today—yes, you—
Transliteration: liheyvot vayhovah mivetachekha hvodaetiykha hayyvom af-atah

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֤א כָתַ֣בְתִּֽי לְ֭ךָ (שלשום) [שָׁלִישִׁ֑ים] בְּמֹ֖עֵצ֣וֹת וָדָֽעַת׃
Translated:
Indeed, I wrote down for you a threefold lore,
Wise counsel,
Transliteration: halo khatavetiy lekha (shlshvm) [shaliyshiym] vemoetsvot vadaat

Hebrew: לְהֽוֹדִיעֲךָ֗ קֹ֭שְׁטְ אִמְרֵ֣י אֱמֶ֑ת לְהָשִׁ֥יב אֲמָרִ֥ים אֱ֝מֶ֗ת לְשֹׁלְחֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
To let you know truly reliable words,
That you may give a faithful reply to him who sent you.
Transliteration: lehvodiyakha koshete imerey emet lehashiyv amariym emet lesholecheykha

Hebrew: אַֽל־תִּגְזׇל־דָּ֭ל כִּ֣י דַל־ה֑וּא וְאַל־תְּדַכֵּ֖א עָנִ֣י בַשָּֽׁעַר׃
Translated:
Do not rob the wretched because he is wretched;
Do not crush the poor man in the gate;
Transliteration: al-tigezׇl-dal khiy dal-hu veal-tedakhe aniy vashaar

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יְ֭הֹוָה יָרִ֣יב רִיבָ֑ם וְקָבַ֖ע אֶת־קֹבְעֵיהֶ֣ם נָֽפֶשׁ׃
Translated:
For the LORD will take up their cause
And despoil those who despoil them of life.
Transliteration: khiy-yehovah yariyv riyvam vekava et-koveeyhem nafesh

Hebrew: אַל־תִּ֭תְרַע אֶת־בַּ֣עַל אָ֑ף וְאֶת־אִ֥ישׁ חֵ֝מ֗וֹת לֹ֣א תָבֽוֹא׃
Translated:
Do not associate with an irascible man,
Or go about with one who is hot-tempered,
Transliteration: al-titera et-vaal af veet-iysh chemvot lo tavvo

Hebrew: פֶּן־תֶּאֱלַ֥ף אֹרְחֹתָ֑ו וְלָקַחְתָּ֖ מוֹקֵ֣שׁ לְנַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated:
Lest you learn his ways
And find yourself ensnared.
Transliteration: fen-teelaf orechotav velakacheta mvokesh lenafeshekha

Hebrew: אַל־תְּהִ֥י בְתֹֽקְעֵי־כָ֑ף בַּ֝עֹרְבִ֗ים מַשָּׁאֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Do not be one of those who give their hand,
Who stand surety for debts,
Transliteration: al-tehiy vetokeey-khaf vaoreviym mashavot

Hebrew: אִם־אֵֽין־לְךָ֥ לְשַׁלֵּ֑ם לָ֥מָּה יִקַּ֥ח מִ֝שְׁכָּבְךָ֗ מִתַּחְתֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Lest your bed be taken from under you
When you have no money to pay.
Transliteration: im-eyn-lekha leshalem lamah yikach mishekhavekha mitacheteykha

Hebrew: אַל־תַּ֭סֵּג גְּב֣וּל עוֹלָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר עָשׂ֣וּ אֲבוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Do not remove the ancient boundary stone
That your ancestors set up.
Transliteration: al-taseg gevul volam asher ashu avvoteykha

Hebrew: חָזִ֡יתָ אִ֤ישׁ ׀ מָ֘הִ֤יר בִּמְלַאכְתּ֗וֹ לִֽפְנֵי־מְלָכִ֥ים יִתְיַצָּ֑ב בַּל־יִ֝תְיַצֵּ֗ב לִפְנֵ֥י חֲשֻׁכִּֽים׃ {פ}
Translated:
See a man skilled at his work—
He shall attend upon kings;
He shall not attend upon obscure men.
Transliteration: chaziyta iysh mahiyr vimelakhetvo lifeney-melakhiym yiteyatsav val-yiteyatsev lifeney chashukhiym {f}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תֵ֭שֵׁב לִלְח֣וֹם אֶת־מוֹשֵׁ֑ל בִּ֥ין תָּ֝בִ֗ין אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
When you sit down to dine with a ruler,
Consider well who is before you.
Transliteration: khiy-teshev lilechvom et-mvoshel viyn taviyn et-asher lefaneykha

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ שַׂכִּ֣ין בְּלֹעֶ֑ךָ אִם־בַּ֖עַל נֶ֣פֶשׁ אָֽתָּה׃
Translated:
Thrust a knife into your gullet
If you have a large appetite.
Transliteration: veshameta shakhiyn veloekha im-vaal nefesh atah

Hebrew: אַל־תִּ֭תְאָו לְמַטְעַמּוֹתָ֑יו וְ֝ה֗וּא לֶ֣חֶם כְּזָבִֽים׃
Translated:
Do not crave for his dainties,
For they are counterfeit food.
Transliteration: al-titeav lemateamvotayv vehu lechem khezaviym

Hebrew: אַל־תִּיגַ֥ע לְֽהַעֲשִׁ֑יר מִֽבִּינָתְךָ֥ חֲדָֽל׃
Translated:
Do not toil to gain wealth;
Have the sense to desist.
Transliteration: al-tiyga lehaashiyr miviynatekha chadal

Hebrew: (התעוף) [הֲתָ֤עִיף]־עֵינֶ֥יךָ בּ֗וֹ וְֽאֵ֫ינֶ֥נּוּ כִּ֤י עָשֹׂ֣ה יַעֲשֶׂה־לּ֣וֹ כְנָפַ֑יִם כְּ֝נֶ֗שֶׁר (ועיף) [יָע֥וּף] הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated:
You see it, then it is gone;
It grows wings and flies away,
Like an eagle, heavenward.
Transliteration: (htvf) [hataiyf]-eyneykha vvo veeynenu khiy ashoh yaasheh-lvo khenafayiim khenesher (vyf) [yauf] hashamayiim {f}

Hebrew: אַל־תִּלְחַ֗ם אֶת־לֶ֭חֶם רַ֣ע עָ֑יִן וְאַל־תִּ֝תְאָ֗ו לְמַטְעַמֹּתָֽיו׃
Translated:
Do not eat of a stingy man’s food;
Do not crave for his dainties;
Transliteration: al-tilecham et-lechem ra ayiin veal-titeav lemateamotayv

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ כְּמ֥וֹ שָׁעַ֥ר בְּנַפְשׁ֗וֹ כֶּ֫ן־ה֥וּא אֱכ֣וֹל וּ֭שְׁתֵה יֹ֣אמַר לָ֑ךְ וְ֝לִבּ֗וֹ בַּל־עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
He is like one keeping accounts;
“Eat and drink,” he says to you,
But he does not really mean it.
Transliteration: khiy khemvo shaar venafeshvo khen-hu ekhvol usheteh yomar lakhe velivvo val-imakhe

Hebrew: פִּֽתְּךָ־אָכַ֥לְתָּ תְקִיאֶ֑נָּה וְ֝שִׁחַ֗תָּ דְּבָרֶ֥יךָ הַנְּעִימִֽים׃
Translated:
The morsel you eat you will vomit;
You will waste your courteous words.
Transliteration: fitekha-akhaleta tekiyenah veshichata devareykha haneiymiym

Hebrew: בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י כְ֭סִיל אַל־תְּדַבֵּ֑ר כִּי־יָ֝ב֗וּז לְשֵׂ֣כֶל מִלֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Do not speak to a dullard,
For he will disdain your sensible words.
Transliteration: veׇzeney khesiyl al-tedaver khiy-yavuz leshekhel mileykha

Hebrew: אַל־תַּ֭סֵּג גְּב֣וּל עוֹלָ֑ם וּבִשְׂדֵ֥י יְ֝תוֹמִ֗ים אַל־תָּבֹֽא׃
Translated:
Do not remove ancient boundary stones;
Do not encroach upon the field of orphans,
Transliteration: al-taseg gevul volam uvishedey yetvomiym al-tavo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־גֹאֲלָ֥ם חָזָ֑ק הֽוּא־יָרִ֖יב אֶת־רִיבָ֣ם אִתָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
For they have a mighty Kinsman,
And He will surely take up their cause with you.
Transliteration: khiy-goalam chazak hu-yariyv et-riyvam itakhe

Hebrew: הָבִ֣יאָה לַמּוּסָ֣ר לִבֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝אׇזְנֶ֗ךָ לְאִמְרֵי־דָֽעַת׃
Translated:
Apply your mind to discipline
And your ears to wise sayings.
Transliteration: haviyah lamusar livekha veׇzenekha leimerey-daat

Hebrew: אַל־תִּמְנַ֣ע מִנַּ֣עַר מוּסָ֑ר כִּֽי־תַכֶּ֥נּוּ בַ֝שֵּׁ֗בֶט לֹ֣א יָמֽוּת׃
Translated:
Do not withhold discipline from a child;
If you beat him with a rod he will not die.
Transliteration: al-timena minaar musar khiy-takhenu vashevet lo yamut

Hebrew: אַ֭תָּה בַּשֵּׁ֣בֶט תַּכֶּ֑נּוּ וְ֝נַפְשׁ֗וֹ מִשְּׁא֥וֹל תַּצִּֽיל׃
Translated:
Beat him with a rod
And you will save him from the grave.
Transliteration: atah vashevet takhenu venafeshvo mishevol tatsiyl

Hebrew: בְּ֭נִי אִם־חָכַ֣ם לִבֶּ֑ךָ יִשְׂמַ֖ח לִבִּ֣י גַם־אָֽנִי׃
Translated:
My son, if your mind gets wisdom,
My mind, too, will be gladdened.
Transliteration: veniy im-chakham livekha yishemach liviy gam-aniy

Hebrew: וְתַעְלֹ֥זְנָה כִלְיוֹתָ֑י בְּדַבֵּ֥ר שְׂ֝פָתֶ֗יךָ מֵישָׁרִֽים׃
Translated:
I shall rejoice with all my heart
When your lips speak right things.
Transliteration: vetaelozenah khileyvotay vedaver shefateykha meyshariym

Hebrew: אַל־יְקַנֵּ֣א לִ֭בְּךָ בַּחַטָּאִ֑ים כִּ֥י אִם־בְּיִרְאַת־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated:
Do not envy sinners in your heart,
But only God-fearing men, at all times,
Transliteration: al-yekane livekha vachataiym khiy im-veyireat-yehovah khׇl-hayyvom

Hebrew: כִּ֭י אִם־יֵ֣שׁ אַחֲרִ֑ית וְ֝תִקְוָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א תִכָּרֵֽת׃
Translated:
For then you will have a future,
And your hope will never fail.
Transliteration: khiy im-eish achariyt vetikevatekha lo tikharet

Hebrew: שְׁמַע־אַתָּ֣ה בְנִ֣י וַחֲכָ֑ם וְאַשֵּׁ֖ר בַּדֶּ֣רֶךְ לִבֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
