Listen, my son, and get wisdom;
Lead your mind in a [proper] path.
Transliteration: shema-atah veniy vachakham veasher vaderekhe livekha

Hebrew: אַל־תְּהִ֥י בְסֹֽבְאֵי־יָ֑יִן בְּזֹלְלֵ֖י בָשָׂ֣ר לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
Do not be of those who guzzle wine,
Or glut themselves on meat;
Transliteration: al-tehiy vesoveey-yayiin vezoleley vashar lamvo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־סֹבֵ֣א וְ֭זוֹלֵל יִוָּרֵ֑שׁ וּ֝קְרָעִ֗ים תַּלְבִּ֥ישׁ נוּמָֽה׃
Translated:
For guzzlers and gluttons will be impoverished,
And drowsing will clothe you in tatters.
Transliteration: khiy-sove vezvolel yivaresh ukeraiym taleviysh numah

Hebrew: שְׁמַ֣ע לְ֭אָבִיךָ זֶ֣ה יְלָדֶ֑ךָ וְאַל־תָּ֝ב֗וּז כִּֽי־זָקְנָ֥ה אִמֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
Listen to your father who begot you;
Do not disdain your mother when she is old.
Transliteration: shema leaviykha zeh yeladekha veal-tavuz khiy-zakenah imekha

Hebrew: אֱמֶ֣ת קְ֭נֵה וְאַל־תִּמְכֹּ֑ר חׇכְמָ֖ה וּמוּסָ֣ר וּבִינָֽה׃
Translated:
Buy truth and never sell it,
And wisdom, discipline, and understanding.
Transliteration: emet keneh veal-timekhor chׇkhemah umusar uviynah

Hebrew: (גול) [גִּ֣יל] יָ֭גִיל אֲבִ֣י צַדִּ֑יק (יולד) [וְיוֹלֵ֥ד] חָ֝כָ֗ם (וישמח) [יִשְׂמַח־]בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The father of a righteous man will exult;
He who begets a wise son will rejoice in him.
Transliteration: (gvl) [giyl] yagiyl aviy tsadiyk (yvld) [veyvoled] chakham (vyshmch) [yishemach-]vvo

Hebrew: יִֽשְׂמַח־אָבִ֥יךָ וְאִמֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝תָגֵ֗ל יוֹלַדְתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
Your father and mother will rejoice;
She who bore you will exult.
Transliteration: yishemach-aviykha veimekha vetagel yvoladetekha

Hebrew: תְּנָה־בְנִ֣י לִבְּךָ֣ לִ֑י וְ֝עֵינֶ֗יךָ דְּרָכַ֥י (תרצנה) [תִּצֹּֽרְנָה]׃
Translated:
Give your mind to me, my son;
Let your eyes watch my ways.
Transliteration: tenah-veniy livekha liy veeyneykha derakhay (trtsnh) [titsorenah]

Hebrew: כִּֽי־שׁוּחָ֣ה עֲמֻקָּ֣ה זוֹנָ֑ה וּבְאֵ֥ר צָ֝רָ֗ה נׇכְרִיָּֽה׃
Translated:
A harlot is a deep pit;
A forbidden woman is a narrow well.
Transliteration: khiy-shuchah amukah zvonah uveer tsarah nׇkheriyah

Hebrew: אַף־הִ֭יא כְּחֶ֣תֶף תֶּאֱרֹ֑ב וּ֝בוֹגְדִ֗ים בְּאָדָ֥ם תּוֹסִֽף׃
Translated:
She too lies in wait as if for prey,
And destroys the unfaithful among men.
Transliteration: af-hiy khechetef teerov uvvogediym veadam tvosif

Hebrew: לְמִ֨י א֥וֹי לְמִ֪י אֲב֡וֹי לְמִ֤י (מדונים) [מִדְיָנִ֨ים ׀] לְמִ֥י שִׂ֗יחַ לְ֭מִי פְּצָעִ֣ים חִנָּ֑ם לְ֝מִ֗י חַכְלִל֥וּת עֵינָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Who cries, “Woe!” who, “Alas!”;
Who has quarrels, who complaints;
Who has wounds without cause;
Who has bleary eyes?
Transliteration: lemiy voy lemiy avvoy lemiy (mdvnym) [mideyaniym ] lemiy shiycha lemiy fetsaiym chinam lemiy chakhelilut eynayiim

Hebrew: לַֽמְאַחֲרִ֥ים עַל־הַיָּ֑יִן לַ֝בָּאִ֗ים לַחְקֹ֥ר מִמְסָֽךְ׃
Translated:
Those whom wine keeps till the small hours,
Those who gather to drain the cups.
Transliteration: lameachariym al-hayayiin lavaiym lachekor mimesakhe

Hebrew: אַל־תֵּ֥רֶא יַּיִן֮ כִּ֤י יִתְאַ֫דָּ֥ם כִּֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן (בכיס) [בַּכּ֣וֹס] עֵינ֑וֹ יִ֝תְהַלֵּ֗ךְ בְּמֵֽישָׁרִֽים׃
Translated:
Do not ogle that red wine
As it lends its color to the cup,
As it flows on smoothly;
Transliteration: al-tere yayin khiy yiteadam khiy-yiten (vkhys) [vakhvos] eynvo yitehalekhe vemeyshariym

Hebrew: אַ֭חֲרִיתוֹ כְּנָחָ֣שׁ יִשָּׁ֑ךְ וּֽכְצִפְעֹנִ֥י יַפְרִֽשׁ׃
Translated:
In the end, it bites like a snake;
It spits like a basilisk.
Transliteration: achariytvo khenachash yishakhe ukhetsifeoniy yaferish

Hebrew: עֵ֭ינֶיךָ יִרְא֣וּ זָר֑וֹת וְ֝לִבְּךָ֗ יְדַבֵּ֥ר תַּהְפֻּכֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Your eyes will see strange sights;
Your heart will speak distorted things.
Transliteration: eyneykha yireu zarvot velivekha yedaver tahefukhvot

Hebrew: וְ֭הָיִיתָ כְּשֹׁכֵ֣ב בְּלֶב־יָ֑ם וּ֝כְשֹׁכֵ֗ב בְּרֹ֣אשׁ חִבֵּֽל׃
Translated:
You will be like one lying in bed on high seas,
Like one lying on top of the rigging.
Transliteration: vehayiyta kheshokhev velev-yam ukheshokhev verosh chivel

Hebrew: הִכּ֥וּנִי בַל־חָלִיתִי֮ הֲלָמ֗וּנִי בַּל־יָ֫דָ֥עְתִּי מָתַ֥י אָקִ֑יץ א֝וֹסִ֗יף אֲבַקְשֶׁ֥נּוּ עֽוֹד׃
Translated:
“They struck me, but I felt no hurt;
They beat me, but I was unaware;
As often as I wake,
I go after it again.”
Transliteration: hikhuniy val-chaliytiy halamuniy val-yadaetiy matay akiyts vosiyf avakeshenu vod

Hebrew: אַל־תְּ֭קַנֵּא בְּאַנְשֵׁ֣י רָעָ֑ה וְאַל־תִּ֝תְאָ֗ו לִֽהְי֥וֹת אִתָּֽם׃
Translated:
Do not envy evil men;
Do not desire to be with them;
Transliteration: al-tekane veaneshey raah veal-titeav liheyvot itam

Hebrew: כִּי־שֹׁ֭ד יֶהְגֶּ֣ה לִבָּ֑ם וְ֝עָמָ֗ל שִׂפְתֵיהֶ֥ם תְּדַבֵּֽרְנָה׃
Translated:
For their hearts talk violence,
And their lips speak mischief.
Transliteration: khiy-shod yehegeh livam veamal shifeteyhem tedaverenah

Hebrew: בְּ֭חׇכְמָה יִבָּ֣נֶה בָּ֑יִת וּ֝בִתְבוּנָ֗ה יִתְכּוֹנָֽן׃
Translated:
A house is built by wisdom,
And is established by understanding;
Transliteration: vechׇkhemah yivaneh vayiit uvitevunah yitekhvonan

Hebrew: וּ֭בְדַעַת חֲדָרִ֣ים יִמָּלְא֑וּ כׇּל־ה֖וֹן יָקָ֣ר וְנָעִֽים׃
Translated:
By knowledge are its rooms filled
With all precious and beautiful things.
Transliteration: uvedaat chadariym yimaleu khׇl-hvon yakar venaiym

Hebrew: גֶּבֶר־חָכָ֥ם בַּע֑וֹז וְאִֽישׁ־דַּ֝֗עַת מְאַמֶּץ־כֹּֽחַ׃
Translated:
A wise man is strength;
A knowledgeable man exerts power;
Transliteration: gever-chakham vavoz veiysh-daat meamets-khocha

Hebrew: כִּ֣י בְ֭תַחְבֻּלוֹת תַּעֲשֶׂה־לְּךָ֣ מִלְחָמָ֑ה וּ֝תְשׁוּעָ֗ה בְּרֹ֣ב יוֹעֵֽץ׃
Translated:
For by stratagems you wage war,
And victory comes with much planning.
Transliteration: khiy vetachevulvot taasheh-lekha milechamah uteshuah verov yvoets

Hebrew: רָאמ֣וֹת לֶאֱוִ֣יל חׇכְמ֑וֹת בַּ֝שַּׁ֗עַר לֹ֣א יִפְתַּח־פִּֽיהוּ׃
Translated:
Wisdom is too lofty for a fool;
He does not open his mouth in the gate.
Transliteration: ramvot leeviyl chׇkhemvot vashaar lo yifetach-fiyhu

Hebrew: מְחַשֵּׁ֥ב לְהָרֵ֑עַ ל֝֗וֹ בַּעַל־מְזִמּ֥וֹת יִקְרָֽאוּ׃
Translated:
He who lays plans to do harm
Is called by men a schemer.
Transliteration: mechashev leharea lvo vaal-mezimvot yikerau

Hebrew: זִמַּ֣ת אִוֶּ֣לֶת חַטָּ֑את וְתוֹעֲבַ֖ת לְאָדָ֣ם לֵֽץ׃
Translated:
The schemes of folly are sin,
And a scoffer is an abomination to men.
Transliteration: zimat ivelet chatat vetvoavat leadam lets

Hebrew: הִ֭תְרַפִּיתָ בְּי֥וֹם צָרָ֗ה צַ֣ר כֹּחֶֽכָה׃
Translated:
If you showed yourself slack in time of trouble,
Wanting in power,
Transliteration: hiterafiyta veyvom tsarah tsar khochekhah

Hebrew: הַ֭צֵּל לְקֻחִ֣ים לַמָּ֑וֶת וּמָטִ֥ים לַ֝הֶ֗רֶג אִם־תַּחְשֽׂוֹךְ׃
Translated:
If you refrained from rescuing those taken off to death,
Those condemned to slaughter—
Transliteration: hatsel lekuchiym lamavet umatiym lahereg im-tacheshvokhe

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תֹאמַ֗ר הֵן֮ לֹא־יָדַ֢עְנ֫וּ זֶ֥ה הֲֽלֹא־תֹ֘כֵ֤ן לִבּ֨וֹת ׀ הֽוּא־יָבִ֗ין וְנֹצֵ֣ר נַ֭פְשְׁךָ ה֣וּא יֵדָ֑ע וְהֵשִׁ֖יב לְאָדָ֣ם כְּפׇעֳלֽוֹ׃
Translated:
If you say, “We knew nothing of it,”
Surely He who fathoms hearts will discern [the truth],
He who watches over your life will know it,
And He will pay each man as he deserves.
Transliteration: khiy-tomar hen lo-yada֢enu zeh halo-tokhen livvot hu-yaviyn venotser nafeshekha hu eida veheshiyv leadam khefׇolvo

Hebrew: אֱכׇל־בְּנִ֣י דְבַ֣שׁ כִּי־ט֑וֹב וְנֹ֥פֶת מָ֝ת֗וֹק עַל־חִכֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
My son, eat honey, for it is good;
Let its sweet drops be on your palate.
Transliteration: ekhׇl-veniy devash khiy-tvov venofet matvok al-chikhekha

Hebrew: כֵּ֤ן ׀ דְּעֶ֥ה חׇכְמָ֗ה לְנַ֫פְשֶׁ֥ךָ אִם־מָ֭צָאתָ וְיֵ֣שׁ אַחֲרִ֑ית וְ֝תִקְוָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א תִכָּרֵֽת׃ {פ}
Translated:
Know: such is wisdom for your soul;
If you attain it, there is a future;
Your hope will not be cut off.
Transliteration: khen deeh chׇkhemah lenafeshekha im-matsata veeish achariyt vetikevatekha lo tikharet {f}

Hebrew: אַל־תֶּאֱרֹ֣ב רָ֭שָׁע לִנְוֵ֣ה צַדִּ֑יק אַֽל־תְּשַׁדֵּ֥ד רִבְצֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Wicked man! Do not lurk by the home of the righteous man;
Do no violence to his dwelling.
Transliteration: al-teerov rasha lineveh tsadiyk al-teshaded rivetsvo

Hebrew: כִּ֤י שֶׁ֨בַע ׀ יִפּ֣וֹל צַדִּ֣יק וָקָ֑ם וּ֝רְשָׁעִ֗ים יִכָּשְׁל֥וּ בְרָעָֽה׃
Translated:
Seven times the righteous man falls and gets up,
While the wicked are tripped by one misfortune.
Transliteration: khiy sheva yifvol tsadiyk vakam ureshaiym yikhashelu veraah

Hebrew: בִּנְפֹ֣ל (אויביך) [א֭וֹיִבְךָ] אַל־תִּשְׂמָ֑ח וּ֝בִכָּשְׁל֗וֹ אַל־יָגֵ֥ל לִבֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
If your enemy falls, do not exult;
If he trips, let your heart not rejoice,
Transliteration: vinefol (vyvykh) [voyivekha] al-tishemach uvikhashelvo al-yagel livekha

Hebrew: פֶּן־יִרְאֶ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה וְרַ֣ע בְּעֵינָ֑יו וְהֵשִׁ֖יב מֵעָלָ֣יו אַפּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Lest the LORD see it and be displeased,
And avert His wrath from him.
Transliteration: fen-yireeh yehovah vera veeynayv veheshiyv mealayv afvo

Hebrew: אַל־תִּתְחַ֥ר בַּמְּרֵעִ֑ים אַל־תְּ֝קַנֵּ֗א בָּֽרְשָׁעִֽים׃
Translated:
Do not be vexed by evildoers;
Do not be incensed by the wicked;
Transliteration: al-titechar vamereiym al-tekane vareshaiym

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ לֹא־תִהְיֶ֣ה אַחֲרִ֣ית לָרָ֑ע נֵ֖ר רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִדְעָֽךְ׃
Translated:
For there is no future for the evil man;
The lamp of the wicked goes out.
Transliteration: khiy lo-tiheyeh achariyt lara ner reshaiym yideakhe

Hebrew: יְרָא־אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּנִ֣י וָמֶ֑לֶךְ עִם־שׁ֝וֹנִ֗ים אַל־תִּתְעָרָֽב׃
Translated:
Fear the LORD, my son, and the king,
And do not mix with dissenters,
Transliteration: yera-et-yehovah veniy vamelekhe im-shvoniym al-titearav

Hebrew: כִּֽי־פִ֭תְאֹם יָק֣וּם אֵידָ֑ם וּפִ֥יד שְׁ֝נֵיהֶ֗ם מִ֣י יוֹדֵֽעַ׃ {פ}
Translated:
For disaster comes from them suddenly;
The doom both decree who can foreknow?
Transliteration: khiy-fiteom yakum eydam ufiyd sheneyhem miy yvodea {f}

Hebrew: גַּם־אֵ֥לֶּה לַחֲכָמִ֑ים הַֽכֵּר־פָּנִ֖ים בְּמִשְׁפָּ֣ט בַּל־טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
These also are by the sages:

It is not right to be partial in judgment.
Transliteration: gam-eleh lachakhamiym hakher-faniym vemishefat val-tvov

Hebrew: אֹ֤מֵ֨ר ׀ לְרָשָׁע֮ צַדִּ֢יק אָ֥֫תָּה יִקְּבֻ֥הוּ עַמִּ֑ים יִזְעָמ֥וּהוּ לְאֻמִּֽים׃
Translated:
He who says to the guilty, “You are innocent,”
Shall be cursed by peoples,
Damned by nations;
Transliteration: omer lerasha tsadi֢yk atah yikevuhu amiym yizeamuhu leumiym

Hebrew: וְלַמּוֹכִיחִ֥ים יִנְעָ֑ם וַ֝עֲלֵיהֶ֗ם תָּב֥וֹא בִרְכַּת־טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
But it shall go well with them who decide justly;
Blessings of good things will light upon them.
Transliteration: velamvokhiychiym yineam vaaleyhem tavvo virekhat-tvov

Hebrew: שְׂפָתַ֥יִם יִשָּׁ֑ק מֵ֝שִׁ֗יב דְּבָרִ֥ים נְכֹחִֽים׃
Translated:
Giving a straightforward reply
Is like giving a kiss.
Transliteration: shefatayiim yishak meshiyv devariym nekhochiym

Hebrew: הָ֘כֵ֤ן בַּח֨וּץ ׀ מְלַאכְתֶּ֗ךָ וְעַתְּדָ֣הּ בַּשָּׂדֶ֣ה לָ֑ךְ אַ֝חַ֗ר וּבָנִ֥יתָ בֵיתֶֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Put your external affairs in order,
Get ready what you have in the field,
Then build yourself a home.
Transliteration: hakhen vachuts melakhetekha veatedah vashadeh lakhe achar uvaniyta veytekha {f}

Hebrew: אַל־תְּהִ֣י עֵד־חִנָּ֣ם בְּרֵעֶ֑ךָ וַ֝הֲפִתִּ֗יתָ בִּשְׂפָתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Do not be a witness against your fellow without good cause;
Would you mislead with your speech?
Transliteration: al-tehiy ed-chinam vereekha vahafitiyta vishefateykha

Hebrew: אַל־תֹּאמַ֗ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָֽשָׂה־לִ֭י כֵּ֤ן אֶֽעֱשֶׂה־לּ֑וֹ אָשִׁ֖יב לָאִ֣ישׁ כְּפׇעֳלֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Do not say, “I will do to him what he did to me;
I will pay the man what he deserves.”
Transliteration: al-tomar khaasher ashah-liy khen eesheh-lvo ashiyv laiysh khefׇolvo {f}

Hebrew: עַל־שְׂדֵ֣ה אִישׁ־עָצֵ֣ל עָבַ֑רְתִּי וְעַל־כֶּ֝֗רֶם אָדָ֥ם חֲסַר־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
I passed by the field of a lazy man,
By the vineyard of a man lacking sense.
Transliteration: al-shedeh iysh-atsel avaretiy veal-kherem adam chasar-lev

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֨ה עָ֘לָ֤ה כֻלּ֨וֹ ׀ קִמְּשֹׂנִ֗ים כׇּסּ֣וּ פָנָ֣יו חֲרֻלִּ֑ים וְגֶ֖דֶר אֲבָנָ֣יו נֶהֱרָֽסָה׃
Translated:
It was all overgrown with thorns;
Its surface was covered with chickweed,
And its stone fence lay in ruins.
Transliteration: vehineh alah khulvo kimeshoniym khׇsu fanayv charuliym vegeder avanayv neherasah

Hebrew: וָאֶחֱזֶ֣ה אָ֭נֹכִי אָשִׁ֣ית לִבִּ֑י רָ֝אִ֗יתִי לָקַ֥חְתִּי מוּסָֽר׃
Translated:
I observed and took it to heart;
I saw it and learned a lesson.
Transliteration: vaechezeh anokhiy ashiyt liviy raiytiy lakachetiy musar

Hebrew: מְעַ֣ט שֵׁ֭נוֹת מְעַ֣ט תְּנוּמ֑וֹת מְעַ֓ט ׀ חִבֻּ֖ק יָדַ֣יִם לִשְׁכָּֽב׃
Translated:
A bit more sleep, a bit more slumber,
A bit more hugging yourself in bed,
Transliteration: meat shenvot meat tenumvot meat chivuk yadayiim lishekhav

Hebrew: וּבָֽא־מִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ רֵישֶׁ֑ךָ וּ֝מַחְסֹרֶ֗יךָ כְּאִ֣ישׁ מָגֵֽן׃ {פ}
Translated:
And poverty will come calling upon you,
And want, like a man with a shield.
Transliteration: uva-mitehalekhe reyshekha umachesoreykha kheiysh magen {f}

Hebrew: גַּם־אֵ֭לֶּה מִשְׁלֵ֣י שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶ֝עְתִּ֗יקוּ אַנְשֵׁ֤י ׀ חִזְקִיָּ֬ה מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: These too are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of King Hezekiah of Judah copied:
Transliteration: gam-eleh misheley shelomoh asher heetiyku aneshey chizekiyah melekhe-yehudah

Hebrew: כְּבֹ֣ד אֱ֭לֹהִים הַסְתֵּ֣ר דָּבָ֑ר וּכְבֹ֥ד מְ֝לָכִ֗ים חֲקֹ֣ר דָּבָֽר׃
Translated:
It is the glory of God to conceal a matter,
And the glory of a king to plumb a matter.
Transliteration: khevod Elohim haseter davar ukhevod melakhiym chakor davar

Hebrew: שָׁמַ֣יִם לָ֭רוּם וָאָ֣רֶץ לָעֹ֑מֶק וְלֵ֥ב מְ֝לָכִ֗ים אֵ֣ין חֵֽקֶר׃
Translated:
Like the heavens in their height, like the earth in its depth,
Is the mind of kings—unfathomable.
Transliteration: shamayiim larum vaarets laomek velev melakhiym eyn cheker

Hebrew: הָג֣וֹ סִיגִ֣ים מִכָּ֑סֶף וַיֵּצֵ֖א לַצֹּרֵ֣ף כֶּֽלִי׃
Translated:
The dross having been separated from the silver,
A vessel emerged for the smith.
Transliteration: hagvo siygiym mikhasef vayetse latsoref kheliy

Hebrew: הָג֣וֹ רָ֭שָׁע לִפְנֵי־מֶ֑לֶךְ וְיִכּ֖וֹן בַּצֶּ֣דֶק כִּסְאֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Remove the wicked from the king’s presence,
And his throne will be established in justice.
Transliteration: hagvo rasha lifeney-melekhe veyikhvon vatsedek khisevo

Hebrew: אַל־תִּתְהַדַּ֥ר לִפְנֵי־מֶ֑לֶךְ וּבִמְק֥וֹם גְּ֝דֹלִ֗ים אַֽל־תַּעֲמֹֽד׃
Translated:
Do not exalt yourself in the king’s presence;
Do not stand in the place of nobles.
Transliteration: al-titehadar lifeney-melekhe uvimekvom gedoliym al-taamod

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ט֥וֹב אֲמׇר־לְךָ֗ עֲֽלֵ֫ה־הֵ֥נָּה מֵ֭הַשְׁפִּ֣ילְךָ לִפְנֵ֣י נָדִ֑יב אֲשֶׁ֖ר רָא֣וּ עֵינֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
For it is better to be told, “Step up here,”
Than to be degraded in the presence of the great.

Do not let what your eyes have seen
Transliteration: khiy tvov amׇr-lekha aleh-henah mehashefiylekha lifeney nadiyv asher rau eyneykha

Hebrew: אַל־תֵּצֵ֥א לָרִ֗ב מַ֫הֵ֥ר פֶּ֣ן מַה־תַּ֭עֲשֶׂה בְּאַחֲרִיתָ֑הּ בְּהַכְלִ֖ים אֹתְךָ֣ רֵעֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Be vented rashly in a quarrel;
Think of what it will effect in the end,
When your fellow puts you to shame.
Transliteration: al-tetse lariv maher fen mah-taasheh veachariytah vehakheliym otekha reekha

Hebrew: רִ֭יבְךָ רִ֣יב אֶת־רֵעֶ֑ךָ וְס֖וֹד אַחֵ֣ר אַל־תְּגָֽל׃
Translated:
Defend your right against your fellow,
But do not give away the secrets of another,
Transliteration: riyvekha riyv et-reekha vesvod acher al-tegal

Hebrew: פֶּֽן־יְחַסֶּדְךָ֥ שֹׁמֵ֑עַ וְ֝דִבָּתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א תָשֽׁוּב׃
Translated:
Lest he who hears it reproach you,
And your bad repute never end.
Transliteration: fen-yechasedekha shomea vedivatekha lo tashuv

Hebrew: תַּפּוּחֵ֣י זָ֭הָב בְּמַשְׂכִּיּ֣וֹת כָּ֑סֶף דָּ֝בָ֗ר דָּבֻ֥ר עַל־אׇפְנָֽיו׃
Translated:
Like golden apples in silver showpieces
Is a phrase well turned.
Transliteration: tafuchey zahav vemashekhiyyvot khasef davar davur al-ׇfenayv

Hebrew: נֶ֣זֶם זָ֭הָב וַחֲלִי־כָ֑תֶם מוֹכִ֥יחַ חָ֝כָ֗ם עַל־אֹ֥זֶן שֹׁמָֽעַת׃
Translated:
Like a ring of gold, a golden ornament,
Is a wise man’s reproof in a receptive ear.
Transliteration: nezem zahav vachaliy-khatem mvokhiycha chakham al-ozen shomaat

Hebrew: כְּצִנַּת־שֶׁ֨לֶג ׀ בְּי֬וֹם קָצִ֗יר צִ֣יר נֶ֭אֱמָן לְשֹׁלְחָ֑יו וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ אֲדֹנָ֣יו יָשִֽׁיב׃ {פ}
Translated:
Like the coldness of snow at harvesttime
Is a trusty messenger to those who send him;
He lifts his master’s spirits.
Transliteration: khetsinat-sheleg veyvom katsiyr tsiyr neeman lesholechayv venefesh adonayv yashiyv {f}

Hebrew: נְשִׂיאִ֣ים וְ֭רוּחַ וְגֶ֣שֶׁם אָ֑יִן אִ֥ישׁ מִ֝תְהַלֵּ֗ל בְּמַתַּת־שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translated:
Like clouds, wind—but no rain—
Is one who boasts of gifts not given.
Transliteration: neshiyiym verucha vegeshem ayiin iysh mitehalel vematat-shaker

Hebrew: בְּאֹ֣רֶךְ אַ֭פַּיִם יְפֻתֶּ֣ה קָצִ֑ין וְלָשׁ֥וֹן רַ֝כָּ֗ה תִּשְׁבׇּר־גָּֽרֶם׃
Translated:
Through forbearance a ruler may be won over;
A gentle tongue can break bones.
Transliteration: veorekhe afayim yefuteh katsiyn velashvon rakhah tishevׇr-garem

Hebrew: דְּבַ֣שׁ מָ֭צָאתָ אֱכֹ֣ל דַּיֶּ֑ךָּ פֶּן־תִּ֝שְׂבָּעֶ֗נּוּ וַהֲקֵאתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
If you find honey, eat only what you need,
Lest, surfeiting yourself, you throw it up.
Transliteration: devash matsata ekhol dayekha fen-tishevaenu vahaketvo

Hebrew: הֹקַ֣ר רַ֭גְלְךָ מִבֵּ֣ית רֵעֶ֑ךָ פֶּן־יִ֝שְׂבָּעֲךָ֗ וּשְׂנֵאֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Visit your neighbor sparingly,
Lest he have his surfeit of you and loathe you.
Transliteration: hokar ragelekha miveyt reekha fen-yishevaakha usheneekha

Hebrew: מֵפִ֣יץ וְ֭חֶרֶב וְחֵ֣ץ שָׁנ֑וּן אִ֥ישׁ עֹנֶ֥ה בְ֝רֵעֵ֗הוּ עֵ֣ד שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translated:
Like a club, a sword, a sharpened arrow,
Is a man who testifies falsely against his fellow.
Transliteration: mefiyts vecherev vechets shanun iysh oneh vereehu ed shaker

Hebrew: שֵׁ֣ן רֹ֭עָה וְרֶ֣גֶל מוּעָ֑דֶת מִבְטָ֥ח בּ֝וֹגֵ֗ד בְּי֣וֹם צָרָֽה׃
Translated:
Like a loose tooth and an unsteady leg,
Is a treacherous support in time of trouble.
Transliteration: shen roah veregel muadet mivetach vvoged veyvom tsarah

Hebrew: מַ֥עֲדֶה־בֶּ֨גֶד ׀ בְּי֣וֹם קָ֭רָה חֹ֣מֶץ עַל־נָ֑תֶר וְשָׁ֥ר בַּ֝שִּׁרִ֗ים עַ֣ל לֶב־רָֽע׃ {פ}
Translated:
Disrobing on a chilly day,
Like vinegar on natron,
Is one who sings songs to a sorrowful soul.
Transliteration: maadeh-veged veyvom karah chomets al-nater veshar vashiriym al lev-ra {f}

Hebrew: אִם־רָעֵ֣ב שֹׂ֭נַאֲךָ הַאֲכִלֵ֣הוּ לָ֑חֶם וְאִם־צָ֝מֵ֗א הַשְׁקֵ֥הוּ מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
If your enemy is hungry, give him bread to eat;
If he is thirsty, give him water to drink.
Transliteration: im-raev shonaakha haakhilehu lachem veim-tsame hashekehu mayiim

Hebrew: כִּ֤י גֶחָלִ֗ים אַ֭תָּה חֹתֶ֣ה עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה יְשַׁלֶּם־לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
You will be heaping live coals on his head,
And the LORD will reward you.
Transliteration: khiy gechaliym atah choteh al-roshvo vayhovah yeshalem-lakhe

Hebrew: ר֣וּחַ צָ֭פוֹן תְּח֣וֹלֵֽל גָּ֑שֶׁם וּפָנִ֥ים נִ֝זְעָמִ֗ים לְשׁ֣וֹן סָֽתֶר׃
Translated:
A north wind produces rain,
And whispered words, a glowering face.
Transliteration: rucha tsafvon techvolel gashem ufaniym nizeamiym leshvon sater

Hebrew: ט֗וֹב שֶׁ֥בֶת עַל־פִּנַּת־גָּ֑ג מֵאֵ֥שֶׁת (מדונים) [מִ֝דְיָנִ֗ים] וּבֵ֥ית חָֽבֶר׃
Translated:
Dwelling in the corner of a roof is better
Than a contentious woman in a spacious house.
Transliteration: tvov shevet al-finat-gag meeshet (mdvnym) [mideyaniym] uveyt chaver

Hebrew: מַ֣יִם קָ֭רִים עַל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ עֲיֵפָ֑ה וּשְׁמוּעָ֥ה ט֝וֹבָ֗ה מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מֶרְחָֽק׃
Translated:
Like cold water to a parched throat
Is good news from a distant land.
Transliteration: mayiim kariym al-nefesh aeifah ushemuah tvovah meerets merechak

Hebrew: מַעְיָ֣ן נִ֭רְפָּשׂ וּמָק֣וֹר מׇשְׁחָ֑ת צַ֝דִּ֗יק מָ֣ט לִפְנֵֽי־רָשָֽׁע׃
Translated:
Like a muddied spring, a ruined fountain,
Is a righteous man fallen before a wicked one.
Transliteration: maeyan nirefash umakvor mׇshechat tsadiyk mat lifeney-rasha

Hebrew: אָ֘כֹ֤ל דְּבַ֣שׁ הַרְבּ֣וֹת לֹא־ט֑וֹב וְחֵ֖קֶר כְּבֹדָ֣ם כָּבֽוֹד׃
Translated:
It is not good to eat much honey,
Nor is it honorable to search for honor.
Transliteration: akhol devash harevvot lo-tvov vecheker khevodam khavvod

Hebrew: עִ֣יר פְּ֭רוּצָה אֵ֣ין חוֹמָ֑ה אִ֝֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֵ֖ין מַעְצָ֣ר לְרוּחֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Like an open city without walls
Is a man whose temper is uncurbed.
Transliteration: iyr ferutsah eyn chvomah iysh asher eyn maetsar leruchvo

Hebrew: כַּשֶּׁ֤לֶג ׀ בַּקַּ֗יִץ וְכַמָּטָ֥ר בַּקָּצִ֑יר כֵּ֤ן לֹֽא־נָאוֶ֖ה לִכְסִ֣יל כָּבֽוֹד׃
Translated:
Like snow in summer and rain at harvesttime,
So honor is not fitting for a dullard.
Transliteration: khasheleg vakayiits vekhamatar vakatsiyr khen lo-naveh likhesiyl khavvod

Hebrew: כַּצִּפּ֣וֹר לָ֭נוּד כַּדְּר֣וֹר לָע֑וּף כֵּ֥ן קִֽלְלַ֥ת חִ֝נָּ֗ם (לא) [ל֣וֹ] תָבֹֽא׃
Translated:
As a sparrow must flit and a swallow fly,
So a gratuitous curse must backfire.
Transliteration: khatsifvor lanud khadervor lauf khen kilelat chinam (l) [lvo] tavo

Hebrew: שׁ֣וֹט לַ֭סּוּס מֶ֣תֶג לַחֲמ֑וֹר וְ֝שֵׁ֗בֶט לְגֵ֣ו כְּסִילִֽים׃
Translated:
A whip for a horse and a bridle for a donkey,
And a rod for the back of dullards.
Transliteration: shvot lasus meteg lachamvor veshevet legev khesiyliym

Hebrew: אַל־תַּ֣עַן כְּ֭סִיל כְּאִוַּלְתּ֑וֹ פֶּֽן־תִּשְׁוֶה־לּ֥וֹ גַם־אָֽתָּה׃
Translated:
Do not answer a dullard in accord with his folly,
Else you will become like him.
Transliteration: al-taan khesiyl kheivaletvo fen-tisheveh-lvo gam-atah

Hebrew: עֲנֵ֣ה כְ֭סִיל כְּאִוַּלְתּ֑וֹ פֶּן־יִהְיֶ֖ה חָכָ֣ם בְּעֵינָֽיו׃
Translated:
Answer a dullard in accord with his folly,
Else he will think himself wise.
Transliteration: aneh khesiyl kheivaletvo fen-yiheyeh chakham veeynayv

Hebrew: מְקַצֶּ֣ה רַ֭גְלַיִם חָמָ֣ס שֹׁתֶ֑ה שֹׁלֵ֖חַ דְּבָרִ֣ים בְּיַד־כְּסִֽיל׃
Translated:
He who sends a message by a dullard
Will wear out legs and must put up with lawlessness.
Transliteration: mekatseh ragelayim chamas shoteh sholecha devariym veyad-khesiyl

Hebrew: דַּלְי֣וּ שֹׁ֭קַיִם מִפִּסֵּ֑חַ וּ֝מָשָׁ֗ל בְּפִ֣י כְסִילִֽים׃
Translated:
As legs hang limp on a cripple,
So is a proverb in the mouth of dullards.
Transliteration: daleyu shokayim mifisecha umashal vefiy khesiyliym

Hebrew: כִּצְר֣וֹר אֶ֭בֶן בְּמַרְגֵּמָ֑ה כֵּן־נוֹתֵ֖ן לִכְסִ֣יל כָּבֽוֹד׃
Translated:
Like a pebble in a sling,
So is paying honor to a dullard.
Transliteration: khitservor even vemaregemah khen-nvoten likhesiyl khavvod

Hebrew: ח֭וֹחַ עָלָ֣ה בְיַד־שִׁכּ֑וֹר וּ֝מָשָׁ֗ל בְּפִ֣י כְסִילִֽים׃
Translated:
As a thorn comes to the hand of a drunkard,
So a proverb to the mouth of a dullard.
Transliteration: chvocha alah veyad-shikhvor umashal vefiy khesiyliym

Hebrew: רַ֥ב מְחוֹלֵֽל־כֹּ֑ל וְשֹׂכֵ֥ר כְּ֝סִ֗יל וְשֹׂכֵ֥ר עֹבְרִֽים׃
Translated:
A master can produce anything,
But he who hires a dullard is as one who hires transients.
Transliteration: rav mechvolel-khol veshokher khesiyl veshokher overiym

Hebrew: כְּ֭כֶלֶב שָׁ֣ב עַל־קֵא֑וֹ כְּ֝סִ֗יל שׁוֹנֶ֥ה בְאִוַּלְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
As a dog returns to his vomit,
So a dullard repeats his folly.
Transliteration: khekhelev shav al-kevo khesiyl shvoneh veivaletvo

Hebrew: רָאִ֗יתָ אִ֭ישׁ חָכָ֣ם בְּעֵינָ֑יו תִּקְוָ֖ה לִכְסִ֣יל מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
If you see a man who thinks himself wise,
There is more hope for a dullard than for him.
Transliteration: raiyta iysh chakham veeynayv tikevah likhesiyl mimenu

Hebrew: אָמַ֣ר עָ֭צֵל שַׁ֣חַל בַּדָּ֑רֶךְ אֲ֝רִ֗י בֵּ֣ין הָרְחֹבֽוֹת׃
Translated:
A lazy man says,
“There’s a cub on the road, a lion in the squares.”
Transliteration: amar atsel shachal vadarekhe ariy veyn harechovvot

Hebrew: הַ֭דֶּלֶת תִּסּ֣וֹב עַל־צִירָ֑הּ וְ֝עָצֵ֗ל עַל־מִטָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The door turns on its hinge,
And the lazy man on his bed.
Transliteration: hadelet tisvov al-tsiyrah veatsel al-mitatvo

Hebrew: טָ֘מַ֤ן עָצֵ֣ל יָ֭דוֹ בַּצַּלָּ֑חַת נִ֝לְאָ֗ה לַהֲשִׁיבָ֥הּ אֶל־פִּֽיו׃
Translated:
The lazy man buries his hand in the bowl;
He will not even bring it to his mouth.
Transliteration: taman atsel yadvo vatsalachat nileah lahashiyvah el-fiyv

Hebrew: חָכָ֣ם עָצֵ֣ל בְּעֵינָ֑יו מִ֝שִּׁבְעָ֗ה מְשִׁ֣יבֵי טָֽעַם׃
Translated:
The lazy man thinks himself wiser
Than seven men who give good advice.
Transliteration: chakham atsel veeynayv mishiveah meshiyvey taam

Hebrew: מַחֲזִ֥יק בְּאׇזְנֵי־כָ֑לֶב עֹבֵ֥ר מִ֝תְעַבֵּ֗ר עַל־רִ֥יב לֹּא־לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
A passerby who gets embroiled in someone else’s quarrel
Is like one who seizes a dog by its ears.
Transliteration: machaziyk veׇzeney-khalev over miteaver al-riyv lo-lvo

Hebrew: כְּֽ֭מִתְלַהְלֵהַּ הַיֹּרֶ֥ה זִקִּ֗ים חִצִּ֥ים וָמָֽוֶת׃
Translated: Like a madman scattering deadly firebrands, arrows,
Transliteration: khemitelaheleha hayoreh zikiym chitsiym vamavet

Hebrew: כֵּֽן־אִ֭ישׁ רִמָּ֣ה אֶת־רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְ֝אָמַ֗ר הֲֽלֹא־מְשַׂחֵ֥ק אָֽנִי׃
Translated: Is one who cheats his fellow and says, “I was only joking.”
Transliteration: khen-iysh rimah et-reehu veamar halo-meshachek aniy

Hebrew: בְּאֶ֣פֶס עֵ֭צִים תִּכְבֶּה־אֵ֑שׁ וּבְאֵ֥ין נִ֝רְגָּ֗ן יִשְׁתֹּ֥ק מָדֽוֹן׃
Translated:
For lack of wood a fire goes out,
And without a querulous man contention is stilled.
Transliteration: veefes etsiym tikheveh-esh uveeyn niregan yishetok madvon

Hebrew: פֶּחָ֣ם לְ֭גֶחָלִים וְעֵצִ֣ים לְאֵ֑שׁ וְאִ֥ישׁ (מדונים) [מִ֝דְיָנִ֗ים] לְחַרְחַר־רִֽיב׃ {פ}
Translated:
Charcoal for embers and wood for a fire
And a contentious man for kindling strife.
Transliteration: fecham legechaliym veetsiym leesh veiysh (mdvnym) [mideyaniym] lecharechar-riyv {f}

Hebrew: דִּבְרֵ֣י נִ֭רְגָּן כְּמִֽתְלַהֲמִ֑ים וְ֝הֵ֗ם יָרְד֥וּ חַדְרֵי־בָֽטֶן׃
Translated:
The words of a querulous man are bruising;
They penetrate one’s inmost parts.
Transliteration: diverey niregan khemitelahamiym vehem yaredu chaderey-vaten

Hebrew: כֶּ֣סֶף סִ֭יגִים מְצֻפֶּ֣ה עַל־חָ֑רֶשׂ שְׂפָתַ֖יִם דֹּלְקִ֣ים וְלֶב־רָֽע׃
Translated:
Base silver laid over earthenware
Are ardent lips with an evil mind.
Transliteration: khesef siygiym metsufeh al-charesh shefatayiim dolekiym velev-ra

Hebrew: בִּ֭שְׂפָתָו יִנָּכֵ֣ר שׂוֹנֵ֑א וּ֝בְקִרְבּ֗וֹ יָשִׁ֥ית מִרְמָֽה׃
Translated:
An enemy dissembles with his speech,
Inwardly he harbors deceit.
Transliteration: vishefatav yinakher shvone uvekirevvo yashiyt miremah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יְחַנֵּ֣ן ק֭וֹלוֹ אַל־תַּאֲמֶן־בּ֑וֹ כִּ֤י שֶׁ֖בַע תּוֹעֵב֣וֹת בְּלִבּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Though he be fair-spoken do not trust him,
For seven abominations are in his mind.
Transliteration: khiy-yechanen kvolvo al-taamen-vvo khiy sheva tvoevvot velivvo

Hebrew: תִּכַּסֶּ֣ה שִׂ֭נְאָה בְּמַשָּׁא֑וֹן תִּגָּלֶ֖ה רָעָת֣וֹ בְקָהָֽל׃
Translated:
His hatred may be concealed by dissimulation,
But his evil will be exposed to public view.
Transliteration: tikhaseh shineah vemashavon tigaleh raatvo vekahal

Hebrew: כֹּֽרֶה־שַּׁ֭חַת בָּ֣הּ יִפּ֑וֹל וְג֥וֹלֵֽל אֶ֝֗בֶן אֵלָ֥יו תָּשֽׁוּב׃
Translated:
He who digs a pit will fall in it,
And whoever rolls a stone, it will roll back on him.
Transliteration: khoreh-shachat vah yifvol vegvolel even elayv tashuv

Hebrew: לְֽשׁוֹן־שֶׁ֭קֶר יִשְׂנָ֣א דַכָּ֑יו וּפֶ֥ה חָ֝לָ֗ק יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה מִדְחֶֽה׃
Translated:
A lying tongue hates those crushed by it;
Smooth speech throws one down.
Transliteration: leshvon-sheker yishena dakhayv ufeh chalak yaasheh midecheh

Hebrew: אַֽל־תִּ֭תְהַלֵּל בְּי֣וֹם מָחָ֑ר כִּ֤י לֹֽא־תֵ֝דַ֗ע מַה־יֵּ֥לֶד יֽוֹם׃
Translated:
Do not boast of tomorrow,
For you do not know what the day will bring.
Transliteration: al-titehalel veyvom machar khiy lo-teda mah-yeled yvom

Hebrew: יְהַלֶּלְךָ֣ זָ֣ר וְלֹא־פִ֑יךָ נׇ֝כְרִ֗י וְאַל־שְׂפָתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Let the mouth of another praise you, not yours,
The lips of a stranger, not your own.
Transliteration: yehalelekha zar velo-fiykha nׇkheriy veal-shefateykha

Hebrew: כֹּֽבֶד־אֶ֭בֶן וְנֵ֣טֶל הַח֑וֹל וְכַ֥עַס אֱ֝וִ֗יל כָּבֵ֥ד מִשְּׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
A stone has weight, sand is heavy,
But a fool’s vexation outweighs them both.
Transliteration: khoved-even venetel hachvol vekhaas eviyl khaved misheneyhem

Hebrew: אַכְזְרִיּ֣וּת חֵ֭מָה וְשֶׁ֣טֶף אָ֑ף וּמִ֥י יַ֝עֲמֹ֗ד לִפְנֵ֥י קִנְאָֽה׃
Translated:
There is the cruelty of fury, the overflowing of anger,
But who can withstand jealousy?
Transliteration: akhezeriyyut chemah veshetef af umiy yaamod lifeney kineah

Hebrew: ט֭וֹבָה תּוֹכַ֣חַת מְגֻלָּ֑ה מֵאַהֲבָ֥ה מְסֻתָּֽרֶת׃
Translated: Open reproof is better than concealed love.
Transliteration: tvovah tvokhachat megulah meahavah mesutaret

Hebrew: נֶ֭אֱמָנִים פִּצְעֵ֣י אוֹהֵ֑ב וְ֝נַעְתָּר֗וֹת נְשִׁיק֥וֹת שׂוֹנֵֽא׃
Translated:
Wounds by a loved one are long lasting;
The kisses of an enemy are profuse.
Transliteration: neemaniym fitseey vohev venaetarvot neshiykvot shvone

Hebrew: נֶ֣פֶשׁ שְׂ֭בֵעָה תָּב֣וּס נֹ֑פֶת וְנֶ֥פֶשׁ רְ֝עֵבָ֗ה כׇּל־מַ֥ר מָתֽוֹק׃
Translated:
A sated person disdains honey,
But to a hungry man anything bitter seems sweet.
Transliteration: nefesh sheveah tavus nofet venefesh reevah khׇl-mar matvok

Hebrew: כְּ֭צִפּוֹר נוֹדֶ֣דֶת מִן־קִנָּ֑הּ כֵּֽן־אִ֝֗ישׁ נוֹדֵ֥ד מִמְּקוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Like a sparrow wandering from its nest
Is a man who wanders from his home.
Transliteration: khetsifvor nvodedet min-kinah khen-iysh nvoded mimekvomvo

Hebrew: שֶׁ֣מֶן וּ֭קְטֹרֶת יְשַׂמַּֽח־לֵ֑ב וּמֶ֥תֶק רֵ֝עֵ֗הוּ מֵעֲצַת־נָֽפֶשׁ׃
Translated:
Oil and incense gladden the heart,
And the sweetness of a friend is better than one’s own counsel.
Transliteration: shemen uketoret yeshamach-lev umetek reehu meatsat-nafesh

Hebrew: רֵ֥עֲךָ֨ (ורעה) [וְרֵ֪עַ] אָבִ֡יךָ אַֽל־תַּעֲזֹ֗ב וּבֵ֥ית אָחִ֗יךָ אַל־תָּ֭בוֹא בְּי֣וֹם אֵידֶ֑ךָ ט֥וֹב שָׁכֵ֥ן קָ֝ר֗וֹב מֵאָ֥ח רָחֽוֹק׃
Translated:
Do not desert your friend and your father’s friend;
Do not enter your brother’s house in your time of misfortune;
A close neighbor is better than a distant brother.
Transliteration: reakha (vrh) [verea] aviykha al-taazov uveyt achiykha al-tavvo veyvom eydekha tvov shakhen karvov meach rachvok

Hebrew: חֲכַ֣ם בְּ֭נִי וְשַׂמַּ֣ח לִבִּ֑י וְאָשִׁ֖יבָה חֹרְפִ֣י דָבָֽר׃
Translated:
Get wisdom, my son, and gladden my heart,
That I may have what to answer those who taunt me.
Transliteration: chakham veniy veshamach liviy veashiyvah chorefiy davar

Hebrew: עָר֤וּם ׀ רָאָ֣ה רָעָ֣ה נִסְתָּ֑ר פְּ֝תָאיִ֗ם עָבְר֥וּ נֶעֱנָֽשׁוּ׃
Translated:
The shrewd man saw trouble and took cover;
The simple kept going and paid the penalty.
Transliteration: arum raah raah nisetar fetayim averu neenashu

Hebrew: קַח־בִּ֭גְדוֹ כִּי־עָ֣רַב זָ֑ר וּבְעַ֖ד נׇכְרִיָּ֣ה חַבְלֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
Seize his garment, for he stood surety for another;
Take it as a pledge, [for he stood surety] for an unfamiliar woman.
Transliteration: kach-vigedvo khiy-arav zar uvead nׇkheriyah chavelehu

Hebrew: מְבָ֘רֵ֤ךְ רֵעֵ֨הוּ ׀ בְּק֣וֹל גָּ֭דוֹל בַּבֹּ֣קֶר הַשְׁכֵּ֑ים קְ֝לָלָ֗ה תֵּחָ֥שֶׁב לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He who greets his fellow loudly early in the morning
Shall have it reckoned to him as a curse.
Transliteration: mevarekhe reehu vekvol gadvol vavoker hashekheym kelalah techashev lvo

Hebrew: דֶּ֣לֶף ט֭וֹרֵד בְּי֣וֹם סַגְרִ֑יר וְאֵ֥שֶׁת (מדונים) [מִ֝דְיָנִ֗ים] נִשְׁתָּוָֽה׃
Translated:
An endless dripping on a rainy day
And a contentious wife are alike;
Transliteration: delef tvored veyvom sageriyr veeshet (mdvnym) [mideyaniym] nishetavah

Hebrew: צֹפְנֶ֥יהָ צָפַן־ר֑וּחַ וְשֶׁ֖מֶן יְמִינ֣וֹ יִקְרָֽא׃
Translated:
As soon repress her as repress the wind,
Or declare one’s right hand to be oil.
Transliteration: tsofeneyha tsafan-rucha veshemen yemiynvo yikera

Hebrew: בַּרְזֶ֣ל בְּבַרְזֶ֣ל יָ֑חַד וְ֝אִ֗ישׁ יַ֣חַד פְּנֵֽי־רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
As iron sharpens iron
So a man sharpens the wit of his friend.
Transliteration: varezel vevarezel yachad veiysh yachad feney-reehu

Hebrew: נֹצֵ֣ר תְּ֭אֵנָה יֹאכַ֣ל פִּרְיָ֑הּ וְשֹׁמֵ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣יו יְכֻבָּֽד׃
Translated:
He who tends a fig tree will enjoy its fruit,
And he who cares for his master will be honored.
Transliteration: notser teenah yokhal fireyah veshomer adonayv yekhuvad

Hebrew: כַּ֭מַּיִם הַפָּנִ֣ים לַפָּנִ֑ים כֵּ֤ן לֵֽב־הָ֝אָדָ֗ם לָאָדָֽם׃
Translated:
As face answers to face in water,
So does one man’s heart to another.
Transliteration: khamayim hafaniym lafaniym khen lev-haadam laadam

Hebrew: שְׁא֣וֹל וַ֭אֲבַדֹּה לֹ֣א תִשְׂבַּ֑עְנָה וְעֵינֵ֥י הָ֝אָדָ֗ם לֹ֣א תִשְׂבַּֽעְנָה׃
Translated:
Sheol and Abaddon cannot be satisfied,
Nor can the eyes of man be satisfied.
Transliteration: shevol vaavadoh lo tishevaenah veeyney haadam lo tishevaenah

Hebrew: מַצְרֵ֣ף לַ֭כֶּסֶף וְכ֣וּר לַזָּהָ֑ב וְ֝אִ֗ישׁ לְפִ֣י מַהֲלָלֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For silver—the crucible, for gold—the furnace,
And a man is tested by his praise.
Transliteration: matseref lakhesef vekhur lazahav veiysh lefiy mahalalvo

Hebrew: אִ֥ם־תִּכְתּֽוֹשׁ־אֶת־הָאֱוִ֨יל ׀ בַּ֥מַּכְתֵּ֡שׁ בְּת֣וֹךְ הָ֭רִיפוֹת בַּעֱלִ֑י לֹא־תָס֥וּר מֵ֝עָלָ֗יו אִוַּלְתּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Even if you pound the fool in a mortar
With a pestle along with grain,
His folly will not leave him.
Transliteration: im-tikhetvosh-et-haeviyl vamakhetesh vetvokhe hariyfvot vaeliy lo-tasur mealayv ivaletvo {f}

Hebrew: יָדֹ֣עַ תֵּ֭דַע פְּנֵ֣י צֹאנֶ֑ךָ שִׁ֥ית לִ֝בְּךָ֗ לַעֲדָרִֽים׃
Translated:
Mind well the looks of your flock;
Pay attention to your herds;
Transliteration: yadoa teda feney tsonekha shiyt livekha laadariym

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א לְעוֹלָ֣ם חֹ֑סֶן וְאִם־נֵ֝֗זֶר לְד֣וֹר (דור) [וָדֽוֹר]׃
Translated:
For property does not last forever,
Or a crown for all generations.
Transliteration: khiy lo levolam chosen veim-nezer ledvor (dvr) [vadvor]

Hebrew: גָּלָ֣ה חָ֭צִיר וְנִרְאָה־דֶ֑שֶׁא וְ֝נֶאֶסְפ֗וּ עִשְּׂב֥וֹת הָרִֽים׃
Translated:
Grass vanishes, new grass appears,
And the herbage of the hills is gathered in.
Transliteration: galah chatsiyr venireah-deshe veneesefu ishevvot hariym

Hebrew: כְּבָשִׂ֥ים לִלְבוּשֶׁ֑ךָ וּמְחִ֥יר שָׂ֝דֶ֗ה עַתּוּדִֽים׃
Translated:
The lambs will provide you with clothing,
The he-goats, the price of a field.
Transliteration: khevashiym lilevushekha umechiyr shadeh atudiym

Hebrew: וְדֵ֤י ׀ חֲלֵ֬ב עִזִּ֗ים לְֽ֭לַחְמְךָ לְלֶ֣חֶם בֵּיתֶ֑ךָ וְ֝חַיִּ֗ים לְנַעֲרוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
The goats’ milk will suffice for your food,
The food of your household,
And the maintenance of your maids.
Transliteration: vedey chalev iziym lelachemekha lelechem veytekha vechayiym lenaarvoteykha

Hebrew: נָ֣סוּ וְאֵין־רֹדֵ֣ף רָשָׁ֑ע וְ֝צַדִּיקִ֗ים כִּכְפִ֥יר יִבְטָֽח׃
Translated:
The wicked flee though no one gives chase,
But the righteous are as confident as a lion.
Transliteration: nasu veeyn-rodef rasha vetsadiykiym khikhefiyr yivetach

Hebrew: בְּפֶ֣שַֽׁע אֶ֭רֶץ רַבִּ֣ים שָׂרֶ֑יהָ וּבְאָדָ֥ם מֵבִ֥ין יֹ֝דֵ֗עַ כֵּ֣ן יַאֲרִֽיךְ׃
Translated:
When there is rebellion in the land, many are its rulers;
But with a man who has understanding and knowledge, stability will last.
Transliteration: vefesha erets raviym shareyha uveadam meviyn yodea khen yaariykhe

Hebrew: גֶּֽבֶר־רָ֭שׁ וְעֹשֵׁ֣ק דַּלִּ֑ים מָטָ֥ר סֹ֝חֵ֗ף וְאֵ֣ין לָֽחֶם׃
Translated:
A poor man who withholds what is due to the wretched
Is like a destructive rain that leaves no food.
Transliteration: gever-rash veoshek daliym matar sochef veeyn lachem

Hebrew: עֹזְבֵ֣י ת֭וֹרָה יְהַלְל֣וּ רָשָׁ֑ע וְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י ת֝וֹרָ֗ה יִתְגָּ֥רוּ בָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
Those who forsake instruction praise the wicked,
But those who heed instruction fight them.
Transliteration: ozevey tvorah yehalelu rasha veshomerey tvorah yitegaru vam {f}

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁי־רָ֭ע לֹא־יָבִ֣ינוּ מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּמְבַקְשֵׁ֥י יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה יָבִ֥ינוּ כֹֽל׃
Translated:
Evil men cannot discern judgment,
But those who seek the LORD discern all things.
Transliteration: aneshey-ra lo-yaviynu mishefat umevakeshey yehovah yaviynu khol

Hebrew: טֽוֹב־רָ֭שׁ הוֹלֵ֣ךְ בְּתֻמּ֑וֹ מֵעִקֵּ֥שׁ דְּ֝רָכַ֗יִם וְה֣וּא עָשִֽׁיר׃
Translated:
Better is a poor man who lives blamelessly
Than a rich man whose ways are crooked.
Transliteration: tvov-rash hvolekhe vetumvo meikesh derakhayiim vehu ashiyr

Hebrew: נוֹצֵ֣ר תּ֭וֹרָה בֵּ֣ן מֵבִ֑ין וְרֹעֶ֥ה ז֝וֹלְלִ֗ים יַכְלִ֥ים אָבִֽיו׃
Translated:
An intelligent son heeds instruction,
But he who keeps company with gluttons disgraces his father.
Transliteration: nvotser tvorah ven meviyn veroeh zvoleliym yakheliym aviyv

Hebrew: מַרְבֶּ֣ה ה֭וֹנוֹ בְּנֶ֣שֶׁךְ (ובתרבית) [וְתַרְבִּ֑ית] לְחוֹנֵ֖ן דַּלִּ֣ים יִקְבְּצֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
He who increases his wealth by loans at discount or interest
Amasses it for one who is generous to the poor.
Transliteration: mareveh hvonvo veneshekhe (vvtrvyt) [vetareviyt] lechvonen daliym yikevetsenu

Hebrew: מֵסִ֣יר אׇ֭זְנוֹ מִשְּׁמֹ֣עַ תּוֹרָ֑ה גַּ֥ם תְּ֝פִלָּת֗וֹ תּוֹעֵבָֽה׃
Translated:
He who turns a deaf ear to instruction—
His prayer is an abomination.
Transliteration: mesiyr ׇzenvo mishemoa tvorah gam tefilatvo tvoevah

Hebrew: מַשְׁגֶּ֤ה יְשָׁרִ֨ים ׀ בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ רָ֗ע בִּשְׁחוּת֥וֹ הֽוּא־יִפּ֑וֹל וּ֝תְמִימִ֗ים יִנְחֲלוּ־טֽוֹב׃ {פ}
Translated:
He who misleads the upright into an evil course
Will fall into his own pit,
But the blameless will prosper.
Transliteration: mashegeh yeshariym vederekhe ra vishechutvo hu-yifvol utemiymiym yinechalu-tvov {f}

Hebrew: חָכָ֣ם בְּ֭עֵינָיו אִ֣ישׁ עָשִׁ֑יר וְדַ֖ל מֵבִ֣ין יַחְקְרֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
A rich man is clever in his own eyes,
But a perceptive poor man can see through him.
Transliteration: chakham veeynayv iysh ashiyr vedal meviyn yachekerenu

Hebrew: בַּעֲלֹ֣ץ צַ֭דִּיקִים רַבָּ֣ה תִפְאָ֑רֶת וּבְק֥וּם רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יְחֻפַּ֥שׂ אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
When the righteous exult there is great glory,
But when the wicked rise up men make themselves scarce.
Transliteration: vaalots tsadiykiym ravah tifearet uvekum reshaiym yechufash adam

Hebrew: מְכַסֶּ֣ה פְ֭שָׁעָיו לֹ֣א יַצְלִ֑יחַ וּמוֹדֶ֖ה וְעֹזֵ֣ב יְרֻחָֽם׃
Translated:
He who covers up his faults will not succeed;
He who confesses and gives them up will find mercy.
Transliteration: mekhaseh feshaayv lo yatseliycha umvodeh veozev yerucham

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֣י אָ֭דָם מְפַחֵ֣ד תָּמִ֑יד וּמַקְשֶׁ֥ה לִ֝בּ֗וֹ יִפּ֥וֹל בְּרָעָֽה׃
Translated:
Happy is the man who is anxious always,
But he who hardens his heart falls into misfortune.
Transliteration: asherey adam mefached tamiyd umakesheh livvo yifvol veraah

Hebrew: אֲֽרִי־נֹ֭הֵם וְדֹ֣ב שׁוֹקֵ֑ק מוֹשֵׁ֥ל רָ֝שָׁ֗ע עַ֣ל עַם־דָּֽל׃
Translated:
A roaring lion and a prowling bear
Is a wicked man ruling a helpless people.
Transliteration: ariy-nohem vedov shvokek mvoshel rasha al am-dal

Hebrew: נָגִ֗יד חֲסַ֣ר תְּ֭בוּנוֹת וְרַ֥ב מַעֲשַׁקּ֑וֹת (שנאי) [שֹׂ֥נֵא] בֶ֝֗צַע יַאֲרִ֥יךְ יָמִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated:
A prince who lacks understanding is very oppressive;
He who spurns ill-gotten gains will live long.
Transliteration: nagiyd chasar tevunvot verav maashakvot (shny) [shone] vetsa yaariykhe yamiym {f}

Hebrew: אָ֭<small>דָ</small>ם עָשֻׁ֣ק בְּדַם־נָ֑פֶשׁ עַד־בּ֥וֹר יָ֝נ֗וּס אַל־יִתְמְכוּ־בֽוֹ׃
Translated:
A man oppressed by bloodguilt will flee to a pit;
Let none give him support.
Transliteration: a<small>da</small>m ashuk vedam-nafesh ad-vvor yanus al-yitemekhu-vvo

Hebrew: הוֹלֵ֣ךְ תָּ֭מִים יִוָּשֵׁ֑עַ וְנֶעְקַ֥שׁ דְּ֝רָכַ֗יִם יִפּ֥וֹל בְּאֶחָֽת׃
Translated:
He who lives blamelessly will be delivered,
But he who is crooked in his ways will fall all at once.
Transliteration: hvolekhe tamiym yivashea veneekash derakhayiim yifvol veechat

Hebrew: עֹבֵ֣ד אַ֭דְמָתוֹ יִֽשְׂבַּֽע־לָ֑חֶם וּמְרַדֵּ֥ף רֵ֝יקִ֗ים יִֽשְׂבַּֽע־רִֽישׁ׃
Translated:
He who tills his land will have food in plenty,
But he who pursues vanities will have poverty in plenty.
Transliteration: oved adematvo yisheva-lachem umeradef reykiym yisheva-riysh

Hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ אֱ֭מוּנוֹת רַב־בְּרָכ֑וֹת וְאָ֥ץ לְ֝הַעֲשִׁ֗יר לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶֽה׃
Translated:
A dependable man will receive many blessings,
But one in a hurry to get rich will not go unpunished.
Transliteration: iysh emunvot rav-verakhvot veats lehaashiyr lo yinakeh

Hebrew: הַֽכֵּר־פָּנִ֥ים לֹא־ט֑וֹב וְעַל־פַּת־לֶ֝֗חֶם יִפְשַׁע־גָּֽבֶר׃
Translated:
To be partial is not right;
A man may do wrong for a piece of bread.
Transliteration: hakher-faniym lo-tvov veal-fat-lechem yifesha-gaver

Hebrew: נִ֥בְהָֽל־לַה֗וֹן אִ֭ישׁ רַ֣ע עָ֑יִן וְלֹא־יֵ֝דַ֗ע כִּי־חֶ֥סֶר יְבֹאֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
A miserly man runs after wealth;
He does not realize that loss will overtake it.
Transliteration: nivehal-lahvon iysh ra ayiin velo-eida khiy-cheser yevoenu

Hebrew: מ֘וֹכִ֤יחַ אָדָ֣ם אַ֭חֲרַי חֵ֣ן יִמְצָ֑א מִֽמַּחֲלִ֥יק לָשֽׁוֹן׃
Translated:
He who reproves a man will in the end
Find more favor than he who flatters him.
Transliteration: mvokhiycha adam acharay chen yimetsa mimachaliyk lashvon

Hebrew: גּוֹזֵ֤ל ׀ אָ֘בִ֤יו וְאִמּ֗וֹ וְאֹמֵ֥ר אֵֽין־פָּ֑שַׁע חָבֵ֥ר ה֝֗וּא לְאִ֣ישׁ מַשְׁחִֽית׃
Translated:
He who robs his father and mother and says, “It is no offense,”
Is a companion to vandals.
Transliteration: gvozel aviyv veimvo veomer eyn-fasha chaver huu leiysh mashechiyt

Hebrew: רְחַב־נֶ֭פֶשׁ יְגָרֶ֣ה מָד֑וֹן וּבֹטֵ֖חַ עַל־יְהֹוָ֣ה יְדֻשָּֽׁן׃
Translated:
A greedy man provokes quarrels,
But he who trusts the LORD shall enjoy prosperity.
Transliteration: rechav-nefesh yegareh madvon uvotecha al-yehovah yedushan

Hebrew: בּוֹטֵ֣חַ בְּ֭לִבּוֹ ה֣וּא כְסִ֑יל וְהוֹלֵ֥ךְ בְּ֝חׇכְמָ֗ה ה֣וּא יִמָּלֵֽט׃
Translated:
He who trusts his own instinct is a dullard,
But he who lives by wisdom shall escape.
Transliteration: vvotecha velivvo hu khesiyl vehvolekhe vechׇkhemah hu yimalet

Hebrew: נוֹתֵ֣ן לָ֭רָשׁ אֵ֣ין מַחְס֑וֹר וּמַעְלִ֥ים עֵ֝ינָ֗יו רַב־מְאֵרֽוֹת׃
Translated:
He who gives to the poor will not be in want,
But he who shuts his eyes will be roundly cursed.
Transliteration: nvoten larash eyn machesvor umaeliym eynayv rav-meervot

Hebrew: בְּק֣וּם רְ֭שָׁעִים יִסָּתֵ֣ר אָדָ֑ם וּ֝בְאׇבְדָ֗ם יִרְבּ֥וּ צַדִּיקִֽים׃
Translated:
When the wicked rise up, men go into hiding,
But when they perish the righteous increase.
Transliteration: vekum reshaiym yisater adam uveׇvedam yirevu tsadiykiym

Hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ תּ֭וֹכָחוֹת מַקְשֶׁה־עֹ֑רֶף פֶּ֥תַע יִ֝שָּׁבֵ֗ר וְאֵ֣ין מַרְפֵּֽא׃
Translated:
One oft reproved may become stiffnecked,
But he will be suddenly broken beyond repair.
Transliteration: iysh tvokhachvot makesheh-oref feta yishaver veeyn marefe

Hebrew: בִּרְב֣וֹת צַ֭דִּיקִים יִשְׂמַ֣ח הָעָ֑ם וּבִמְשֹׁ֥ל רָ֝שָׁ֗ע יֵאָ֥נַֽח עָֽם׃
Translated:
When the righteous become great the people rejoice,
But when the wicked dominate the people groan.
Transliteration: virevvot tsadiykiym yishemach haam uvimeshol rasha eianach am

Hebrew: אִישׁ־אֹהֵ֣ב חׇ֭כְמָה יְשַׂמַּ֣ח אָבִ֑יו וְרֹעֶ֥ה ז֝וֹנ֗וֹת יְאַבֶּד־הֽוֹן׃
Translated:
A man who loves wisdom brings joy to his father,
But he who keeps company with harlots will lose his wealth.
Transliteration: iysh-ohev chׇkhemah yeshamach aviyv veroeh zvonvot yeaved-hvon

Hebrew: מֶ֗לֶךְ בְּ֭מִשְׁפָּט יַעֲמִ֣יד אָ֑רֶץ וְאִ֖ישׁ תְּרוּמ֣וֹת יֶהֶרְסֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
By justice a king sustains the land,
But a fraudulent man tears it down.
Transliteration: melekhe vemishefat yaamiyd arets veiysh terumvot yeheresenah

Hebrew: גֶּ֭בֶר מַחֲלִ֣יק עַל־רֵעֵ֑הוּ רֶ֝֗שֶׁת פּוֹרֵ֥שׂ עַל־פְּעָמָֽיו׃
Translated:
A man who flatters his fellow
Spreads a net for his feet.
Transliteration: gever machaliyk al-reehu reshet fvoresh al-feamayv

Hebrew: בְּפֶ֤שַֽׁע אִ֣ישׁ רָ֣ע מוֹקֵ֑שׁ וְ֝צַדִּ֗יק יָר֥וּן וְשָׂמֵֽחַ׃
Translated:
An evil man’s offenses are a trap for himself,
But the righteous sing out joyously.
Transliteration: vefesha iysh ra mvokesh vetsadiyk yarun veshamecha

Hebrew: יֹדֵ֣עַ צַ֭דִּיק דִּ֣ין דַּלִּ֑ים רָ֝שָׁ֗ע לֹא־יָבִ֥ין דָּֽעַת׃
Translated:
A righteous man is concerned with the cause of the wretched;
A wicked man cannot understand such concern.
Transliteration: yodea tsadiyk diyn daliym rasha lo-yaviyn daat

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֣י לָ֭צוֹן יָפִ֣יחוּ קִרְיָ֑ה וַ֝חֲכָמִ֗ים יָשִׁ֥יבוּ אָֽף׃
Translated:
Scoffers inflame a city,
But the wise allay anger.
Transliteration: aneshey latsvon yafiychu kireyah vachakhamiym yashiyvu af

Hebrew: אִֽישׁ־חָכָ֗ם נִ֭שְׁפָּט אֶת־אִ֣ישׁ אֱוִ֑יל וְרָגַ֥ז וְ֝שָׂחַ֗ק וְאֵ֣ין נָֽחַת׃
Translated:
When a wise man enters into litigation with a fool
There is ranting and ridicule, but no satisfaction.
Transliteration: iysh-chakham nishefat et-iysh eviyl veragaz veshachak veeyn nachat

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁ֣י דָ֭מִים יִשְׂנְאוּ־תָ֑ם וִ֝ישָׁרִ֗ים יְבַקְשׁ֥וּ נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
Bloodthirsty men detest the blameless,
But the upright seek them out.
Transliteration: aneshey damiym yisheneu-tam viyshariym yevakeshu nafeshvo

Hebrew: כׇּל־ר֭וּחוֹ יוֹצִ֣יא כְסִ֑יל וְ֝חָכָ֗ם בְּאָח֥וֹר יְשַׁבְּחֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
A dullard vents all his rage,
But a wise man calms it down.
Transliteration: khׇl-ruchvo yvotsiy khesiyl vechakham veachvor yeshavechenah

Hebrew: מֹ֭שֵׁל מַקְשִׁ֣יב עַל־דְּבַר־שָׁ֑קֶר כׇּֽל־מְשָׁרְתָ֥יו רְשָׁעִֽים׃
Translated:
A ruler who listens to lies,
All his ministers will be wicked.
Transliteration: moshel makeshiyv al-devar-shaker khׇl-mesharetayv reshaiym

Hebrew: רָ֤שׁ וְאִ֣ישׁ תְּכָכִ֣ים נִפְגָּ֑שׁוּ מֵ֤אִיר־עֵינֵ֖י שְׁנֵיהֶ֣ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
A poor man and a fraudulent man meet;
The LORD gives luster to the eyes of both.
Transliteration: rash veiysh tekhakhiym nifegashu meiyr-eyney sheneyhem yehovah

Hebrew: מֶ֤לֶךְ שׁוֹפֵ֣ט בֶּאֱמֶ֣ת דַּלִּ֑ים כִּ֝סְא֗וֹ לָעַ֥ד יִכּֽוֹן׃
Translated:
A king who judges the wretched honestly,
His throne will be established forever.
Transliteration: melekhe shvofet veemet daliym khisevo laad yikhvon

Hebrew: שֵׁ֣בֶט וְ֭תוֹכַחַת יִתֵּ֣ן חׇכְמָ֑ה וְנַ֥עַר מְ֝שֻׁלָּ֗ח מֵבִ֥ישׁ אִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Rod and reproof produce wisdom,
But a lad out of control is a disgrace to his mother.
Transliteration: shevet vetvokhachat yiten chׇkhemah venaar meshulach meviysh imvo

Hebrew: בִּרְב֣וֹת רְ֭שָׁעִים יִרְבֶּה־פָּ֑שַׁע וְ֝צַדִּיקִ֗ים בְּֽמַפַּלְתָּ֥ם יִרְאֽוּ׃
Translated:
When the wicked increase, offenses increase,
But the righteous will see their downfall.
Transliteration: virevvot reshaiym yireveh-fasha vetsadiykiym vemafaletam yireu

Hebrew: יַסֵּ֣ר בִּ֭נְךָ וִינִיחֶ֑ךָ וְיִתֵּ֖ן מַעֲדַנִּ֣ים לְנַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Discipline your son and he will give you peace;
He will gratify you with dainties.
Transliteration: yaser vinekha viyniychekha veyiten maadaniym lenafeshekha {f}

Hebrew: בְּאֵ֣ין חָ֭זוֹן יִפָּ֣רַֽע עָ֑ם וְשֹׁמֵ֖ר תּוֹרָ֣ה אַשְׁרֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
For lack of vision a people lose restraint,
But happy is he who heeds instruction.
Transliteration: veeyn chazvon yifara am veshomer tvorah asherehu

Hebrew: בִּ֭דְבָרִים לֹא־יִוָּ֣סֶר עָ֑בֶד כִּי־יָ֝בִ֗ין וְאֵ֣ין מַעֲנֶֽה׃
Translated:
A slave cannot be disciplined by words;
Though he may comprehend, he does not respond.
Transliteration: videvariym lo-yivaser aved khiy-yaviyn veeyn maaneh

Hebrew: חָזִ֗יתָ אִ֭ישׁ אָ֣ץ בִּדְבָרָ֑יו תִּקְוָ֖ה לִכְסִ֣יל מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
If you see a man hasty in speech,
There is more hope for a fool than for him.
Transliteration: chaziyta iysh ats videvarayv tikevah likhesiyl mimenu

Hebrew: מְפַנֵּ֣ק מִנֹּ֣עַר עַבְדּ֑וֹ וְ֝אַחֲרִית֗וֹ יִהְיֶ֥ה מָנֽוֹן׃
Translated:
A slave pampered from youth
Will come to a bad end.
Transliteration: mefanek minoar avedvo veachariytvo yiheyeh manvon

Hebrew: אִֽישׁ־אַ֭ף יְגָרֶ֣ה מָד֑וֹן וּבַ֖עַל חֵמָ֣ה רַב־פָּֽשַׁע׃
Translated:
An angry man provokes a quarrel;
A hot-tempered man commits many offenses.
Transliteration: iysh-af yegareh madvon uvaal chemah rav-fasha

Hebrew: גַּאֲוַ֣ת אָ֭דָם תַּשְׁפִּילֶ֑נּוּ וּשְׁפַל־ר֝֗וּחַ יִתְמֹ֥ךְ כָּבֽוֹד׃
Translated:
A man’s pride will humiliate him,
But a humble man will obtain honor.
Transliteration: gaavat adam tashefiylenu ushefal-ruucha yitemokhe khavvod

Hebrew: חוֹלֵ֣ק עִם־גַּ֭נָּב שׂוֹנֵ֣א נַפְשׁ֑וֹ אָלָ֥ה יִ֝שְׁמַ֗ע וְלֹ֣א יַגִּֽיד׃
Translated:
He who shares with a thief is his own enemy;
He hears the imprecation and does not tell.
Transliteration: chvolek im-ganav shvone nafeshvo alah yishema velo yagiyd

Hebrew: חֶרְדַּ֣ת אָ֭דָם יִתֵּ֣ן מוֹקֵ֑שׁ וּבוֹטֵ֖חַ בַּיהֹוָ֣ה יְשֻׂגָּֽב׃
Translated:
A man’s fears become a trap for him,
But he who trusts in the LORD shall be safeguarded.
Transliteration: cheredat adam yiten mvokesh uvvotecha vayhovah yeshugav

Hebrew: רַ֭בִּים מְבַקְשִׁ֣ים פְּנֵֽי־מוֹשֵׁ֑ל וּ֝מֵיְהֹוָ֗ה מִשְׁפַּט־אִֽישׁ׃
Translated:
Many seek audience with a ruler,
But it is from the LORD that a man gets justice.
Transliteration: raviym mevakeshiym feney-mvoshel umeyehovah mishefat-iysh

Hebrew: תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת צַ֭דִּיקִים אִ֣ישׁ עָ֑וֶל וְתוֹעֲבַ֖ת רָשָׁ֣ע יְשַׁר־דָּֽרֶךְ׃ {פ}
Translated:
The unjust man is an abomination to the righteous,
And he whose way is straight is an abomination to the wicked.
Transliteration: tvoavat tsadiykiym iysh avel vetvoavat rasha yeshar-darekhe {f}

Hebrew: דִּבְרֵ֤י ׀ אָג֥וּר בִּן־יָקֶ֗ה הַמַּ֫שָּׂ֥א נְאֻ֣ם הַ֭גֶּבֶר לְאִיתִיאֵ֑ל לְאִ֖יתִיאֵ֣ל וְאֻכָֽל׃
Translated: The words of Agur son of Jakeh, [man of] Massa; The speech of the man to Ithiel, to Ithiel and Ucal:
Transliteration: diverey agur vin-yakeh hamasha neum hagever leiytiyel leiytiyel veukhal

Hebrew: כִּ֤י בַ֣עַר אָנֹכִ֣י מֵאִ֑ישׁ וְלֹֽא־בִינַ֖ת אָדָ֣ם לִֽי׃
Translated:
I am brutish, less than a man;
I lack common sense.
Transliteration: khiy vaar anokhiy meiysh velo-viynat adam liy

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־לָמַ֥דְתִּי חׇכְמָ֑ה וְדַ֖עַת קְדֹשִׁ֣ים אֵדָֽע׃
Translated:
I have not learned wisdom,
Nor do I possess knowledge of the Holy One.
Transliteration: velo-lamadetiy chׇkhemah vedaat kedoshiym eda

Hebrew: מִ֤י עָלָֽה־שָׁמַ֨יִם ׀ וַיֵּרַ֡ד מִ֤י אָֽסַף־ר֨וּחַ ׀ בְּחׇפְנָ֡יו מִ֤י צָֽרַר־מַ֨יִם ׀ בַּשִּׂמְלָ֗ה מִ֭י הֵקִ֣ים כׇּל־אַפְסֵי־אָ֑רֶץ מַה־שְּׁמ֥וֹ וּמַֽה־שֶּׁם־בְּ֝נ֗וֹ כִּ֣י תֵדָֽע׃
Translated:
Who has ascended heaven and come down?
Who has gathered up the wind in the hollow of his hand?
Who has wrapped the waters in his garment?
Who has established all the extremities of the earth?
What is his name or his son’s name, if you know it?
Transliteration: miy alah-shamayiim vayerad miy asaf-rucha vechׇfenayv miy tsarar-mayiim vashimelah miy hekiym khׇl-afesey-arets mah-shemvo umah-shem-venvo khiy teda

Hebrew: כׇּל־אִמְרַ֣ת אֱל֣וֹהַּ צְרוּפָ֑ה מָגֵ֥ן ה֝֗וּא לַחֹסִ֥ים בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Every word of God is pure,
A shield to those who take refuge in Him.
Transliteration: khׇl-imerat elvoha tserufah magen huu lachosiym vvo

Hebrew: אַל־תּ֥וֹסְףְּ עַל־דְּבָרָ֑יו פֶּן־יוֹכִ֖יחַ בְּךָ֣ וְנִכְזָֽבְתָּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Do not add to His words,
Lest He indict you and you be proved a liar.
Transliteration: al-tvosefe al-devarayv fen-yvokhiycha vekha venikhezaveta {f}

Hebrew: שְׁ֭תַּיִם שָׁאַ֣לְתִּי מֵאִתָּ֑ךְ אַל־תִּמְנַ֥ע מִ֝מֶּ֗נִּי בְּטֶ֣רֶם אָמֽוּת׃
Translated: Two things I ask of You; do not deny them to me before I die:
Transliteration: shetayim shaaletiy meitakhe al-timena mimeniy veterem amut

Hebrew: שָׁ֤וְא ׀ וּֽדְבַר־כָּזָ֡ב הַרְחֵ֬ק מִמֶּ֗נִּי רֵ֣אשׁ וָ֭עֹשֶׁר אַל־תִּֽתֶּן־לִ֑י הַ֝טְרִיפֵ֗נִי לֶ֣חֶם חֻקִּֽי׃
Translated:
Keep lies and false words far from me;
Give me neither poverty nor riches,
But provide me with my daily bread,
Transliteration: shave udevar-khazav harechek mimeniy resh vaosher al-titen-liy hateriyfeniy lechem chukiy

Hebrew: פֶּ֥ן־אֶשְׂבַּ֨ע ׀ וְכִחַשְׁתִּי֮ וְאָמַ֗רְתִּי מִ֥י־יְ֫הֹוָ֥ה וּפֶֽן־אִוָּרֵ֥שׁ וְגָנַ֑בְתִּי וְ֝תָפַ֗שְׂתִּי שֵׁ֣ם אֱלֹהָֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
Lest, being sated, I renounce, saying,
“Who is the LORD?”
Or, being impoverished, I take to theft
And profane the name of my God.
Transliteration: fen-esheva vekhichashetiy veamaretiy miy-yehovah ufen-ivaresh veganavetiy vetafashetiy shem elohay {f}

Hebrew: אַל־תַּלְשֵׁ֣ן עֶ֭בֶד אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֑ו פֶּֽן־יְקַלֶּלְךָ֥ וְאָשָֽׁמְתָּ׃
Translated:
Do not inform on a slave to his master,
Lest he curse you and you incur guilt.
Transliteration: al-taleshen eved el-adonav fen-yekalelekha veashameta

Hebrew: דּ֭וֹר אָבִ֣יו יְקַלֵּ֑ל וְאֶת־אִ֝מּ֗וֹ לֹ֣א יְבָרֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
There is a breed of men that brings a curse on its fathers
And brings no blessing to its mothers,
Transliteration: dvor aviyv yekalel veet-imvo lo yevarekhe

Hebrew: דּ֭וֹר טָה֣וֹר בְּעֵינָ֑יו וּ֝מִצֹּאָת֗וֹ לֹ֣א רֻחָֽץ׃
Translated:
A breed that thinks itself pure,
Though it is not washed of its filth;
Transliteration: dvor tahvor veeynayv umitsoatvo lo ruchats

Hebrew: דּ֭וֹר מָה־רָמ֣וּ עֵינָ֑יו וְ֝עַפְעַפָּ֗יו יִנָּשֵֽׂאוּ׃
Translated: A breed so haughty of bearing, so supercilious;
Transliteration: dvor mah-ramu eynayv veafeafayv yinasheu

Hebrew: דּ֤וֹר ׀ חֲרָב֣וֹת שִׁנָּיו֮ וּֽמַאֲכָל֢וֹת מְֽתַלְּעֹ֫תָ֥יו לֶאֱכֹ֣ל עֲנִיִּ֣ים מֵאֶ֑רֶץ וְ֝אֶבְיוֹנִ֗ים מֵאָדָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
A breed whose teeth are swords,
Whose jaws are knives,
Ready to devour the poor of the land,
The needy among men.
Transliteration: dvor charavvot shinayv umaakhal֢vot metaleotayv leekhol aniyiym meerets veeveyvoniym meadam {f}

Hebrew: לַ֥עֲלוּקָ֨ה ׀ שְׁתֵּ֥י בָנוֹת֮ הַ֤ב ׀ הַ֥֫ב שָׁל֣וֹשׁ הֵ֭נָּה לֹ֣א תִשְׂבַּ֑עְנָה אַ֝רְבַּ֗ע לֹא־אָ֥מְרוּ הֽוֹן׃
Translated:
The leech has two daughters, “Give!” and “Give!”
Three things are insatiable;
Four never say, “Enough!”:
Transliteration: laalukah shetey vanvot hav hav shalvosh henah lo tishevaenah areva lo-ameru hvon

Hebrew: שְׁאוֹל֮ וְעֹ֢צֶ֫ר רָ֥חַם אֶ֭רֶץ לֹא־שָׂ֣בְעָה מַּ֑יִם וְ֝אֵ֗שׁ לֹא־אָ֥מְרָה הֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Sheol, a barren womb,
Earth that cannot get enough water,
And fire which never says, “Enough!”
Transliteration: shevol veo֢tser racham erets lo-shaveah mayiim veesh lo-amerah hvon

Hebrew: עַ֤יִן ׀ תִּ֥לְעַ֣ג לְאָב֮ וְתָבֻ֢ז לִֽיקְּהַ֫ת־אֵ֥ם יִקְּר֥וּהָ עֹֽרְבֵי־נַ֑חַל וְֽיֹאכְל֥וּהָ בְנֵי־נָֽשֶׁר׃ {פ}
Translated:
The eye that mocks a father
And disdains the homage due a mother—
The ravens of the brook will gouge it out,
Young eagles will devour it.
Transliteration: ayiin tileag leav vetavu֢z liykehat-em yikeruha orevey-nachal veyokheluha veney-nasher {f}

Hebrew: שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה הֵ֭מָּה נִפְלְא֣וּ מִמֶּ֑נִּי (וארבע) [וְ֝אַרְבָּעָ֗ה] לֹ֣א יְדַעְתִּֽים׃
Translated:
Three things are beyond me;
Four I cannot fathom:
Transliteration: sheloshah hemah nifeleu mimeniy (vrv) [vearevaah] lo yedaetiym

Hebrew: דֶּ֤רֶךְ הַנֶּ֨שֶׁר ׀ בַּשָּׁמַיִם֮ דֶּ֥רֶךְ נָחָ֗שׁ עֲלֵ֫י־צ֥וּר דֶּרֶךְ־אֳנִיָּ֥ה בְלֶב־יָ֑ם וְדֶ֖רֶךְ גֶּ֣בֶר בְּעַלְמָֽה׃
Translated:
How an eagle makes its way over the sky;
How a snake makes its way over a rock;
How a ship makes its way through the high seas;
How a man has his way with a maiden.
Transliteration: derekhe hanesher vashamayim derekhe nachash aley-tsur derekhe-oniyah velev-yam vederekhe gever vealemah

Hebrew: כֵּ֤ן ׀ דֶּ֥רֶךְ אִשָּׁ֗ה מְנָ֫אָ֥פֶת אָ֭כְלָה וּמָ֣חֲתָה פִ֑יהָ וְ֝אָמְרָ֗ה לֹא־פָעַ֥לְתִּי אָֽוֶן׃ {פ}
Translated:
Such is the way of an adulteress:
She eats, wipes her mouth,
And says, “I have done no wrong.”
Transliteration: khen derekhe ishah menaafet akhelah umachatah fiyha veamerah lo-faaletiy aven {f}

Hebrew: תַּ֣חַת שָׁ֭לוֹשׁ רָ֣גְזָה אֶ֑רֶץ וְתַ֥חַת אַ֝רְבַּ֗ע לֹא־תוּכַ֥ל שְׂאֵֽת׃
Translated:
The earth shudders at three things,
At four which it cannot bear:
Transliteration: tachat shalvosh ragezah erets vetachat areva lo-tukhal sheet

Hebrew: תַּֽחַת־עֶ֭בֶד כִּ֣י יִמְל֑וֹךְ וְ֝נָבָ֗ל כִּ֣י יִֽשְׂבַּֽע־לָֽחֶם׃
Translated:
A slave who becomes king;
A scoundrel sated with food;
Transliteration: tachat-eved khiy yimelvokhe venaval khiy yisheva-lachem

Hebrew: תַּ֣חַת שְׂ֭נוּאָה כִּ֣י תִבָּעֵ֑ל וְ֝שִׁפְחָ֗ה כִּֽי־תִירַ֥שׁ גְּבִרְתָּֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
A loathsome woman who gets married;
A slave-girl who supplants her mistress.
Transliteration: tachat shenuah khiy tivael veshifechah khiy-tiyrash geviretah {f}

Hebrew: אַרְבָּ֣עָה הֵ֭ם קְטַנֵּי־אָ֑רֶץ וְ֝הֵ֗מָּה חֲכָמִ֥ים מְחֻכָּמִֽים׃
Translated:
Four are among the tiniest on earth,
Yet they are the wisest of the wise:
Transliteration: arevaah hem ketaney-arets vehemah chakhamiym mechukhamiym

Hebrew: הַ֭נְּמָלִים עַ֣ם לֹא־עָ֑ז וַיָּכִ֖ינוּ בַקַּ֣יִץ לַחְמָֽם׃
Translated:
Ants are a folk without power,
Yet they prepare food for themselves in summer;
Transliteration: hanemaliym am lo-az vayakhiynu vakayiits lachemam

Hebrew: שְׁ֭פַנִּים עַ֣ם לֹא־עָצ֑וּם וַיָּשִׂ֖ימוּ בַסֶּ֣לַע בֵּיתָֽם׃
Translated:
The badger is a folk without strength,
Yet it makes its home in the rock;
Transliteration: shefaniym am lo-atsum vayashiymu vasela veytam

Hebrew: מֶ֭לֶךְ אֵ֣ין לָאַרְבֶּ֑ה וַיֵּצֵ֖א חֹצֵ֣ץ כֻּלּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The locusts have no king,
Yet they all march forth in formation;
Transliteration: melekhe eyn laareveh vayetse chotsets khulvo

Hebrew: שְׂ֭מָמִית בְּיָדַ֣יִם תְּתַפֵּ֑שׂ וְ֝הִ֗יא בְּהֵ֣יכְלֵי מֶֽלֶךְ׃ {פ}
Translated:
You can catch the lizard in your hand,
Yet it is found in royal palaces.
Transliteration: shemamiyt veyadayiim tetafesh vehiy veheykheley melekhe {f}

Hebrew: שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה הֵ֭מָּה מֵיטִ֣יבֵי צָ֑עַד וְ֝אַרְבָּעָ֗ה מֵיטִ֥בֵי לָֽכֶת׃
Translated:
There are three that are stately of stride,
Four that carry themselves well:
Transliteration: sheloshah hemah meytiyvey tsaad vearevaah meytivey lakhet

Hebrew: לַ֭יִשׁ גִּבּ֣וֹר בַּבְּהֵמָ֑ה וְלֹא־יָ֝שׁ֗וּב מִפְּנֵי־כֹֽל׃
Translated:
The lion is mightiest among the beasts,
And recoils before none;
Transliteration: layiish givvor vavehemah velo-yashuv mifeney-khol

Hebrew: זַרְזִ֣יר מׇתְנַ֣יִם אוֹ־תָ֑יִשׁ וּ֝מֶ֗לֶךְ אַלְק֥וּם עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The greyhound, the he-goat,
The king whom none dares resist.
Transliteration: zareziyr mׇtenayiim vo-tayiish umelekhe alekum imvo

Hebrew: אִם־נָבַ֥לְתָּ בְהִתְנַשֵּׂ֑א וְאִם־זַ֝מּ֗וֹתָ יָ֣ד לְפֶֽה׃
Translated:
If you have been scandalously arrogant,
If you have been a schemer,
Then clap your hand to your mouth.
Transliteration: im-navaleta vehitenashe veim-zamvota yad lefeh

Hebrew: כִּ֤י מִ֪יץ חָלָ֡ב י֘וֹצִ֤יא חֶמְאָ֗ה וּֽמִיץ־אַ֭ף י֣וֹצִיא דָ֑ם וּמִ֥יץ אַ֝פַּ֗יִם י֣וֹצִיא רִֽיב׃ {פ}
Translated:
As milk under pressure produces butter,
And a nose under pressure produces blood,
So patience under pressure produces strife.
Transliteration: khiy miyts chalav yvotsiy chemeah umiyts-af yvotsiy dam umiyts afayiim yvotsiy riyv {f}

Hebrew: דִּ֭בְרֵי לְמוּאֵ֣ל מֶ֑לֶךְ מַ֝שָּׂ֗א אֲֽשֶׁר־יִסְּרַ֥תּוּ אִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: The words of Lemuel, king of Massa, with which his mother admonished him:
Transliteration: diverey lemuel melekhe masha asher-yiseratu imvo

Hebrew: מַה־בְּ֭רִי וּמַֽה־בַּר־בִּטְנִ֑י וּ֝מֶ֗ה בַּר־נְדָרָֽי׃
Translated:
No, my son!
No, O son of my womb!
No, O son of my vows!
Transliteration: mah-veriy umah-var-viteniy umeh var-nedaray

Hebrew: אַל־תִּתֵּ֣ן לַנָּשִׁ֣ים חֵילֶ֑ךָ וּ֝דְרָכֶ֗יךָ לַֽמְח֥וֹת מְלָכִֽין׃
Translated:
Do not give your strength to women,
Your vigor, to those who destroy kings.
Transliteration: al-titen lanashiym cheylekha uderakheykha lamechvot melakhiyn

Hebrew: אַ֤ל לַֽמְלָכִ֨ים ׀ לְֽמוֹאֵ֗ל אַ֣ל לַֽמְלָכִ֣ים שְׁתוֹ־יָ֑יִן וּ֝לְרוֹזְנִ֗ים (או) [אֵ֣י] שֵׁכָֽר׃
Translated:
Wine is not for kings, O Lemuel;
Not for kings to drink,
Nor any strong drink for princes,
Transliteration: al lamelakhiym lemvoel al lamelakhiym shetvo-yayiin ulervozeniym (v) [ey] shekhar

Hebrew: פֶּן־יִ֭שְׁתֶּה וְיִשְׁכַּ֣ח מְחֻקָּ֑ק וִ֝ישַׁנֶּ֗ה דִּ֣ין כׇּל־בְּנֵי־עֹֽנִי׃
Translated:
Lest they drink and forget what has been ordained,
And infringe on the rights of the poor.
Transliteration: fen-yisheteh veyishekhach mechukak viyshaneh diyn khׇl-veney-oniy

Hebrew: תְּנוּ־שֵׁכָ֥ר לְאוֹבֵ֑ד וְ֝יַ֗יִן לְמָ֣רֵי נָֽפֶשׁ׃
Translated:
Give strong drink to the hapless
And wine to the embittered.
Transliteration: tenu-shekhar levoved veyayiin lemarey nafesh

Hebrew: יִ֭שְׁתֶּה וְיִשְׁכַּ֣ח רִישׁ֑וֹ וַ֝עֲמָל֗וֹ לֹ֣א יִזְכׇּר־עֽוֹד׃ {פ}
Translated:
Let them drink and forget their poverty,
And put their troubles out of mind.
Transliteration: yisheteh veyishekhach riyshvo vaamalvo lo yizekhׇr-vod {f}

Hebrew: פְּתַח־פִּ֥יךָ לְאִלֵּ֑ם אֶל־דִּ֝֗ין כׇּל־בְּנֵ֥י חֲלֽוֹף׃
Translated:
Speak up for the dumb,
For the rights of all the unfortunate.
Transliteration: fetach-fiykha leilem el-diyn khׇl-veney chalvof

Hebrew: פְּתַח־פִּ֥יךָ שְׁפׇט־צֶ֑דֶק וְ֝דִ֗ין עָנִ֥י וְאֶבְיֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated:
Speak up, judge righteously,
Champion the poor and the needy.
Transliteration: fetach-fiykha shefׇt-tsedek vediyn aniy veeveyvon {f}

Hebrew: אֵֽשֶׁת־חַ֭יִל מִ֣י יִמְצָ֑א וְרָחֹ֖ק מִפְּנִינִ֣ים מִכְרָֽהּ׃
Translated:
What a rare find is a capable wife!
Her worth is far beyond that of rubies.
Transliteration: eshet-chayiil miy yimetsa verachok mifeniyniym mikherah

Hebrew: בָּ֣טַח בָּ֭הּ לֵ֣ב בַּעְלָ֑הּ וְ֝שָׁלָ֗ל לֹ֣א יֶחְסָֽר׃
Translated:
Her husband puts his confidence in her,
And lacks no good thing.
Transliteration: vatach vah lev vaelah veshalal lo yechesar

Hebrew: גְּמָלַ֣תְהוּ ט֣וֹב וְלֹא־רָ֑ע כֹּ֝֗ל יְמֵ֣י חַיֶּֽיהָ׃
Translated:
She is good to him, never bad,
All the days of her life.
Transliteration: gemalatehu tvov velo-ra khol yemey chayeyha

Hebrew: דָּ֭רְשָׁה צֶ֣מֶר וּפִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַ֝תַּ֗עַשׂ בְּחֵ֣פֶץ כַּפֶּֽיהָ׃
Translated:
She looks for wool and flax,
And sets her hand to them with a will.
Transliteration: dareshah tsemer ufishetiym vataash vechefets khafeyha

Hebrew: הָ֭יְתָה כׇּאֳנִיּ֣וֹת סוֹחֵ֑ר מִ֝מֶּרְחָ֗ק תָּבִ֥יא לַחְמָֽהּ׃
Translated:
She is like a merchant fleet,
Bringing her food from afar.
Transliteration: hayetah khׇoniyyvot svocher mimerechak taviy lachemah

Hebrew: וַתָּ֤קׇם ׀ בְּע֬וֹד לַ֗יְלָה וַתִּתֵּ֣ן טֶ֣רֶף לְבֵיתָ֑הּ וְ֝חֹ֗ק לְנַעֲרֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
She rises while it is still night,
And supplies provisions for her household,
The daily fare of her maids.
Transliteration: vatakׇm vevod layelah vatiten teref leveytah vechok lenaaroteyha

Hebrew: זָמְמָ֣ה שָׂ֭דֶה וַתִּקָּחֵ֑הוּ מִפְּרִ֥י כַ֝פֶּ֗יהָ (נטע) [נָ֣טְעָה] כָּֽרֶם׃
Translated:
She sets her mind on an estate and acquires it;
She plants a vineyard by her own labors.
Transliteration: zamemah shadeh vatikachehu miferiy khafeyha (nt) [nateah] kharem

Hebrew: חָֽגְרָ֣ה בְע֣וֹז מׇתְנֶ֑יהָ וַ֝תְּאַמֵּ֗ץ זְרוֹעֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
She girds herself with strength,
And performs her tasks with vigor.
Transliteration: chagerah vevoz mׇteneyha vateamets zervooteyha

Hebrew: טָ֭עֲמָה כִּי־ט֣וֹב סַחְרָ֑הּ לֹא־יִכְבֶּ֖ה (בליל) [בַלַּ֣יְלָה] נֵרָֽהּ׃
Translated:
She sees that her business thrives;
Her lamp never goes out at night.
Transliteration: taamah khiy-tvov sacherah lo-yikheveh (vlyl) [valayelah] nerah

Hebrew: יָ֭דֶיהָ שִׁלְּחָ֣ה בַכִּישׁ֑וֹר וְ֝כַפֶּ֗יהָ תָּ֣מְכוּ פָֽלֶךְ׃
Translated:
She sets her hand to the distaff;
Her fingers work the spindle.
Transliteration: yadeyha shilechah vakhiyshvor vekhafeyha tamekhu falekhe

Hebrew: כַּ֭פָּהּ פָּֽרְשָׂ֣ה לֶעָנִ֑י וְ֝יָדֶ֗יהָ שִׁלְּחָ֥ה לָאֶבְיֽוֹן׃
Translated:
She gives generously to the poor;
Her hands are stretched out to the needy.
Transliteration: khafah fareshah leaniy veyadeyha shilechah laeveyvon

Hebrew: לֹא־תִירָ֣א לְבֵיתָ֣הּ מִשָּׁ֑לֶג כִּ֥י כׇל־בֵּ֝יתָ֗הּ לָבֻ֥שׁ שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated:
She is not worried for her household because of snow,
For her whole household is dressed in crimson.
Transliteration: lo-tiyra leveytah mishaleg khiy khׇl-veytah lavush shaniym

Hebrew: מַרְבַדִּ֥ים עָֽשְׂתָה־לָּ֑הּ שֵׁ֖שׁ וְאַרְגָּמָ֣ן לְבוּשָֽׁהּ׃
Translated:
She makes covers for herself;
Her clothing is linen and purple.
Transliteration: marevadiym ashetah-lah shesh vearegaman levushah

Hebrew: נוֹדָ֣ע בַּשְּׁעָרִ֣ים בַּעְלָ֑הּ בְּ֝שִׁבְתּ֗וֹ עִם־זִקְנֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Her husband is prominent in the gates,
As he sits among the elders of the land.
Transliteration: nvoda vasheariym vaelah veshivetvo im-zikeney-arets

Hebrew: סָדִ֣ין עָ֭שְׂתָה וַתִּמְכֹּ֑ר וַ֝חֲג֗וֹר נָתְנָ֥ה לַֽכְּנַעֲנִֽי׃
Translated:
She makes cloth and sells it,
And offers a girdle to the merchant.
Transliteration: sadiyn ashetah vatimekhor vachagvor natenah lakhenaaniy

Hebrew: עֹז־וְהָדָ֥ר לְבוּשָׁ֑הּ וַ֝תִּשְׂחַ֗ק לְי֣וֹם אַחֲרֽוֹן׃
Translated:
She is clothed with strength and splendor;
She looks to the future cheerfully.
Transliteration: oz-vehadar levushah vatishechak leyvom acharvon

Hebrew: פִּ֭יהָ פָּתְחָ֣ה בְחׇכְמָ֑ה וְת֥וֹרַת חֶ֝֗סֶד עַל־לְשׁוֹנָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Her mouth is full of wisdom,
Her tongue with kindly teaching.
Transliteration: fiyha fatechah vechׇkhemah vetvorat chesed al-leshvonah

Hebrew: צ֭וֹפִיָּה (הילכות) [הֲלִיכ֣וֹת] בֵּיתָ֑הּ וְלֶ֥חֶם עַ֝צְל֗וּת לֹ֣א תֹאכֵֽל׃
Translated:
She oversees the activities of her household
And never eats the bread of idleness.
Transliteration: tsvofiyah (hylkhvt) [haliykhvot] veytah velechem atselut lo tokhel

Hebrew: קָ֣מוּ בָ֭נֶיהָ וַֽיְאַשְּׁר֑וּהָ בַּ֝עְלָ֗הּ וַֽיְהַלְלָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Her children declare her happy;
Her husband praises her,
Transliteration: kamu vaneyha vayeasheruha vaelah vayehalelah

Hebrew: רַבּ֣וֹת בָּ֭נוֹת עָ֣שׂוּ חָ֑יִל וְ֝אַ֗תְּ עָלִ֥ית עַל־כֻּלָּֽנָה׃
Translated:
“Many women have done well,
But you surpass them all.”
Transliteration: ravvot vanvot ashu chayiil veate aliyt al-khulanah

Hebrew: שֶׁ֣קֶר הַ֭חֵן וְהֶ֣בֶל הַיֹּ֑פִי אִשָּׁ֥ה יִרְאַת־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה הִ֣יא תִתְהַלָּֽל׃
Translated:
Grace is deceptive,
Beauty is illusory;
It is for her fear of the LORD
That a woman is to be praised.
Transliteration: sheker hachen vehevel hayofiy ishah yireat-yehovah hiy titehalal

Hebrew: תְּנוּ־לָ֭הּ מִפְּרִ֣י יָדֶ֑יהָ וִיהַלְל֖וּהָ בַשְּׁעָרִ֣ים מַֽעֲשֶֽׂיהָ׃
Translated:
Extol her for the fruit of her hand,
And let her works praise her in the gates.
Transliteration: tenu-lah miferiy yadeyha viyhaleluha vasheariym maasheyha
